campaigns, and even develop consumer products.</li> \n <li>Please&nbsp;submit your ideas by December 10 and email <a href=\"mailto:aperelli@businessinsider.com\" data-uri=\"98017caaffd93628e1217254a790380a\"></a>\n<p>As the creator industry grows, so does the demand for managers to help influencers build on their success.&nbsp;</p>\n<p>With the help of a manager, many influencers expand their digital businesses by selling consumer products or securing lucrative brand partnerships.&nbsp;</p>\n<p>With multichannel networks (or MCNs) that once dominated the YouTube talent space experiencing a decline and <a href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2019/1/29/18202131/matpat-defy-media-youtube-ally-bank-ryland-adams-multi-channel-network\">shutting down,</a> the industry is shifting toward firms with a small-scale roster of clients.&nbsp;</p>\n<p>These new power players have developed expertise in the many facets of the influencer world, like negotiating deals, advising clients <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/brands-product-sponsorships-youtube-influencers-reject-manager-2019-7\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"20\" data-uri=\"c50ed318a3fc31448989136f7a7c61ab\">against promoting products</a> that could damage their careers, and helping operate companies and selling <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/top-ways-youtube-influencers-creators-make-money-2019-7\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"20\" data-uri=\"cde50a6836dd7c706c8835267da1a631\">direct-to-consumer products</a>.&nbsp;</p>\n<p>But who are the other top players in 2020?</p>\n<p>We are seeking nominations of the leading people who manage YouTube creators for Business Insider's <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/top-talent-managers-of-youtube-creators-influencers-power-list-2019-10\">second annual list</a> of the top YouTube talent managers.</p>\n<p>The ranking will factor in the manager's role, responsibilities, and impact on their clients and the YouTube and influencer space broadly.</p>\n<p>Please submit your ideas <a href=\"https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSf2dGLxD1DBvHxyebWm9WyQRC0-jqxgazHGkjXKys7Dd2iQdg/viewform?usp=sf_link\">through this form</a>&nbsp;by December 10, or enter the information 10:48:29","updatedTime":"2020-12-03 10:48:29","title":"I tried Firstleaf, a subscription box that delivers wines from top vineyards around the world — here's how it works","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/firstleaf-wine-club-review","description":"<p class=\"financial-disclaimer\"><i>When you buy through our links, we may earn money from our affiliate partners. <a href=\"https://www.insider-inc.com/commerce-on-insider-inc/\">Learn more.</a></i></p><p><a href=\"http://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/3861930/type/dlg/https://www.firstleaf.club/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow sponsored\"><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e5d3484fee23d28d22e29db?format=jpeg\" alt=\"firstleaf wine club update\" height=\"600\" width=\"800\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Firstleaf&#39;s introductory box of six wines is only $40 and then the price goes up to about $90 for all future shipments.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Firstleaf/Instagram</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></a></p><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li><strong><a href=\"http://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/3861930/type/dlg/https://www.firstleaf.club/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored\">Firstleaf</a> is one of <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-wine-club\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">many other wine clubs</a>, but it's unique in that you can rate the wines after testing to help its algorithm find more wines based on your preferences.</strong></li><li><strong>Its introductory box of six wines is only $40 and then goes up to about $90 for all future shipments, and sets the wheels in motion for the service to learn more about your tastes and preferences as they evolve.&#160;</strong></li><li><strong>The wines all come from award-winning winemakers and vineyards, but you have the final say about which ones are considered true award winners in your book through Firstleaf's rating and review system.&#160;</strong></li><li><strong>See more: <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-wine-club\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">The best wine subscriptions</a></strong></li><li><strong><a href=\"https://newsletter.businessinsider.com/join/4np/insider-picks\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" data-stringify-link=\"https://newsletter.businessinsider.com/join/4np/insider-picks\" data-sk=\"tooltip_parent\">Sign up for Insider Reviews' weekly newsletter for more buying advice and great deals.</a></strong></li></ul><p><em>This content is intended for readers 21+. Please drink responsibly. If you or anyone you know is dealing with alcohol abuse, get help.&#160;The&#160;</em><a href=\"https://www.samhsa.gov/find-help/national-helpline\"><em>Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration's National Helpline</em></a><em> at 1-800-662-HELP (4357)&#160;provides&#160;a free, confidential, 24/7, treatment referral, and information service.</em></p><div id=\"ProductCard_5db1bd0edee01914e4330f05\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5db1bd0edee01914e4330f05&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><p>Based on the number of <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-wine-club\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">wine clubs and subscription services</a> that have started in the past few years, the jig is clearly up. People like wine, but most of us don't know what we're talking about or what we're actually sipping. It's easier when someone just tells us what's good.</p><p><a href=\"http://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/3861930/type/dlg/https://www.firstleaf.club/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">Firstleaf</a> is an algorithm-based wine subscription service that learns more about your tastes and preferences as you try different wines and curates a personalized experience for you over time.&#160;</p><h2>How Firstleaf works</h2><p>As with <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/vinebox-wine-club-review-2018-2\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">most personalized services</a>, you start off by taking a short online quiz, which asks about your white vs. red vs. rosé vs. sparkling preferences, what region you prefer your wine to come from, and how much wine you drink per month. The quiz also includes food tastes and dislikes to further understand your palate.&#160;</p><p>You'll immediately get a recommendation of six wines. For newcomers, Firstleaf gives an introductory offer of these six wines for only $40, plus tax.&#160;</p><p>This welcome-to-the-club offer also serves as a kind of diagnostic test (that's infinitely more fun than the SAT one you took in high school) for the rest of your <a href=\"http://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/3861930/type/dlg/https://www.firstleaf.club/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">Firstleaf</a> experience. If you decide to continue the subscription, it costs around $90 for six wines including shipping, which comes out to $15 a bottle.&#160;</p><h2>Review of Firstleaf</h2><p><a href=\"http://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/3861930/type/dlg/https://www.firstleaf.club/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\"><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5b578d6b3b49fc2a008b469c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"my firstleaf box\" height=\"550\" width=\"800\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The wines I received when I tried Firstleaf for myself.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Connie Chen/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></a></p><p>At the time of my initial review, Firstleaf had a three for $15 deal (which, unfortunately, is no longer available), so I took advantage of that offer.</p><p>Three full-sized bottles of red and white wine were securely packed in a cardboard crate and each came with its own informational card explaining the origins of the wine and region, tasting notes, and food pairings. All this information can also be found online when you log in to your account and click on your past orders.&#160;</p><p>My first box included a Chardonnay from Paso Robles, a Malbec from Mendoza, Argentina, and a Zinfandel from Sonoma County. All were international wine competition winners, but despite their prestige, I didn't love them all, which was completely fine and not unexpected. I would have the opportunity to rate the picks and explain my specific thoughts later on.&#160;</p><p><a href=\"http://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/3861930/type/dlg/https://www.firstleaf.club/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\"><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5b577ed97d4dc732008b463d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"firstleaf rate wines\" height=\"600\" width=\"800\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>You&#39;ll rate each wine you taste so Firstleaf&#39;s algorithm can get a better idea of your preferences and provide better wine recommendations.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Firstleaf</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></a></p><p>Once you log back into your account, you can give each wine a \"Thumbs Up\" (I'd drink this wine again and <a href=\"http://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/3861930/type/dlg/https://www.firstleaf.club/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Firstleaf</a> will send more like it), a \"Thumbs Down\" (not for me), or leave the thumb icons blank if you have no opinion and don't feel strongly either way. There is a section below each wine where you can write additional comments and notes for <a href=\"http://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/3861930/type/dlg/https://www.firstleaf.club/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">Firstleaf</a> or just for personal reference. You can also reorder six bottles of the wine you loved for $90.</p><p>After this initial box, every future shipment will consist of six different wines curated around your preferences for $90 including shipping and be delivered automatically every one, two, or three months. However, you can choose any other delivery date or cancel your subscription at any time.&#160;</p><p>By design, <a href=\"http://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/3861930/type/dlg/https://www.firstleaf.club/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">Firstleaf</a> works better the longer you use it. The more wines you rate, the better its system can match future shipments to your taste and adjust picks if your tastes evolve from the initial quiz.&#160;</p><h2>The bottom line</h2><p>Using <a href=\"http://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/3861930/type/dlg/https://www.firstleaf.club/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">Firstleaf</a> isn't only about convenience, education, or personalization, though these are all strong reasons why you should try it. With each bottle coming out to about $7 in the intro offer and $15 for future ones, it's also a much more affordable way to enjoy quality wines from top vineyards around the world.&#160;</p><h3><a href=\"http://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/3861930/type/dlg/https://www.firstleaf.club/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">Take Firstleaf's wine quiz here</a></h3><div Not only are they an adorable addition to the bathroom, but they're dark navy so they conceal makeup grime.&#160;</p>\n\tA gift card to try out some new fitness classes\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f91e363abcd0c0018d692d4?format=jpeg\" alt=\"classpass, $50\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">ClassPass</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><strong><a href=\"https://classpass.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">ClassPass gift card, choose your amount, available at ClassPass</a></strong></h3><p>Boutique workout classes are all the rage (whether by social distance or at home), but there are so many to choose from. Give her the ability to try them all with a ClassPass gift card. You can choose how much you want to give and each amount will correlate with a certain number of credits she can put towards trying new classes.</p>\n</div><div class=\"read-original\">Read the bbde70f644a317bb5?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn56@2020_1/2020/12/03/02-48-59-004_12f0283199045f7e.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f91e5222121130018740446?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn87@2020_6/2020/12/03/02-48-58-336_5c1b1487951fcab3.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f9304c02121130018740769?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn32@2020_4/2020/12/03/02-48-53-220_1a34d5f9e72f8ab6.webp","https://i.insider.com/5fc7c48350e71a00115586b2?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn80@2020_6/2020/12/03/02-48-52-758_67ceab0d5eea99a1.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f930538abcd0c0018d69609?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn19@2020_3/2020/12/03/02-48-55-318_39fc6c6118a95d2a.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f91e7382121130018740461?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn84@2020_5/2020/12/03/02-48-54-744_3bfdf0f9889095e6.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f91de85abcd0c0018d692a2?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn100@2020_3/2020/12/03/02-49-01-728_74cd06c3aa23823a.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f91e14aabcd0c0018d692c2?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn67@2020_5/2020/12/03/02-49-01-404_5d206d2c460a465e.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f9305fc2121130018740774?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn35@2020_2/2020/12/03/02-48-51-363_65bb08b8c7e73624.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f92fe3b212113001874073e?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn56@2020_2/2020/12/03/02-48-50-937_ed924f4aa3e4ea9f.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f92dee1212113001874063b?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn55@2020_2/2020/12/03/02-48-49-923_062310c29e175df9.webp","https://i.insider.com/5c0add85bde70f79372e2b20?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn74@2020_6/2020/12/03/02-48-49-840_a2dbb6fa034a20c6.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f91e363abcd0c0018d692d4?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn40@2020_5/2020/12/03/02-48-59-675_fca5339741231af2.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn3@2020_2/2020/12/03/02-49-00-176_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=_3JlWcMHUpI:N1Ah3g3XSDw:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn40@2020_5/2020/12/03/02-48-57-192_571b88e1855aeefb.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=_3JlWcMHUpI:N1Ah3g3XSDw:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn16@2020_3/2020/12/03/02-49-00-256_f6ca1968cb1423bd.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn99@2020_3/2020/12/03/02-48-56-007_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=_3JlWcMHUpI:N1Ah3g3XSDw:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn47@2020_3/2020/12/03/02-48-58-226_418a8899ccc28608.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/_3JlWcMHUpI":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn81@2020_3/2020/12/03/02-48-48-579_6e8db26f7b1429cf.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1606963710035},{"createdTime":"2020-12-03 10:48:30","updatedTime":"2020-12-03 10:48:30","title":"Why stubbing your toe hurts so much","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/why-stubbing-your-toe-hurts-so-much-2019-3","description":"<div style=\"position:relative; overflow:hidden; padding-bottom:56.25%\">\n<iframe src=\"https://cdn.jwplayer.com/players/AKOQUdNK-jZbcmOYf.html\"\nwidth=\"100%\" height=\"100%\" frameborder=\"0\" scrolling=\"auto\" title=\"Why stubbing your toe hurts so much\"\nstyle=\"position:absolute;\" allowfullscreen></iframe>\n</div><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li><strong>Stubbing your toe <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/why-we-think-pain-feels-good-2018-4\">hurts so much</a> because you're slamming a tiny surface with a force equal to 2-3 times your bodyweight. </strong></li>\n<li><strong>Then a bundle of nerve endings called nociceptors fire a danger signal to your <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/category/brain\">brain</a>.</strong></li>\n<li><strong>Although it's not pleasant, this <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/category/pain\">pain</a> might have helped your ancestors step carefully and avoid injury and infection.</strong></li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p><em>Following is a transcript of the video.</em></p><p><strong>Narrator: </strong>Stubbing your toe hurts. It's right up there with paper cuts and chapped lips. Annoying, minor injuries that hurt way more than they have any right to. But it turns out, there's a good reason why stubbing your toe hurts so much.</p><p>When you stub your toe, you're slamming it with a force equal to 2-3 times your body weight. That's about the same force as a karate punch! And since your toe has a tiny surface area, that force can't spread out. So the pain stays concentrated at the point of impact.</p><p>It's the same reason it hurts more to step on the tiny, pointy end of a thumbtack than the wider, blunt end. But you don't just feel an immediate shock like when you step on a thumbtack. There's that aching throb that comes after. That's because when you stub your toe, you're actually hitting a bundle of special nerve endings called nociceptors. They all fire at once, blaring a danger signal.</p><p>But some signals travel faster than others. The faster, A-delta nociceptors fire the first wave of signal, which races at 20 m/s up thousands of densely-bundled nerve fibers and ultimately to your brain. That causes the sharp, sudden pain you feel at the moment of impact. But some nerve fibers called C nociceptors send a slower signal at only 2 m/s. So after a moment's delay, a second wave of pain signals reach your brain. That's the dull throbbing that lingers on.</p><p>You can find nociceptors all over your body, from your eyes to your bladder. But they're concentrated at the highest densities in parts of your body you use to explore your environment, like your fingertips, and lips. That's why accidents like paper cuts and chapped lips can also hurt more than they seem like they should. Now, your toe isn't packed with as many nociceptors as your fingertips. But since there's not much in the way of fat padding to cushion the blow it's easy to set those unprotected nociceptors off. And that's no coincidence.</p><p>Researchers suspect the pain we feel from mishaps like a stubbed toe might've saved our ancestors' lives. Back before antibiotics, even the tiniest cut could mean a deadly infection. And feet, which were constantly in contact with dirty, bacteria-infested surfaces were particularly vulnerable. So people who had extra- sensitive feet might've been more careful about where they stepped. As a result, they'd be less likely to get infections and would live to pass on their genes.</p><p>So the next time you collapse to the floor, cradling your aching toe you can thank your great great great great great great grandpa for the privilege.</p><p><em>EDITOR'S NOTE: This video was originally published in March 2019.</em></p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/why-stubbing-your-toe-hurts-so-much-2019-3'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=s84V7iWZkrY:cwzFuQ9ClUA:V_sGLiPBpWU\"><img border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/s84V7iWZkrY\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Wed, 02 Dec 2020 19:30:00 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5c8a59b9f73f5c2e1155246f?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"5d19cc3eec047bd15752ef3163204095","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn50@2020_6/2020/12/03/02-49-00-670_227d5b05991b59df.webp","destWidth":2073,"destHeight":1555,"sourceBytes":96202,"destBytes":96202,"author":"usharma@businessinsider.com (Uma Sharma,Shira Polan)","articleImgCdnMap":{"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn3@2020_2/2020/12/03/02-49-00-176_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=s84V7iWZkrY:cwzFuQ9ClUA:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn92@2020_3/2020/12/03/02-48-54-968_7ef03817ee079f0d.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=s84V7iWZkrY:cwzFuQ9ClUA:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn11@2020_6/2020/12/03/02-49-02-658_6d96250c417a6bd7.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn99@2020_3/2020/12/03/02-48-56-007_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=s84V7iWZkrY:cwzFuQ9ClUA:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn39@2020_2/2020/12/03/02-48-54-440_bbfde86644ef0ee5.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/s84V7iWZkrY":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn100@2020_2/2020/12/03/02-48-55-287_65e0fc64acde5a9f.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1606963710029},{"createdTime":"2020-12-03 10:48:30","updatedTime":"2020-12-03 10:48:30","title":"More than half of the money from the Paycheck Protection Program went to just 5% of recipients","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/5-percent-recipients-got-over-half-pay-paycheck-program-funds-2020-12","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f0c3a244dca6855ca5408b3?format=jpeg\" alt=\"FILE PHOTO: U.S. President Donald Trump signs the Paycheck Protection Program and Health Care Enhancement Act financial response to the coronavirus disease (COVID-19) outbreak, in the Oval Office at the White House in Washington, U.S. April 24, 2020.  REUTERS/Jonathan Ernst/File Photo\" height=\"3105\" width=\"4658\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>U.S. President Trump signs the Paycheck Protection Program and Health Care Enhancement Act response to the coronavirus disease outbreak at the White House in Washington\n<p class=\"copyright\">Reuters</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Over half the funds from the Paycheck Protection Program (PPP) went to just 5% of total recipients.</li>\n<li>In the past, Republicans have said the program has been working as intended, but banks have reported record business-loan fraud suspicion in the months of June and July.&#160;</li>\n<li>The program has been marred with issues, including fraud and large companies receiving funds.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Over half the funds from the US' Paycheck Protection Program went to just 5% of recipients, according to new data released by the Treasury Department on Tuesday.&#160;</p><p>Around 600 large companies \"including dozens of national chains, received the maximum amount allowed under the program of $10 million,\"according to<a href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2020/12/01/ppp-sba-data/\"> the Washington Post, which had to file a lawsuit to acquire the data via a Freedom of Information Act request.</a> Law firms and churches also received the maximum amount.&#160;</p><p>Officials from both the Treasury Department and the Small Business Administration have previously said the program had worked the way it was intended, with 87% of loans totalling $150,000 or less. However, the new data shows that only 28% of the $552 billion distributed were for smaller loans.</p><p>The program was initially created to help small business pay their employees after the coronavirus pandemic led to mass layoffs in March. &#160;The loans could also be forgiven <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/sba-loosening-payroll-restrictions-ppp-partial-loan-forgiveness-mnuchin-2020-6\">(if they hit certain criteria)</a> making them especially helpful to businesses who were unsure about their ability to repay.</p><p>While the PPP has been estimated to help save anywhere between <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/paycheck-protection-program-saved-millions-jobs-coronavirus-pandemic-economy-stimulus-2020-7\">1.4 million and 3.2 million jobs</a>, it has been plagued by fraud and other issues.</p><p><em><strong>Read More:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/ppp-ends-deadline-august-experts-say-what-will-replace-who-will-benefit?r=bs-sub\">The winners of the next round of federal relief funds will be airlines, restaurants, and businesses owned by women or people of color. Here's what to expect in the coming months.</a></em></p><p>A Florida man was charged in July for <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/florida-man-buys-lamborghini-charged-coronavirus-covid-ppp-funds-huracan-2020-7\">allegedly spending $3.9 million from the program on a Lamborghini </a>and other lavish items.</p><p>In September, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/ppp-loans-high-risk-fraud-waste-abuse-coronavirus-economic-stimulus-2020-9\">House Democrats sent out a memo</a> saying the PPP was susceptible to \"fraud, waste, or abuse\" because normal oversight was removed in order to get loans out sooner. That same month, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/banks-report-record-amount-of-suspected-business-fraud-during-ppp-2020-9\">banks released a report</a> showing an increase of suspected business-loan fraud during both June and July, when PPP loans were being issued.&#160;</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/5-percent-recipients-got-over-half-pay-paycheck-program-funds-2020-12'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=njSKnLJHfBs:M4arO85LEfQ:yIl2AUoC8zA\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=njSKnLJHfBs:M4arO85LEfQ:F7zBnMyn0Lo\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=njSKnLJHfBs:M4arO85LEfQ:F7zBnMyn0Lo\" Smith)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f0c3a244dca6855ca5408b3?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn90@2020_1/2020/12/03/02-48-48-674_8783dc7f08239534.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn3@2020_2/2020/12/03/02-49-00-176_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=njSKnLJHfBs:M4arO85LEfQ:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn75@2020_6/2020/12/03/02-49-00-878_a5b84bdecbd9bed0.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=njSKnLJHfBs:M4arO85LEfQ:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn28@2020_6/2020/12/03/02-48-58-737_7a49472e25408b8e.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn99@2020_3/2020/12/03/02-48-56-007_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=njSKnLJHfBs:M4arO85LEfQ:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn48@2020_6/2020/12/03/02-48-54-609_178632322828285b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/njSKnLJHfBs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn83@2020_3/2020/12/03/02-48-58-259_6f2a8bf2982625de.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1606963710012},{"createdTime":"2020-12-03 10:48:30","updatedTime":"2020-12-03 10:48:30","title":"How to watch live TV on Hulu and how much it costs","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-watch-live-tv-on-hulu","description":"<p class=\"financial-disclaimer\"><i>When you buy through our links, we may earn money from our affiliate partners. <a href=\"https://www.insider-inc.com/commerce-on-insider-inc/\">Learn more.</a></i></p><p><a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&mid=42392&u1=biipf_090619_hulu-live-tv&murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.hulu.com%2Flive-tvom%2Flive-tv\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d72bba22e22af2af24c1093?format=jpeg\" alt=\"hulu cat lol\" height=\"1354\" width=\"1805\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Hulu/Facebook</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></a></p><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li><strong><a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&mid=42392&u1=biipf_090619_hulu-live-tv&murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.hulu.com%2Flive-tvom%2Flive-tv\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Hulu + Live TV</a> offers over 65 live channels including CBS, Food Network, ESPN, and Disney, plus Hulu's entire streaming catalog, starting at $54.99 a month.</strong></li><li><strong>With that said, the service will be increasing its starting price to $64.99 a month on December 18.</strong></li><li><strong>Upgrade to Hulu Premium + Live TV for only $6 more a month to experience Hulu's streaming catalog ad-free.</strong></li><li><strong>It comes with the ability to record live TV with up to 50 hours of storage at no additional cost.</strong></li><li><strong>Read more: <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-much-is-hulu\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">A complete price breakdown for Hulu and Hulu Live TV packages</a></strong></li></ul><div id=\"ProductCard_5e18fba0b2e66a3b703df013\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5e18fba0b2e66a3b703df013&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><p><a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&mid=42392&u1=biipf_090619_hulu-live-tv&murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.hulu.com%2Flive-tvom%2Flive-tv\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Hulu + Live TV</a> saved my life. Well, maybe that's a bit of an exaggeration, but it definitely saved my Shark Week. Shark Week is a huge deal in my house. My partner and I dedicate our whole week to observing these majestic creatures in their natural habitats and cheering on the brave and dedicated scientists, researchers, and divers who make it all possible. Last year was to be no different. But we'd recently moved apartments and switched cable providers, so when I went to turn on Discovery moments before the first episode of Shark Week 2019 was set to begin, I was stunned to learn the channel didn't come with our cable package. It always had before, so I didn't think to check beforehand. Now Shark Week was moments away, the popcorn was already popped, and I was at a loss.</p><p>I needed something that would get me access to the Discovery Channel and my beautiful breaching apex predators instantly. I thought about finding an illegal stream online, but those were unreliable … and illegal, so I thought better of it. I thought about calling my cable provider and upgrading to a package that included Discovery, but that would've made my cable bill skyrocket. And then I remembered Hulu has a Live TV add-on, and I was thrilled to see the Discovery logo prominently displayed on their channel list. I already had a <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/hulu-premium-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Hulu Premium subscription</a> and the app was installed on my smart TV, so all I had to do was click into my account settings and toggle on the Hulu + Live TV option. Within seconds, we were blissfully watching great whites hunt robo-seals. It was that easy.</p><p><a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&mid=42392&u1=biipf_090619_hulu-live-tv&murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.hulu.com%2Flive-tvom%2Flive-tv\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Hulu + Live TV</a> is a great option if you're looking into cord-cutting thanks to the sheer volume of content you gain access to. Plus you can record TV to watch later, DVR-style, so you don't have to worry about catching your shows as they air live. We used this option to make sure we didn't miss a single sharky moment.</p><p><em>Updated on 12/2/2020 by Steven Cohen: Added details about the upcoming price increase for Hulu + Live TV.</em></p><h2><strong>How much does Hulu + Live TV cost?</strong></h2><p>With Hulu + Live TV, you first and foremost gain access to Hulu's entire streaming catalog — all the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-shows-on-hulu\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">shows</a>, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-movies-on-hulu\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">movies</a>, and <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-hulu-orignals-to-stream\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Hulu originals</a> that you get with a normal Hulu subscription are yours to enjoy. If you can tolerate ads interrupting your on-demand streams, <a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&mid=42392&u1=biipf_090619_hulu-live-tv&murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.hulu.com%2Flive-tvom%2Flive-tv\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Hulu Basic + Live TV</a> will set you back $54.99 a month after the free one-week trial. That said, Hulu will be increasing the monthly cost of this plan to $64.99 a month for new and existing members starting December 18.&#160;</p><p>If you want to upgrade to <a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&mid=42392&u1=biipf_090619_hulu-live-tv&murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.hulu.com%2Flive-tvom%2Flive-tv\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Hulu Premium + Live TV</a> for ad-free on-demand streaming, you can currently pay $60.99 a month — though that price will also be increasing by $10 on December 18. The new $70.99 monthly cost will apply to new and existing subscribers. It's also important to note that even with the Hulu Premium + Live TV option, you'll still have to sit through ads during live TV streams. After all, it's live TV, and there are commercials.</p><p>Free with Hulu + Live TV is up to 50 hours of storage so you can record your favorite shows to watch them later. You can also rewind shows that have already started back to the beginning so you don't have to worry about rushing home to catch the first five minutes of the new episode of \"The Bachelor.\" If 50 hours doesn't seem like enough, because you want to horde the entire new season of \"Real Housewives\" and your roommate wants to record every Crimson Tide football game, you can upgrade to 200 hours of DVR storage for an additional $9.99 a month.</p><p>You can also add on premium channels like <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/hbo-max-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">HBO Max</a> ($14.99 per month), Showtime ($10.99 per month), Cinemax ($9.99 per month), and Starz ($8.99 per month) for additional monthly charges. <a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&mid=42392&u1=biipf_090619_hulu-live-tv&murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.hulu.com%2Flive-tvom%2Flive-tv\" rel=\"nofollow sponsored\">Hulu + Live TV</a> also offers add-on packages that include additional entertainment channels ($7.99 per month), and Spanish-language channels ($4.99 per month).</p><h2><strong>What channels come with Hulu + Live TV?</strong></h2><p>Discovery is just one of the more than 65&#160;channels that come with <a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&mid=42392&u1=biipf_090619_hulu-live-tv&murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.hulu.com%2Flive-tvom%2Flive-tv\" rel=\"nofollow sponsored\">Hulu + Live TV</a>.</p><p>You'll gain access to networks like ABC, CBS, Fox, and NBC, so you can keep up with your favorite sitcoms and news programs. Also included are lifestyle channels like TLC, HGTV, and Food Network.</p><p>And if you've somehow missed Hulu's ubiquitous ad campaign: Hulu has live sports. Channels like ESPN, NBCSN, and the SEC Network are at your disposal so you'll never miss a kick-off, or tip-off, or puck drop ever again.</p><p>They offer local channels as well, so be sure to enter your zip code to see what else you'll get based on your geographic location. The full list is far too long to include here, so<a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&mid=42392&u1=biipf_090619_hulu-live-tv&murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.hulu.com%2Flive-tvom%2Flive-tv\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\"> check out Hulu's website</a> to make sure all your favorites are included. They're listed in alphabetical order to help you quickly find what you're looking for.</p><h2>How do I sign up for Hulu + Live TV?</h2><p>If you're not already subscribed to one of Hulu's on-demand plans, signing up for Hulu + Live TV is a simple process. Here's a rundown of how to sign up:</p><ol><li>Visit the <a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&mid=42392&u1=biipf_090619_hulu-live-tv&murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.hulu.com%2Flive-tvom%2Flive-tv\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">Hulu + Live TV website</a>.</li><li>Click on the link that says \"Start Your Free Trial.\"</li><li>Enter your information to create an account.</li><li>Provide a credit card number or use a PayPal account for payment.</li><li>You will receive a free seven-day trial.</li><li>After the trial, you'll be billed the regular $54.99 monthly fee ($64.99 starting December 18).</li></ol><p>If you're already an existing subscriber to one of Hulu's on-demand plans, upgrading to the <a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&mid=42392&u1=biipf_090619_hulu-live-tv&murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.hulu.com%2Flive-tvom%2Flive-tv\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Hulu + Live TV</a> service is also very simple.</p><ol><li>Visit the <a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&mid=42392&u1=biipf_090619_hulu-live-tv&murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.hulu.com%2Flive-tvom%2Flive-tv\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\">Hulu website</a> and log in to your account.</li><li>Hover over the account icon at the top right of the page.</li><li>Click on \"Account.\"</li><li>Select the \"Manage Plan\" option.</li><li>Choose the <a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&mid=42392&u1=biipf_090619_hulu-live-tv&murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.hulu.com%2Flive-tvom%2Flive-tv\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Hulu + Live TV</a> plan.</li></ol><h2>Can I get Hulu + Live TV with the Disney Plus and ESPN+ bundle?</h2><p>The Hulu Basic service is available as part of a discounted bundle with <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/disney-plus-bundle\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Disney Plus and ESPN+ for $12.99 a month</a>. Though the version of Hulu included with this <a href=\"https://disneyplus.bn5x.net/c/196318/858039/9358\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">bundle</a> is the ad-supported on-demand plan, there is a way to sign up for Hulu + Live TV and still take advantage of the bundle savings.&#160;</p><ol><li>Sign up for <a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&mid=42392&murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.hulu.com%2FwelcomeFwelcome\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Hulu + Live TV</a> ($54.99/month).&#160;</li><li>Navigate to the \"Manage Your Account\" section on the Hulu website.&#160;</li><li>Select \"Manage Plan.\"</li><li>Choose the Disney Bundle with Hulu + Live TV ($61.99/month) or the Disney Bundle with Premium Hulu + Live TV ($67.99/month).</li><li>Make sure to use the same email address you use for your Hulu account when you activate the Disney Plus bundle.</li><li>You will have new Disney Plus and ESPN+ accounts but will continue to be billed separately for your Hulu + Live TV subscription.&#160;</li><li>Every month, Disney will credit you $5.99, which is the value of the ad-supported Hulu in the original bundle.</li><li>You will end up saving about $5 per month with the bundle versus paying for each service separately.</li></ol><h2><strong>What devices can I stream Hulu + Live TV on?</strong></h2><p>Most smart TVs come with the Hulu app already installed, so once you sign up online or modify your account to add the Live TV package, you'll be able to stream instantly through your Hulu app. Check out our recommendations for the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-4k-tv\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">best 4K Smart TVs</a> if you're looking to make the switch. It's incredibly convenient to be able to watch Hulu and other streaming services without any additional hardware or plugins.</p><p>You can also access the Hulu app through <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-streaming-box-stick\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">streaming devices</a> like <a href=\"https://amzn.to/2PP5AII\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Roku</a>, <a href=\"http://bestbuy.7tiv.net/c/196318/614286/10014?subId1=biipf_090619_hulu-live-tv&u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.bestbuy.com%2Fsite%2Fapple-apple-tv-4k-32gb-latest-model-black%2F5901530.p%3FskuId%3D5901530%26irclickid%3DxeY2isTanxyJWlt05-R4sULoUklSr0Q0wx2wSM0%26irgwc%3D1%26ref%3D198%26loc%3D196318%26acampID%3D6142864286\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Apple TV</a>, or <a href=\"https://amzn.to/2LxxGmh\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Amazon Fire Stick</a>, and as always, you can stream on your phone or laptop instantly.</p><div id=\"ProductCard_5e18fba0b2e66a3b703df013\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe Cohen)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5d72bba22e22af2af24c1093?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn39@2020_4/2020/12/03/02-48-53-294_2225be65bdc830b1.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn3@2020_2/2020/12/03/02-49-00-176_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Aqy1zWYMeiE:Ic-i1E4PH4o:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn48@2020_5/2020/12/03/02-48-53-396_bf973fe112d15e0e.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Aqy1zWYMeiE:Ic-i1E4PH4o:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn28@2020_2/2020/12/03/02-48-58-042_f8b85fdca775ac03.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn99@2020_3/2020/12/03/02-48-56-007_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Aqy1zWYMeiE:Ic-i1E4PH4o:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn36@2020_2/2020/12/03/02-49-00-387_a83b316eab8685e8.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/Aqy1zWYMeiE":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn87@2020_3/2020/12/03/02-48-56-859_2d05f8948061def8.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1606963710043},{"createdTime":"2020-12-03 10:48:29","updatedTime":"2020-12-03 10:48:29","title":"How bitcoin surged to an all-time high in 2020 — while remaining as uncertain an investment as ever","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/bitcoin-an-all-time-high-still-uncertain-investment-millennials-2020-12","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fa5bab1f7d1cb0019e3a54c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"bitcoin\" height=\"3006\" width=\"4009\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A key aspect of bitcoin is mining.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.reutersconnect.com/all?id=tag%3Areuters.com%2C2020%3Anewsml_RC2PIF9I0Y2U%3A1573684471&#38;search=all%3Abitcoin\" target=\"_blank\">REUTERS/Dado Ruvic/Illustration</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Bitcoin is back &#8212; the cryptocurrency just surpassed its previous peak from December 2017.</li>\n<li>The cryptocurrency's massive rise in buzz and price in 2017 only presaged a huge slump the following year &#8212; will 2021 be different?</li>\n<li>The conditions of the pandemic, bitcoin's more widespread availability, and new Wall Street regulators could be contributing to its current &#8212; and continuing &#8212; rally.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Bitcoin is having a moment — again.</p><p>The cryptocurrency, which was created in 2009, <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/currencies/news/bitcoin-hits-new-record-high-after-trading-above-19700-2020-11-1029849416\">surged above its previous December 2017 peak on Monday</a>, gaining 177% year to date to $19,857.03.</p><p>A cryptocurrency is essentially digital currency, with a decentralized database that contains all of the currency's transactions. Instead of being backed by something like gold, bitcoin has code behind it. Its main advantage is there's no primary owner (like a bank), but instead a network that anyone can join, which powers the currency.</p><p>Bitcoin is powered by <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/what-is-blockchain-2016-3\">blockchain</a> technology, and every bitcoin transaction is permanently recorded. Its famous \"miners\" process all new transactions, and then use cryptography to add them to the database. Its creator, the mysterious \"Satoshi Nakamoto,\" <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/bitcoin-history-cryptocurrency-satoshi-nakamoto-2017-12#but-satoshi-nakamoto-didnt-work-entirely-alone-3\">is still unknown</a>. It's a buzzy alternative investment for the internet generation, but it's also famously volatile — and <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/currencies/news/economist-nouriel-roubini-trashes-bitcoin-manipulation-retail-investor-fomo-2020-11-1029844248\">has its fair share of skeptics</a>.</p><p>Back in 2017, bitcoin had what <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/bitcoin-price-in-2017-review-2017-12\">Business Insider described as a \"wild run,</a>\" rising by over 1,300% and <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/cryptocurrency-bitcoin-ethereum-ico-mania-going-mainstream-2017-8?curator=TechREDEF\">going mainstream</a> with Times Square ads and celebrity endorsements including Floyd Mayweather. But bitcoin took a mighty tumble the next year, <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/currencies/news/bitcoin-surges-past-15000-hits-highest-level-in-two-years-2020-11-1029772298\">falling 80% from its peak</a>, while other <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/bitcoin-price-cryptocurrencies-ether-litecoin-bitcoin-cash-2018-9\">cryptocurrencies also slumped</a>. Still, it's the world's best-known (and most popular) cryptocurrency, <a href=\"https://www.investopedia.com/tech/most-important-cryptocurrencies-other-than-bitcoin/\">and is seen as a standard-setter</a>.</p><p>The hype now is back close to — or even beyond — 2017 levels, with millennial celebrities especially curious.</p><p>For instance, \"Game of Thrones\" actor Maisie Williams asked her millions of Twitter followers if she should go long on it, and billionaire Mike Novogratz responded with a <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/currencies/news/billionaire-mike-novogratz-bitcoin-65k-game-of-thrones-maisie-williams-2020-11-1029814531\">buy recommendation</a>, saying he expected the price to hit $65,000.</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">&#8212;Maisie Williams  (@Maisie_Williams) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1328428879334297600?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">November 16, 2020</a></blockquote><script async src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p>&#160;</p><p>Williams isn't the only one contemplating bitcoin: Inigo Fraser-Jenkins, Bernstein Research's co-head of portfolio strategy, wrote in a note to clients that <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/currencies/news/stock-market-outlook-bitcoin-portfolio-crypto-skeptic-investing-bernstein-2020-12-1029854263\">he had changed his mind about the cryptocurrency</a>. He believes that bitcoin now has a place in investor portfolios.</p><h2>So what's changed?</h2><p>For Fraser-Jenkins, the difference is the economic fallout from the pandemic — such as higher taxes and inflation — coupled with bitcoin's declining volatility over the past three years.</p><p>But there's no one clear reason why the cryptocurrency has rallied so tremendously — it's probably a confluence of factors. The <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/currencies/news/world-biggest-crypto-fund-manager-michael-sonnenshein-bitcoin-money-evolution-2020-11-1029826836\">pandemic is a big one</a>, with <a href=\"https://www.coindesk.com/dbs-bitcoin-crypto-pandemic\">more investors looking to bitcoin</a> as a steady alternative that won't be impacted by potential inflation.</p><p>It's also now more widely available to use and trade. Prospective bitcoin users can now actually buy and sell it on services including <a href=\"https://newsroom.paypal-corp.com/2020-10-21-PayPal-Launches-New-Service-Enabling-Users-to-Buy-Hold-and-Sell-Cryptocurrency\">PayPal</a> and <a href=\"https://cash.app/help/us/en-us/1016-bitcoin\">Square</a>. Starting in 2021, PayPal users will even be able to use it in exchange for goods and services. Fidelity Investments even started <a href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-08-26/fidelity-launches-inaugural-bitcoin-fund-for-wealthy-investors\">its own bitcoin fund</a> in August.</p><p>There's <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/currencies/news/bitcoin-surges-past-15000-hits-highest-level-in-two-years-2020-11-1029772298\">substantial millennial interest in it</a>, and Novogratz told Bloomberg that it's like \"<a href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-08-26/fidelity-launches-inaugural-bitcoin-fund-for-wealthy-investors\">digital gold</a>.\"</p><p>The cryptocurrency could also have a government ally on Wall Street. President-elect Joe Biden has appointed to his transition team Gary Gensler, a figure with deep knowledge and experience about cryptocurrencies, who's also seen as <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/currencies/news/bitcoin-price-explodes-above-18k-market-cap-all-time-high-2020-11-1029815353\">friendly toward</a> the alternative asset class.</p><p>So it certainly seems possible that bitcoin <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/currencies/news/bitcoin-price-outlook-here-to-stay-millennial-demand-blackrock-rieder-2020-11-1029827265\">will stick around for the long haul</a>, despite its <a href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-11-30/bitcoin-jumps-to-record-as-advocates-say-this-time-is-different\">continued volatility</a>.&#160;</p><p>But, much like its creator and its origins, when it comes to bitcoin's value, there's always considerable mystery.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/EEyhNl6tKIo\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Wed, 02 Dec 2020 20:41:40 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5fa5bab1f7d1cb0019e3a54c?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"d56abbfa5a6a520bb3587837558f5ca9","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn23@2020_2/2020/12/03/02-48-35-688_a3627037a23e46f0.webp","destWidth":4009,"destHeight":3006,"sourceBytes":605812,"destBytes":605812,"author":"insider@insider.com (Juliana Kaplan)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5fa5bab1f7d1cb0019e3a54c?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn23@2020_2/2020/12/03/02-48-35-688_a3627037a23e46f0.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn3@2020_2/2020/12/03/02-49-00-176_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=EEyhNl6tKIo:gUP0i7DH_Rw:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn48@2020_5/2020/12/03/02-48-56-462_3bf0a62f2428a232.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=EEyhNl6tKIo:gUP0i7DH_Rw:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn84@2020_6/2020/12/03/02-48-57-707_c0f92b8b03ab6732.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn99@2020_3/2020/12/03/02-48-56-007_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=EEyhNl6tKIo:gUP0i7DH_Rw:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn7@2020_6/2020/12/03/02-48-59-366_f1c67a38c967324e.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/EEyhNl6tKIo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn79@2020_4/2020/12/03/02-49-03-090_2db227cb9896ef16.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1606963709999},{"createdTime":"2020-12-03 10:48:30","updatedTime":"2020-12-03 10:48:30","title":"Pfizer vaccine-trial participant reveals what it's like to volunteer for research that helped create the first effective COVID-19 vaccine","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/pfizer-vaccine-trial-participant-on-side-effects-what-its-like-2020-11","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fac3fccb09abb00186260e5?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Jenny Hamilton.\" height=\"455\" width=\"607\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Jenny Hamilton said she didn&#39;t think twice about getting involved in the trial.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Jenny Hamilton</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Jenny Hamilton is a 57-year-old former police officer who now works in location security for the film industry and lives in Atlanta.</li>\n<li><strong data-stringify-type=\"bold\">She's a participant in the Pfizer vaccine trial, which recently announced that it developed the&#160;</strong><strong data-stringify-type=\"bold\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/insider-pfizer-biontech-historic-coronavirus-vaccine-program-2020-11\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" data-stringify-link=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/insider-pfizer-biontech-historic-coronavirus-vaccine-program-2020-11\" data-sk=\"tooltip_parent\">first effective coronavirus vaccine</a></strong><strong data-stringify-type=\"bold\"> in record time and just filed for <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/pfizer-coronavirus-vaccine-filed-for-emergency-authorization-with-fda-2020-11\">emergency authorization</a> with the FDA.</strong></li>\n<li>The UK just <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/pfizer-biontech-covid-vaccine-approved-uk-who-first-how-many-2020-12\">approved the COVID-19 vaccine</a> from Pfizer and BioNTech, making it the first Western country to authorize a coronavirus shot.</li>\n<li><strong data-stringify-type=\"bold\">Hamilton wasn't told whether she received the vaccine or a placebo, but after receiving the first two injections, she experienced what felt like a cold &#8212; low-grade fevers, fatigue, and muscle aches.</strong></li>\n<li>\"I'm excited that others will be able to have some protection,\" Hamilton told Business Insider.&#160;</li>\n<li>This is what her experience has been like, as told to Lauren Lee.&#160;</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>My family member is a nurse who got COVID-19 in probably early-to-mid May. We kind of expected it because they visit a lot of people in assisted-living facilities and nursing homes, so we figured they were waiting for the shoe to drop.&#160;</p><p>It was very sobering for us as a family. They ended up getting a mild form, which was lucky for us. They have a couple of other preexisting conditions that put them at higher risk for a more serious outcome.</p><h2><strong>Since we were exposed in January, I've always viewed the pandemic as a once-in-a-century pandemic.</strong></h2><p>I'd been thinking about what I could do to help, even though I'm basically a walking high-risk category for COVID-19.&#160; I have asthma and Hashimoto's, an autoimmune condition.</p><p>I was actively seeking to become part of this. First and foremost, it's a monumental opportunity to be able to help your fellow citizens and be able to be in a position to further a therapeutic or vaccine that will keep people from dying. I really didn't think twice about it. It was something I sought after, and I did it mainly because my family members are nurses.</p><p>They didn't make it easy. I looked for information on where the trials were being conducted and waited for details to come out on how I could sign up for a trial. I had heard other people signed up to participate, and I wanted to know where they were getting that information.&#160;</p><p>There are three facilities in the Atlanta area that are doing the study. I'm part of the one by the Clinical Research Atlanta in Stockbridge, Georgia.&#160;</p><p><em><strong>Read more: </strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/insider-pfizer-biontech-historic-coronavirus-vaccine-program-2020-11\">How the pharma giant Pfizer teamed up with a little-known biotech to develop an effective coronavirus vaccine in record time</a></em></p><p>I finally went to their website and filled out a small survey. I was called the next day.</p><h2>I was finally accepted into the trial in mid-August.&#160;</h2><p>I'm taking part in the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/insider-pfizer-biontech-historic-coronavirus-vaccine-program-2020-11\">Pfizer trial</a>, where we get two doses.</p><p>They asked me a bunch of questions and tested me for COVID-19 as part of the test. They drew blood and they gave me the first injection. At that point, I didn't know if I was getting the placebo or vaccine, but that night, I started getting really tired. The next day I was really exhausted, and then I started having a fever. My temperature was 99, almost 100 degrees for two and a half to three days. (Editor's note: Hamilton was not told whether she got a working shot or the placebo. She said she thinks she got the vaccine, because of her body's reaction to the injections.)&#160;</p><p>After the first injection, I waited three weeks and got another injection in the beginning of September. It was the same scenario — I was <em>really</em> tired the next day. It was a little more severe, where I didn't even feel like getting up to fix something to eat. I just laid in bed and slept most of the day and still had a low-grade fever for two or three days as well.</p><p>After that, I'm fine. I'm in the third phase of the study. I got the blood draw a month after I did the last injection and will get another blood draw in March to determine if I have antibodies — or different responses with platelets and white blood cells — and what my body's response is.</p><h2><strong>They request for you to fill out a diary.&#160;</strong></h2><p>Every time you get an injection, you're supposed to detail in your responses of what your side effects are for seven days: what your temperature is, aches, pains, and, on a scale, how severe they are.</p><p><em><strong>Read more: </strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/pharma-executives-selling-company-stock-amid-covid-19-pandemic-2020-10\">Biotech execs hunting for COVID-19 vaccines and treatments have raked in more than $1 billion by selling company stock this year. Here are the 27 leaders who've cashed in the most.</a></em></p><section></section><p>If you got more than moderate on any of the questions you have, a study coordinator would reach out.&#160;</p><p>For example, one of my questions was about tiredness. When I put \"severe\" on tiredness, the study coordinator texted me soon after and wanted to get an idea of how I was doing. The same thing happened when my temperature was elevated for a longer period of time after the second injection.&#160;</p><p>She basically said the side effects for this particular vaccine were usually more severe with the second injection than the first, so this was normal.&#160;</p><h2>They're very good about following up with you.</h2><p>It'll prompt you with certain entries in your diary to call your study coordinator. She calls right away, wants to make sure you're OK, and determines how severe your reactions are.</p><p>Those are the kinds of things I found comforting.&#160;</p><p>Other than that, they don't really talk to you. They just say if you feel bad, you can call at any time. Or if you feel like you want to withdraw from the study, you can call immediately and they'll talk you through that. They try to mitigate situations where someone is feeling scared or anxious.</p><p>I've never felt any of that because this situation was like having a slight cold.&#160;</p><p><em><strong>Read more: </strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/coronavirus-antibody-treatments-eli-lilly-regeneron-gsk-amgen-2020-4\">Here's how 9 leading drugmakers are racing to develop a new kind of coronavirus treatment despite an early setback</a></em></p><h2><strong>Even though I'm in the last phase, the study is going to last for 2 years.&#160;</strong></h2><p>I'll have to fill out a diary once a week at least for two years. They want you to fill out a diary to see if you have any symptoms or feel like you've gotten COVID-19. If you do, they give you a test to do a nasal swab and pick it up.&#160;</p><p>The way they were explaining to me, the last blood draw they'll do is in March.</p><p><em><strong>Read more:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/timeline-of-when-pfizer-covid-19-vaccine-could-be-available-2020-11\">Read a timeline of when Pfizer's new coronavirus vaccine could reach ordinary people — a process likely to take months</a>.)&#160;</em></p><p>Even though it feels like I have another layer of protection, I still wear my mask. I'm actually careful. I have gone out to eat occasionally, but since the whole pandemic, it's made my perception change. I look down on restaurants that don't enforce mask-wearing and social distancing. I make sure I'm socially distancing myself in places.</p><p>It's wonderful that it looks like the trial is getting close to producing a successful candidate for the vaccine. I'm excited that others will be able to have some protection.</p><p><em data-stringify-type=\"italic\">The thoughts expressed are those of the subject's. Her participation in the trial was confirmed by Business Insider.</em></p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a 2020 19:52:46
