(Lauren Lee)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5fac3fccb09abb00186260e5?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn17@2020_4/2020/12/03/02-48-30-582_b5efbb9078770aae.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn3@2020_2/2020/12/03/02-49-00-176_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=gYTpGoEiQs0:z3JzCDYFvfs:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn88@2020_2/2020/12/03/02-49-00-161_ba976f59358e6345.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=gYTpGoEiQs0:z3JzCDYFvfs:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn12@2020_1/2020/12/03/02-48-51-211_aa205e37651b5c0c.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn99@2020_3/2020/12/03/02-48-56-007_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=gYTpGoEiQs0:z3JzCDYFvfs:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn51@2020_1/2020/12/03/02-48-53-595_393d6c8ef7c3c683.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/gYTpGoEiQs0":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn8@2020_4/2020/12/03/02-49-01-962_5ee1b029dc1211f1.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1606963710009},{"createdTime":"2020-12-03 10:48:29","updatedTime":"2020-12-03 10:48:29","title":"The best exercise bikes","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-exercise-bike","description":"<ul class=\"summary-list\"><li><strong>An exercise bike is a great way to keep your heart healthy and muscles toned, and it could help you lose weight or maintain it where you want it. </strong></li><li><strong>Having a stationary bike at home allows you to work out at any time you like without having to commute to the gym or worry about if it's nice enough outside to ride your bike.</strong></li><li><strong>Our top pick, the <a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com/?id=35871X943606&xs=1&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.nordictrack.com%2Fexercise-bikes%2Fs22i-studio-bike&xcust=1584379980380ahoy3ip0d|xid:fr1584379983063efi379983063efi\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow\">NordicTrack's S22i Studio Cycle</a>, is a high-quality at-home bike that offers a deep library of on-demand content like instructor-led courses and digital rides across the world, that you'll love jumping on for a workout each day.&#160;</strong></li></ul><p>Exercise bicycles, also known as <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-indoor-bike-trainer\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">stationary bikes</a> or spinning bikes, have a surprisingly long history that dates back to when Francis Lowndes invented a device approximating the function of an exercise bike in the late 1790s. His creation, the Gymnasticon, predated even the earliest riding bicycles by several decades. By the end of the 19th century, as bicycles took their modern form, stationary bikes used for exercise became a more common sight in homes and gymnasiums.</p><p>For much of the 20th century, exercise bikes and treadmills were essentially the only stationary devices suitable for cardiovascular exercise. In the 1990s, equipment such as the NordicTrack, the elliptical trainer, and stair machine gained in popularity. Exercise bikes almost seemed passé, used more for hanging laundry than for fitness in the home.</p><p>Then the spin class craze hit and exercise bikes surged into style once again. Led by familiar faces in NordicTrack and newcomers like Peloton, the current wave of exercise bikes have become an incredibly popular part of anyone's <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-home-gym\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">at-home fitness setup</a>. For info on what to consider when buying an exercise bike, jump to the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-exercise-bike#how-to-shop-for-an-exercise-bike-8\">bottom of this guide</a>.</p><h2>Here are the best exercise bikes:</h2><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li><strong>Best overall: <a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com/?id=35871X943606&xs=1&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.nordictrack.com%2Fexercise-bikes%2Fs22i-studio-bike&xcust=1584379980380ahoy3ip0d|xid:fr1584379983063efi379983063efi\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\">NordicTrack's S22i Studio Cycle</a></strong></li><li><strong>Best high-intensity: <a href=\"https://www.onepeloton.com/shop/bike/bike-package\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Peloton</a></strong></li><li><strong>Best budget connected bike: </strong><a href=\"https://www.insider.com/stryde-bike-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Stryde Bike</a></li><li><strong>Best pedal exerciser: <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00W46YILA/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=biipgf_030818_best-exercise-bikes-20&camp=1789&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B00W46YILA&linkId=b5b5a0559c9b927f895fa5fd465302ae9c9b927f895fa5fd465302ae\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">Vive Pedal Exerciser</a></strong></li><li><strong>Best budget exercise bike: <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Marcy-Recumbent-Exercise-Resistance-ME-709/dp/B002KV1MJU\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Marcy Recumbent Mag Cycle</a></strong></li><li><strong>Best folding exercise bike: <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B01LYFWKMH/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=biipgf_030818_best-exercise-bikes-20&camp=1789&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B01LYFWKMH&linkId=1f6613efd68c0d9eaebdf07b1c830238d68c0d9eaebdf07b1c830238\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored\">XTERRA FB150 Folding Exercise Bike</a></strong></li><li><strong><strong>Best for comfort: <a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com/?id=35871X943606&isjs=1&jv=14.0.0-alpha.1-stackpath&sref=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.businessinsider.com%2Fpost%2Fpreview%3Fpost_id%3D5e6fbdaac485405ad82f0748%26mode%3Ddesktop&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.amazon.com%2Fgp%2Fproduct%2FB0844XJZB6%2Fref%3Das_li_tl%3Fie%3DUTF8%26tag%3Dbiipgf_030818_best-exercise-bikes-20%26camp%3D1789%26creative%3D9325%26linkCode%3Das2%26creativeASIN%3DB0844XJZB6%26linkId%3D0438469e770946ef9613de21055d13a6&xguid=01DW82HZBXD53M4EZNADWYW5DJ&xs=1&xtz=240&xuuid=232b23b77b02a394b950cdd26132668e232b23b77b02a394b950cdd26132668e\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\">Exerpeutic 5000 Magnetic Recumbent Bike</a></strong></strong></li></ul><p><em>Updated on 12/2/2020. We updated prices, links, and formatting. We also removed the <a href=\"https://www.schwinnfitness.com/cruiser/100735.html?adID=SDOFG2SFEED3&gclid=CKGHzITfvNkCFUKiswodlS0D2A&gclsrc=ds&psearch=1mp;psearch=1\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Schwinn Classic Cruiser</a> as it is currently out of stock.&#160;</em></p>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tThe best exercise bike overall\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e00f3c1855cc264c9388e92?format=jpeg\" alt=\"NordicTrack Commercial S22i Studio Cycle\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">NordicTrack</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com/?id=35871X943606&#38;xs=1&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.nordictrack.com%2Fexercise-bikes%2Fs22i-studio-bike&#38;xcust=1584379980380ahoy3ip0d|xid:fr1584379983063efi\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\">NordicTrack's S22i Studio Cycle</a> offers a high-quality ride experience and some of the best streamable workout content via its iFit program.&#160;</h3><p><strong>Pros:&#160;</strong>Deep well of content to support a high-quality at-home ride experience, can choose between trainer-led classes or free rides in places across the world</p><p><strong>Cons:&#160;</strong>Expensive, iFit requires a monthly subscription fee</p><p>Exercise bikes outfit with a large color touchscreen that streams on-demand workouts is a growing trend in the at-home fitness industry. Though Peloton's name tends to come up first in any conversation about them, the NordicTrack brand has been delivering a high-quality at-home cycling experience for far longer.</p><p>With its <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/nordictrack-commercial-s22i-studio-cycle-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">S22i Studio Cycle</a>, NordicTrack continues that trend by offering a feature-heavy at-home bike with a deep offering of on-demand fitness content. There are the instructor-led courses but also a library of rides capable of digitally taking you around the world &#8212; think biking through Australia one minute then across Moab, Utah the next. This mode features Google Map integration, so it's not just some randomly generated scenery but instead, the real thing.&#160;</p><p><a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com/?id=35871X943606&#38;xs=1&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.nordictrack.com%2Fexercise-bikes%2Fs22i-studio-bike&#38;xcust=1584379980380ahoy3ip0d|xid:fr1584379983063efi\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\">The bike</a> also features incline and decline control, and up to 24 different levels of resistance. Each class is designed to make use of these and they'll automatically adjust as an instructor changes them during a routine.&#160;</p><p>If you're not an all-bike-all-the-time kind of person, the iFit platform even offers cross-training routines like yoga or free weight workouts, adding to the bike's versatility. You'll have a hard time finding an at-home bike that offers more.</p>\n\tThe best high-intensity exercise bike\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e6fbd5ec485405a95604035?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Peloton\" height=\"762\" width=\"1016\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Peloton / Youtube</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://www.onepeloton.com/shop/bike/bike-package\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Peloton's</a> name is synonymous with at-home stationary bikes, and for good reason &#8212; its high-quality bike offers a library of immersive and intense workouts led by motivating trainers.&#160;</h3><p><strong>Pros:&#160;</strong>Peloton's bike is an incredibly interactive home cycling experience, the bike runs quietly, it offers a variety of on-demand and live classes, and its large touchscreen isn't obnoxious</p><p><strong>Cons:&#160;</strong>Expensive, recurring monthly charge for access to the video library</p><p>You don't even need to be a fitness fanatic to recognize the Peloton name when you see it &#8212; the company's done an incredible job making its at-home exercise bike an absolute star ever since it burst on the scene years ago. The attention is deserved, too, as the Peloton bike offers users an interactive workout experience that replicates the feeling of a spin class from the comfort of their home.&#160;</p><p>Like NordicTrack's S22i, the Peloton bike features a huge built-in screen that displays each of its workouts, as well as a rider's progress and stats. The workouts themselves are high-energy, trainer-led courses that are either streamed via Peloton's on-demand library or taken live.&#160;</p><p>Each Peloton class offers a bit of variety, too. Instead of just wailing away on the pedals for 30 minutes, there are classes for varying skill levels and themes, as well as those set to specific types of music. What they all have in common is delivering a sweat-heavy workout anyone can enjoy from the comfort of their home.&#160;</p><p>The bike itself is a compact stationary bike that doesn't require a ton of room to setup and use. Its seat is adjustable to accommodate for a range of riders, and it runs quiet enough to not bother anyone else nearby.&#160;</p><p>Though it is expensive at $2,245 for its basic package, it's well worth the investment.&#160;</p>\n\tThe best budget connected bike\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f6906e9323fc4001e0d7967?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Stryder Bike\" height=\"5304\" width=\"7072\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Ana Gerst (Le CollectiveM)</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://www.strydebike.com/the-bike\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">The Stryde</a> bike not only costs hundreds of dollars less than its connected bike kin like Peloton and NordicTrack, but it lets you stream workouts from other fitness apps, as well as services like Netflix and Hulu.</h3><p><strong>Pros:</strong> Ergonomic design, comfortable seat, perfect size for small apartments, 22-inch touchscreen tablet can stream a variety of apps or streaming services, great value</p><p><strong>Cons:&#160;</strong>Production quality of its classes can be lacking, Stryde app only offers on-bike workouts</p><p>The industry of connected bikes is far from at a loss for variety, but a relative newcomer by the name of <a href=\"https://www.strydebike.com/the-bike\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Stryde</a> released one of our favorite reviewed bikes to date. With a design reminiscent of premium competitors like Peloton and NordicTrack, Stryde offers a few unique features that let it stand out on its own &#8212; including the fact it costs some hundreds of dollars cheaper at just $1,550.</p><p>First is its content strategy. Like almost any connected bike, <a href=\"https://www.strydebike.com/the-bike\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Stryde</a> comes with an 22-inch on-board touchscreen tablet that's able to stream workouts via a companion smartphone application. After signing up for a $30 per month membership, you're able to stream any of its hundreds of on-demand classes filmed at spin studios across the country. Though the production value may not be on par with what Peloton offers, the classes are still impressive and deliver tough workouts.&#160;</p><p>But the Stryde app and its workouts aren't the only thing you're able to access on the tablet &#8212; it also allows for complete internet access. This means you're able to check your email, listen to music, and (perhaps most enticing) stream video services like Netflix or Hulu. Need to catch up on season 3 of <em>Ozark</em>? Do it while pedaling your way to your daily cardio. Put plainly, the tablet's internet access is a game changer.&#160;</p><p>If you're a fan of the more highly-produced content from Peloton or the globe-spanning workouts native to NordicTrack's iFit, then <a href=\"https://www.strydebike.com/the-bike\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Stryde</a> may not be the best fit. However, with its ability to stream other workout apps and services like Netflix or Hulu, as well as the fact it comes with a wallet-friendly price (for connected fitness equipment, that is), it's worth considering for anyone in the market for an at-home exercise bike.&#160;</p>\n\tThe best pedal exerciser\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5aa036ef2d6d0216078b45c4?format=jpeg\" alt=\"vive bike\" height=\"1125\" width=\"1500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">VIVE</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>The <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00W46YILA/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_030818_best-exercise-bikes-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B00W46YILA&#38;linkId=b5b5a0559c9b927f895fa5fd465302ae\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">VIVE Pedal Exerciser</a> is small enough to tuck away under a desk or table, letting you pedal away and burn calories and tone your legs and core at any time.</h3><p><strong>Pros: </strong>Compact and portable, works legs or arms, low cost, low impact exercise</p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>Not as effective a workout as a standard stationary bike</p><p>No, the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00W46YILA/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_030818_best-exercise-bikes-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B00W46YILA&#38;linkId=b5b5a0559c9b927f895fa5fd465302ae\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">VIVE Pedal Exerciser</a> is not a stationary bike, exactly. But the type of exercise it fosters and the benefits therein gained are quite similar to those achieved with a standard exercise bike, and this from a unit that costs a fraction of the price and stows away in any home, office, dorm room, or that can be loaded into the trunk of a car and brought along on the road.</p><p>At just 12.5-inches in height, the VIVE Pedal Cruiser slips under a desk or table with ease, allowing you to exercise while you work, watch TV, read, surf the web, or any of the other countless activities we do while seated in the course of our modern lives. An LCD screen set into the compact unit tracks metrics including RPMs, speed, distance, and approximate calories burned.</p><p>But perhaps the best thing about this unique pedal machine is that it doesn't have to be used only as an under-desk leg exerciser; the VIVE Pedal Exerciser can also be set up on your desk or table for an arm workout. Just grab the pedals with your hands, set the right resistance level, and spin away to build arm muscles and burn calories as part of a complete body workout.</p>\n\tThe best budget exercise bike\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5aa035c0d7321a1c008b45fd?format=jpeg\" alt=\"exercise bike 2\" height=\"600\" width=\"800\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Marcy Recumbent</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>The <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B002KV1MJU/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_030818_best-exercise-bikes-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B002KV1MJU&#38;linkId=727fc7c57eb5c1b7e4a02e6385011db1\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Marcy Recumbent Mag Cycle exercise bike</a> costs less than half the price of many similar bikes without notable loss of quality.</h3><p><strong>Pros: </strong>Great low price, easy to mount and dismount, quiet operation</p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>Computer is basic and limited</p><p>Let's be clear here: the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B002KV1MJU/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_030818_best-exercise-bikes-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B002KV1MJU&#38;linkId=727fc7c57eb5c1b7e4a02e6385011db1\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Marcy Recumbent Mag Cycle</a> is a pretty basic stationary bike. The onboard \"computer\" tracks time, speed, distance, and approximates likely calories burned, but it's not going to offer you customizable workout programs as you get with many more advanced, expensive exercise bikes. But what this low-cost bike will do is help you burn calories, lose weight, and tone your muscles, which is all those other bikes do anyway, just with fancier features.</p><p>The Marcy Recumbent Mag Cycles offers eight different intensities of magnetic resistance, so it suits people of varying fitness levels. Using these eight settings, you can create your own workout program by switching up the difficulty during the session. While in operation, the Marcy Recumbent bike is quiet and stable, suitable for use while you watch TV or with kids sleeping in the room next door.</p><p>While this is a more basic option than many exercise bikes, its low cost makes it a great choice for those on a budget or who aren't sure they'll use it much and thus hesitant to make a large investment.</p>\n\tThe best folding exercise bike\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5aa0364b58e92e26008b45ed?format=jpeg\" alt=\"exercise bike 3\" height=\"600\" width=\"800\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">XTERRA</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>The <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B01LYFWKMH/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_030818_best-exercise-bikes-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B01LYFWKMH&#38;linkId=1f6613efd68c0d9eaebdf07b1c830238\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">XTERRA FB150 Folding Exercise Bike</a> provides a fine cardio workout when it's set up for use, then folds away into a compact package.</h3><p><strong>Pros: </strong>Compact bike folds away for storage, low price tag, easy assembly</p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>Too small for many users</p><p>Ironically, the best thing about the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B01LYFWKMH/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_030818_best-exercise-bikes-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B01LYFWKMH&#38;linkId=1f6613efd68c0d9eaebdf07b1c830238\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">XTERRA FB150 Folding Exercise Bike</a> is how little you'll see of it most of the time. When folded up, this bike occupies just 17-inches by 18-inches of floor space, so it can be stuffed in a closet, tucked behind a door, or even laid flat and slid beneath a bed that sits well above the ground.</p><p>Not only can you stash this folding stationary bike just about anywhere, but you can use it almost anywhere, too. Even when deployed for use, the bike measures only 18-inches wide and 32-inches in length, so it will fit even in a smaller room.</p><p>The XTERRA FB150 Folding Exercise Bike has an adjustable padded seat so it can accommodate riders of varied height, and its curved, multi-grip handlebars allow you to grasp on wherever is most comfortable. When you take hold of the pulse grips set at the sides of the handlebars, you can keep track of your heart rate, helping you achieve ideal cardio intensity.</p><p>The bike's small onboard computer also tracks time, speed, distance, and calories burned. A simple dial adjusts the resistance difficulty, which is spread across eight settings.</p>\n\tThe best exercise bike for comfort\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e6fbeb7c485405ccc667282?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Exerpeutic 5000\" height=\"1125\" width=\"1500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Amazon</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>From its padded armrests and seat cushion to an ergonomic backrest and customizable workouts, the <strong><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0844XJZB6/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_030818_best-exercise-bikes-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B0844XJZB6&#38;linkId=0438469e770946ef9613de21055d13a6\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow sponsored\">Exerpeutic 5000 Magnetic Recumbent Bike</a></strong> proves you can burn calories in comfort.</h3><p><strong>Pros: </strong>Comfortable seat design, multiple fitness programs, large weight capacity</p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>Poor manual makes initial setup frustrating</p><p>Who said a fat-blasting cardio workout session had to be unpleasant? No one who's ever eased themselves into the plush seat of the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0844XJZB6/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_030818_best-exercise-bikes-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B0844XJZB6&#38;linkId=0438469e770946ef9613de21055d13a6\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow sponsored\">Exerpeutic 5000 Magnetic Recumbent Bike</a>, certainly.</p><p>This superlative home exercise stationary bike has a generously padded seat that cradles your core while promoting airflow, a mesh backrest that offers plenty of support while keeping you cool, and padded armrests to keep your elbows and forearms comfortable as you churn away at the bike's magnetic tension system.</p><p>The <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0844XJZB6/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_030818_best-exercise-bikes-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B0844XJZB6&#38;linkId=0438469e770946ef9613de21055d13a6\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Exerpeutic 5000</a>&#160;offers 24 different levels of tension, so whether you're just starting to exercise for the first time in years or you're looking for a way to stay fit between century rides, this bike will offer just the right level of challenge for you.</p><p>It also comes with 12 workout programs, so you can tailor your exercise sessions to suit your fitness goals and your personal preferences. While you're using the bike, an onboard computer will track metrics including distance, RPMs, your heart rate, and even the watts of power generated.</p><p>And while this is a larger bike that will take up some room in the home, it's lightweight enough to be rolled into the corner (or the garage) after each use.</p>\n\tHow to shop for an exercise bike\n\t\n\t<p>It makes sense why exercise bikes are so popular. On those days when it's too cold for a run or when there's no time for a trip to the gym, a home exercise bike is <a href=\"https://www.insider.com/benefits-of-cycling\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">a great way to get your heart rate up</a> and your leg muscles pumping. When you utilize its various seated and standing positions, as well as the interval training approach of a spin class, you can even get what amounts to a total body workout.</p><p>Compared to larger cardio machines like an elliptical trainer or <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-treadmill\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">treadmill</a>, many exercise bikes are relatively affordable and compact. Some even fold away to stash in a closet or under the bed.</p><p>When shopping for an exercise bike, you'll want to keep in mind a few important features. First, consider the bike's&#160;<strong>size</strong>. Whether you have a dedicated workout room or want to slide the bike into your living room/kitchen (i.e. you live in a studio apartment), size matters. Thankfully, most exercise bikes are much smaller than treadmills, so there likely won't be as much of a logistics headache with these.&#160;</p><p>You'll also want to decide whether you want a <strong>connected bike</strong> outfit with a suite of on-demand, streamable classes, or something a little more basic that's just a seat, some handlebars, and a pair of pedals attached to a resistance wheel. Connected bikes do tend to run quite a bit more in terms of price, but offer a deep library of workout classes and fitness tracking.&#160;</p><p>Finally, don't forget about <strong>budget</strong>. The connected bikes mentioned above often come with price tags in the thousands of dollars while the more basic, non-digital options may run you a few hundred (and still do well to deliver a worthy session of cardio exercise).&#160;</p><p>Our guide includes exercise bikes to fit every budget and every home. Some are small enough to tuck under a desk, while others require a few square feet of real estate. But all of the stationary cycles included will help you hit those cardio fitness and weight management goals.</p>\n\tSee more great fitness guides\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f73a4f90ab50d00184ad280?format=jpeg\" alt=\"workout home\" height=\"1413\" width=\"1885\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Benjamin Torode/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<ul class=\"summary-list\"><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-resistance-bands\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">The best resistance +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5eb04fac57853205806f8295?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"09d928155d96f66e1f7e566c09eeb001","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn64@2020_3/2020/12/03/02-48-48-674_487a290c58558f79.webp","destWidth":800,"destHeight":600,"sourceBytes":17692,"destBytes":17692,"author":"stevenjohn23@gmail.com (Steven John,Rick Stella)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5e00f3c1855cc264c9388e92?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn75@2020_2/2020/12/03/02-48-56-805_0485f17d5410481b.webp","https://i.insider.com/5e6fbd5ec485405a95604035?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn44@2020_3/2020/12/03/02-48-58-070_176afe09d1952757.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f6906e9323fc4001e0d7967?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn92@2020_1/2020/12/03/02-48-57-042_92d571501a91c74b.webp","https://i.insider.com/5aa036ef2d6d0216078b45c4?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn55@2020_4/2020/12/03/02-49-00-527_aba953da53becc55.webp","https://i.insider.com/5aa035c0d7321a1c008b45fd?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn52@2020_1/2020/12/03/02-48-59-868_9c0c1dc98c46f9f6.webp","https://i.insider.com/5aa0364b58e92e26008b45ed?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn36@2020_1/2020/12/03/02-48-53-896_490d7b3b3ad4b57c.webp","https://i.insider.com/5e6fbeb7c485405ccc667282?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn20@2020_4/2020/12/03/02-49-02-066_f55829294c065a23.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f73a4f90ab50d00184ad280?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn36@2020_4/2020/12/03/02-49-02-874_a11843c73f8731fc.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn3@2020_2/2020/12/03/02-49-00-176_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=mNuBuS-j0CI:7vk21tq134w:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn92@2020_4/2020/12/03/02-48-53-878_6f44a7b88997c619.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=mNuBuS-j0CI:7vk21tq134w:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn39@2020_2/2020/12/03/02-48-52-284_a7e632b5adc151d2.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn99@2020_3/2020/12/03/02-48-56-007_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=mNuBuS-j0CI:7vk21tq134w:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn39@2020_4/2020/12/03/02-49-00-414_a4cdc576eb9ea24a.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/mNuBuS-j0CI":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn83@2020_4/2020/12/03/02-49-00-723_d82ad0dda44d5297.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1606963709988},{"createdTime":"2020-12-03 10:48:30","updatedTime":"2020-12-03 10:48:30","title":"Here's what's in the 2015 nuclear deal with Iran that Trump abandoned and Biden pledged to restore","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/iran-nuclear-deal-explained","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5af32cb760883622008b47ff?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Trump Iran deal signed\" height=\"977\" width=\"1954\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Donald Trump holds up a copy of the memorandum he signed, enacting a US departure from the Iran deal.\n<p class=\"copyright\">AP</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>President Donald Trump withdrew the US from the Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action (JCPOA), also known as the Iran nuclear deal, in May 2018.</li>\n<li>The Iran deal was one of the crowning diplomatic achievement's of former President Barack Obama's tenure, but has continued to be a divisive issue in Washington since it came to fruition in 2015.</li>\n<li>Withdrawing the US from the deal was one of the biggest and most controversial foreign policy decisions Trump has made yet.</li>\n<li>Since Trump withdrew the US from the JCPOA, tensions between the US and Iran have steadily risen and reached a boiling point in the early days of 2020, sparking fears of war.&#160;</li>\n<li>Iran on January 5 announced it would <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/iran-fully-withdrawing-2015-nuclear-deal-amid-tensions-with-us-2020-1\">no longer adhere to the 2015 nuclear deal</a>, just days after Trump ordered a strike that killed its top general.&#160;</li>\n<li>President-elect Joe Biden has vowed to return the US to the deal, but it won't be an easy task.</li>\n<li>The assassination of an Iranian nuclear scientist in late November has complicated Biden's plans to restore the deal.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit BusinessInsider.com for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>President Donald Trump in May 2018 announced the US government is withdrawing from the Iran nuclear agreement, which marked one of the biggest foreign policy decisions he's made since entering the White House.&#160;</p><p>Trump's decision was highly controversial, especially given three of America's top allies – France, Germany and the UK – were strongly opposed to this move.&#160;&#160;</p><p>Tensions between the US and Iran have reached historic heights during the Trump era, which can be traced back to his decision to withdraw from the 2015 agreement.</p><p>President-elect Joe Biden has pledged to return to the deal, but he faces a tough, windy road ahead in pursuit of rescuing the agreement.&#160;</p><p>Since Trump withdrew the US from the deal, his administration has pummeled Iran with crippling economic sanctions. Simultaneously, Iran has accused the US of waging <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/iran-top-diplomat-javad-zarif-us-trump-economic-war-2019-6\">\"economic war\"</a> and repeatedly rejected proposals from Trump to hold talks unless the US lifts sanctions and returns to the deal, perpetuating an impasse that is making the wider world increasingly nervous.</p><p>Iran has also gradually taken steps away from the pact in response to Trump's \"maximum pressure\" campaign.</p><p>Critics of Trump say that his decision to abandon the pact unnecessarily <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/iran-nuclear-deal-defiance-trump-maximum-pressure-failing-2019-9\">sparked a global crisis and increased the prospect of war</a>, while pushing Iran closer to developing a nuclear weapon.&#160;</p><p>The president has frequently described the deal as \"terrible,\" and while the pact has many proponents, he is hardly alone in this view.</p><p>The Iran deal was one of the crowning diplomatic achievements of former President Barack Obama's tenure, but it has continued to be a divisive issue in Washington since it came to fruition in 2015.&#160;</p><p>To understand the polarizing nature of this deal, why Trump's decision continues to face criticism, and the geopolitical implications of both the US and Iran are stepping away from it, here's a quick breakdown of the historic pact and the debate surrounding it.&#160;</p><h2>The Iran deal, explained</h2><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5af32ccc4e868818008b47b7?format=jpeg\" alt=\"iran deal\" height=\"1200\" width=\"1600\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Former US Secretary of State John Kerry, left, meets with Iranian Foreign Minister Mohammad Javad Zarif in 2016.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"http://www.apimages.com/metadata/Index/United-States-Iran-Meeting/7e2bf8ac50994c2084e4d90598f86eb8/19/0\" target=\"_blank\">Frank Franklin II/AP</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>In July 2015, Iran and six countries reached a historic agreement called the&#160;Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action (JCPOA), popularly known as the Iran nuclear deal.&#160;</p><p>The six major powers involved in these negotiations with Iran were known as the&#160;P5+1, which stands for the United Nations security council's five permanent members (the US, France, the UK, China, and Russia) and Germany.&#160;&#160;</p><p>The deal came together after two years of intense discussions and aimed to restrict Iran's ability to develop nuclear weapons in exchange for lifting economic sanctions against Tehran.&#160;</p><p>As part of the deal, Iran agreed to reduce its number of centrifuges — tube-shaped machines that help enrich uranium — by two-thirds. It also agreed to reduce its stockpile of enriched uranium by 98% and limit uranium enrichment to 3.67%.</p><p>In other words, Tehran agreed to restrictions that would allow it to have enough enriched uranium to maintain the country's energy needs, without having the ability to build a nuclear bomb.&#160;</p><p>On top of this, Iran agreed to give access to inspectors from the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA), the UN's nuclear watchdog agency, to its nuclear facilities, among other facilities. Prior to Trump's decision to withdraw from the deal and for a long period after, the IAEA repeatedly found Iran to be complying with the terms of the pact.&#160;</p><p>In January 2016, when the IAEA declared Iran was living up to its end of the bargain, <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2016/01/17/world/middleeast/iran-sanctions-lifted-nuclear-deal.html\">all nuclear-related international sanctions against Iran were lifted</a>.</p><h2>The controversy surrounding the Iran deal, explained</h2><p>Iran and the US have been <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/why-the-us-iran-have-been-adversaries-roughly-four-decades-2020-1\">enemies for decades</a>. The two countries have an extremely complex history that involved a CIA-orchestrated coup in the 1950s, a pro-American puppet monarch who was overthrown in 1979 via the Islamic revolution, and the infamous hostage crisis at the US embassy in Tehran that followed the uprising.</p><p>The constant threats from Iranian leaders against Israel, America's top ally in the Middle East, and chants of \"death to America\" in Iranian streets have also not helped matters.&#160;</p><p>In this context, there is a massive distrust for Iran in the US (and vice versa), and Washington has long feared what might happen if the Iranian regime developed a nuclear weapon. Iran made great strides in this regard by the 2010s, hence the Obama administration's efforts to orchestrate the nuclear deal. When the pact was finally settled in 2015, it was widely celebrated as a major diplomatic achievement.&#160;</p><p>But many (primarily conservative) leaders in Washington still felt the Iran nuclear deal didn't go far enough to limit the country's ability to develop nuclear weapons.&#160;</p><p>This is because the Iran deal contains <a href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/monkey-cage/wp/2018/04/25/trump-doesnt-like-the-iran-deals-sunset-provisions-heres-how-to-fix-that/?noredirect=on&utm_term=.ea57d961a93ea93e\">sunset clauses</a>, or parts of the agreement that will ultimately expire. Under the deal, the restrictions on Iran's centrifuges go away after 10 years (in 2025) and the limitations on uranium enrichment disappear five years after that (2030). Hence, there are fears that once these restrictions expire, Iran could rapidly develop a nuclear weapon.&#160;</p><p>\"It is clear to me that we cannot prevent an Iranian nuclear bomb under the decaying and rotten structure of the current agreement,\" <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2018/05/08/us/politics/trump-speech-iran-deal.html\">Trump said</a> in May 2018. \"The Iran deal is defective at its core. If we do nothing we know exactly what will happen.\"</p><p>More broadly, Trump, among others, has argued the deal didn't do enough to address Iran's regional behavior or its missile program. Accordingly, the president wants to negotiate a new deal with Tehran.&#160;</p><h2>Iran withdrew from the nuclear deal amid fears of war with the US in early 2020</h2><p>Trump's unilateral decision to withdraw the US from the JCPOA in May 2018 was promptly condemned by US allies, who have scrambled to find a diplomatic solution ever since. On January 5, Iran announced it's withdrawing from the JCPOA.&#160;</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">&#8212;Emmanuel Macron  (@EmmanuelMacron) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/993920765060878336?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">May 8, 2018</a></blockquote><script async src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p>&#160;</p><p>For roughly a year after Trump's controversial announcement, Iran remained in compliance with the JCPOA. But the Iranian government in early June 2019 announced it would break from a key component of the JCPOA by ramping up its enrichment of low-grade uranium and increasing its stockpile beyond the limitations outlined in the deal.&#160;</p><p>Making good on this threat, Iran in July 2019 announced it had surpassed the deal's cap on how much low-grade uranium it could stockpile — <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/iran-breaches-uranium-stockpile-limit-jcpoa-sunset-clause-2030-2019-7\">300 kg or about 660 pounds.</a> It also announced it had breached the deal's limitation on uranium enrichment — 3.67% — but has <a href=\"https://www.iaea.org/sites/default/files/19/07/govinf2019-9.pdf\">only enriched up to 4.5%</a> and far below weapons-grade levels.&#160;</p><p>In September 2019, Iran <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/iran-taking-big-step-allows-faster-development-of-nuclear-weapons-2019-9\">took yet another big step away</a> from the deal when it announced it would begin developing more advanced centrifuges that allow for more rapid uranium enrichment. Iran also said it was lifting all limits on research and development. Wendy Sherman, who served as the Obama administration's lead negotiator on the JCPOA, described this move to Insider as of <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/iran-nuclear-deal-defiance-trump-maximum-pressure-failing-2019-9\">\"serious concern.\"</a></p><p>\"It's all concerning, because it's moving away from a framework that ensured Iran would not get a nuclear weapon,\" Sherman said. \"Iran is not just being emboldened but is being left in some ways to take actions that say they will not be pushed back. We are at a very, very difficult place.\"</p><p>Iran in early November 2019 announced it was taking a fourth step away from the 2015 nuclear deal — injecting uranium gas into 1,044 centrifuges that had been kept empty under the terms of the agreement.</p><h2>2020 has dealt serious blows to the JCPOA</h2><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ee102d35af6cc51f03a31a2?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Soleimani stock photo 1800px Tehran after assassination Qassem\" height=\"1200\" width=\"1800\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>An Iranian holds a photograph of Qassem Soleimani in Tehran after his assassination.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Reuters</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>The 2015 deal virtually collapsed entirely following Trump's decision to order a deadly strike on Iran's top general, Qassem Soleimani, in early January.&#160;</p><p>In the days that followed the strike, the Iranian government said it will no longer comply with any of the limits of the deal, including restrictions on uranium enrichment, its amount of stockpiled uranium, and research and development.&#160;</p><p>But Iran also said it will continue to cooperate with the International Atomic Energy Agency, the United Nations' nuclear watchdog, and would return to the nuclear agreement if sanctions against it were lifted,&#160;<a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/05/world/middleeast/Iran-us-trump.html?smtyp=cur&smid=tw-nytimesimes\">according to the New York Times.</a>&#160;</p><p>In early November, the UN's nuclear watchdog reported that Iran's stockpile of low-enriched uranium was more than 12 times the limit set under the JCPOA. The IAEA said Iran's stockpile was up to 2,443 kilograms, but under the 2015 deal the cap was set at 203 kilograms. Iran's uranium was enriched up to 4.5%, which is far below weapons-grade levels of roughly 90%, but <a href=\"https://apnews.com/article/europe-iran-united-nations-de8772e3b88bdcbacbe98d1062d25c15\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"80\" data-uri=\"f2718dcfffc713f9aa019ef62754aad5\">above</a> the 3.67% limit set by the JCPOA.</p><p>Subsequently, Trump reportedly asked top advisers for options to strike Iran's primary nuclear facility, but was urged against taking an action that could spark a broader conflict with his time in the White House waning.&#160;</p><p>The assassination of Mohsen Fakhrizadeh, a top Iranian nuclear scientist, in late November has ramped up tensions between the US and Iran once again.</p><p>Iran has blamed Fakhrizadeh's killing on Israel, which is America's closest ally in the Middle East. Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has been a leading critic of the JCPOA. Top experts have said Israel was likely behind the assassination, and a former US diplomat told Insider there are \"ample\" reasons to suspect US involvement — including Trump's desire to derail the JCPOA.&#160;</p><p>Fakhrizadeh was widely regarded as the \"father\" of Iran's nuclear program. In the days following his assassination, Iranian lawmakers took steps to further distance the country from the 2015 deal, <a href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-iran-nuclear-law/iran-watchdog-passes-law-on-hardening-nuclear-stance-halting-u-n-inspections-idUSKBN28C2F7\">including moving toward halting UN inspections of nuclear sites.</a></p><h2>Biden wants to restore the deal, but has admitted it won't be easy</h2><p>The president-elect has consistently expressed a desire to return to the 2015 nuclear deal.&#160;</p><p>\"If Iran returns to strict compliance with the nuclear deal, the United States would rejoin the agreement as a starting point for follow-on negotiations,\" Biden said in <a href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/09/13/opinions/smarter-way-to-be-tough-on-iran-joe-biden/index.html\">a September op-ed</a> for CNN.</p><p>More recently, he told the New York Times that he knows it will be \"hard\" to restore the deal, but that he still believes rescuing the pact and restricting Iran's nuclear program is \"the best way to achieve getting some stability in the region.\"</p><p>\"The last goddamn thing we need in that part of the world is a buildup of nuclear capability,\" <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/12/02/opinion/biden-interview-mcconnell-china-iran.html\">Biden said.</a></p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/Y2C5RvCaF-o\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Wed, 02 Dec 2020 22:15:09 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5af32d7a640c8b28008b47c0?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"1d161603d8a5a0172732ec33231cfd32","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn52@2020_2/2020/12/03/02-49-09-436_f73f46f27a6a20df.webp","destWidth":1956,"destHeight":1467,"sourceBytes":110926,"destBytes":110926,"author":"insider@insider.com (John Haltiwanger)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5af32cb760883622008b47ff?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn7@2020_3/2020/12/03/02-48-54-245_3cb3c74d5f389ce7.webp","https://i.insider.com/5af32ccc4e868818008b47b7?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn100@2020_2/2020/12/03/02-48-51-130_878a0feae821cb93.webp","https://i.insider.com/5ee102d35af6cc51f03a31a2?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn27@2020_1/2020/12/03/02-49-03-556_db39d7271ec6d7d9.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn3@2020_2/2020/12/03/02-49-00-176_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Y2C5RvCaF-o:E44w68y_UOs:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn95@2020_5/2020/12/03/02-49-01-031_4e8aa44c0c55d797.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Y2C5RvCaF-o:E44w68y_UOs:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn31@2020_3/2020/12/03/02-48-56-333_029209201fa6b1ac.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn99@2020_3/2020/12/03/02-48-56-007_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Y2C5RvCaF-o:E44w68y_UOs:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn88@2020_3/2020/12/03/02-49-02-655_3d30d0374a34bbcf.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/Y2C5RvCaF-o":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn64@2020_4/2020/12/03/02-49-02-955_40dacc583fbc420b.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1606963710044},{"createdTime":"2020-12-03 10:48:30","updatedTime":"2020-12-03 10:48:30","title":"Trump retweeted a Nevada doctor's selfie to push the false claim that COVID-19 is a hoax. But the photo actually showed him in a new and still unused hospital-care site.","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/nevada-doctor-hospital-selfie-trump-covid-19-hoax-2020-12","description":"<p><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-downplays-covid-19-while-announcing-hell-leave-hospital-2020-10\"><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fc7b4dd50e71a0011558651?format=jpeg\" alt=\"jacob keeperman\" height=\"1538\" width=\"2048\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Dr. Jacob Keeperman, the Renown Transfer and Operations Center medical director snapped a photo on the opening day the center&#39;s alternative care site in a parking garage.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Jacob Keeperman via AP</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></a></p><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>A Nevada doctor posted a selfie on Twitter at a newly opened hospital care site, commiserating with fellow frontline medical workers and urging them to \"stay strong.\"</li>\n<li>On Tuesday, President Donald Trump shared Dr. Jacob Keeperman's post but in an attempt to falsely portray COVID-19 as a hoax.</li>\n<li>A Renown Regional Medical Center spokesperson told Insider that the picture was taken at a&#160;makeshift care site &#8212; which is located in a parking garage &#8212; on the day it opened and before any patients arrived.&#160;</li>\n<li>\"It is really demoralizing to everybody who is out working so hard to have this politicized and polarized so much,\" Keeperman told the Associated Press.</li>\n<li>Trump also drew the ire of Nevada Gov. Steve Sisolak who said in a statement that the president's \"consistent misleading rhetoric on COVID-19 is dangerous and reckless.\"</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>After a difficult week treating coronavirus patients at a hospital in Reno, Nevada, a doctor posted a selfie on Twitter to thank his fellow health care workers and lift their spirits.</p><p>What Dr. Jacob Keeperman didn't anticipate, however, was President Donald Trump sharing that photo to push the claim that COVID-19 is a hoax.</p><p>\"With 5 deaths in the last 32 hours, everyone is struggling to keep their head-up,\" Keeperman, of Renown Regional Medical Center, <a href=\"https://twitter.com/critcare_airems/status/1333188592026337282?s=20\">tweeted</a> on November 29. \"Stay strong.\"</p><p>Donned in personal protective equipment, Keeperman snapped the picture at the center's new makeshift care site, which is located in a parking garage. It was taken on the site's opening day on November 12 before any coronavirus patients arrived, a Renown spokesperson told Insider.&#160;</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">&#8212;Jacob Keeperman  (@critcare_airems) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1333188592026337282?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">November 29, 2020</a></blockquote><script async src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p>The image was later reposted by a Twitter user, Networkinvegas, with numerous false claims, and added to a frenzy of conspiracy theories and denial about COVID-19.&#160;</p><p>\"Here is the fake Nevada parking garage hospital picture that our moron governor tweeted, proving it's all a scam,\" <a href=\"https://twitter.com/Networkinvegas/status/1333569355741679616\">the tweet said</a>. \"No patients, folded up beds, wrapped up equipment that's never been used! They spent millions on this scam and never seen a single patient in this fake hospital!\"</p><p>Trump <a href=\"https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1333771177005867008\">retweeted</a> the post on Tuesday, garnering more than 95,000 likes and Keeperman's criticism.</p><p>\"It is really demoralizing to everybody who is out working so hard to have this politicized and polarized so much,\" Keeperman told the <a href=\"https://apnews.com/article/media-social-media-coronavirus-pandemic-reno-nevada-6d26d70305a1599bf3ce82bf874a9934\">Associated Press</a>. \"I am holding patients' hands when they take their very last breath because their loved ones can't be with them.\"</p><p>The alternative care site has served 219 coronavirus patients so far, the hospital told Insider.&#160;</p><p>Trump also added a baseless allegation to the tweet, writing, \"Fake election results in Nevada, also!\"&#160;In reality, there is <a href=\"https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1333771177005867008\">no evidence</a> that supports the president's claims that widespread voter fraud occurred in the 2020 presidential race. Nevada election officials <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/6-key-battleground-states-finalize-election-results-for-joe-biden-2020-11\">certified</a> President-elect Joe Biden as the state's winner on November 24.</p><p>Nevada Gov. Steve Sisolak denounced Trump for not only spreading false information but also attempting to \"politicize\" the virus.</p><p>\"His consistent misleading rhetoric on COVID-19 is dangerous and reckless,\" Sisolak said in a <a href=\"https://twitter.com/GovSisolak/status/1333835595102130176\">statement</a> on Tuesday, adding that the \"implication that Renown's alternative care site is a 'fake hospital' is among the worst examples we've seen.\"</p><p>\"It is unconscionable for him to continue to spread lies and sow distrust at a time when all Americans should be united during this historic public health crisis,\" Sisolak continued. \"Enough is enough.\"</p><p>The president has&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-repeatedly-downplayed-covid-19-after-telling-woodward-very-deadly-2020-9\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"60\" data-uri=\"6864a2cc2b01ee2b3a3dd3f185c22786\">routinely</a>&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-downplays-covid-19-while-announcing-hell-leave-hospital-2020-10\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"60\" data-uri=\"4d8e5d81238bd67d4caadd154aea5bea\">downplayed</a>&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/donald-trump-coronavirus-infections-records-health-campaign-election-2020-10\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"60\" data-uri=\"a5b2b19bcf23339aebdac427e892e459\">the severity</a> of the virus since the start of the pandemic. His administration has <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/org-chart-white-house-coronavirus-trump-inner-circle-2020-11\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"80\" data-uri=\"412e3eabf636f861cd8dd2b2beef67d3\">flouted</a> public health guidance from experts and scientists — about social distancing and mask wearing — and has faced backlash for its handling of the pandemic. As of Wednesday, the United States has surpassed 13.7 million infections and 272,000 deaths, based on data compiled by <a href=\"https://gisanddata.maps.arcgis.com/apps/opsdashboard/index.html#/bda7594740fd40299423467b48e9ecf6\">Johns Hopkins University</a>.&#160;</p><p>Nevada is currently experiencing a surge in cases across several counties, according to <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2020/us/nevada-coronavirus-cases.html\">The New York Times</a>. The state has seen a 28% uptick in confirmed infections over the past two weeks, with around 155,000 cases and over 2,100 deaths.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/nevada-doctor-hospital-selfie-trump-covid-19-hoax-2020-12'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/7sBWeCX-eLM\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Wed, 02 Dec 2020 19:07:00 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5fc7b4e3037cbd00186134fb?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"45134e04423b1a999491d3ae21b00486","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn68@2020_2/2020/12/03/02-48-48-776_4a75a65de52b5e37.webp","destWidth":2048,"destHeight":1536,"sourceBytes":131896,"destBytes":131896,"author":"oseddiq@insider.com (Oma Seddiq)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5fc7b4dd50e71a0011558651?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn75@2020_5/2020/12/03/02-48-52-792_9eb82fbd1a8c2a40.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn3@2020_2/2020/12/03/02-49-00-176_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=7sBWeCX-eLM:Squ1x6LKoxI:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn48@2020_4/2020/12/03/02-48-48-808_75c16805613cb1b5.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=7sBWeCX-eLM:Squ1x6LKoxI:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn24@2020_3/2020/12/03/02-48-54-423_1f37cc126fae6199.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn99@2020_3/2020/12/03/02-48-56-007_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=7sBWeCX-eLM:Squ1x6LKoxI:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn27@2020_1/2020/12/03/02-48-50-759_023e7cb1e31b2d28.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/7sBWeCX-eLM":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn24@2020_3/2020/12/03/02-48-57-226_da4e838b92682f35.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1606963710040},{"createdTime":"2020-12-03 10:48:30","updatedTime":"2020-12-03 10:48:30","title":"Trump's former national security advisor shared a message asking the president to suspend the Constitution, impose martial law, and hold a new election","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/michael-flynn-shares-message-trump-martial-law-2020-12","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5eb470f2e3c3fb15656b1b77?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Donald Trump Mike Flynn\" height=\"512\" width=\"1024\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">George Frey/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Former national security advisor Michael Flynn shared a message calling on President Donald Trump to invoke martial law and have the military hold a new election.</li>\n<li>The message was an ad from a right-wing activist group asking Trump to \"declare limited Martial Law to temporarily suspend the Constitution ... in order to have the military implement a national re-vote that reflects the true will of the people.\"</li>\n<li>Flynn shared the press release about the ad on Twitter, tagged several Trump-supporting lawyers and media personalities, and wrote, \"Freedom never kneels except for God.\"</li>\n<li>The president does not have the power to unilaterally cancel, delay, postpone, or change the date of an election even if he declares martial law, and declaring martial law does not suspend the Constitution.</li>\n<li>The military also has no role in administering elections, and even if it did, it could not \"implement a national re-vote\" because the right to vote is not specified in the Constitution or in a federal statute.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Former national security advisor Michael Flynn <a href=\"https://twitter.com/GenFlynn/status/1333916403389370369\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">shared an ad</a> this week calling on President Donald Trump to \"suspend the Constitution,\" declare martial law, and have the military hold a new election.</p><p>The ad came from Tom Zawistowski, the president of a right-wing Ohio activist group called the We the People Convention (WTPC). In the ad, Zawistowski asked Trump \"to exercise the Extraordinary Powers of his office and declare limited Martial Law to temporarily suspend the Constitution and civilian control of these federal elections in order to have the military implement a national re-vote that reflects the true will of the people.\"</p><p><strong>Fact check</strong></p><ul><li>Zawistowski's demand is not based in reality. The president does not have the power to unilaterally cancel, delay, postpone, or change the date of an election, even if he declares martial law. <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-cant-cancel-or-postpone-the-november-election-over-coronavirus-2020-3\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">As Business Insider previously reported</a>, that power lies with Congress.</li><li>Declaring martial law also does not suspend the Constitution, and the military has no role in administering elections. Even if it did, it would not be able to \"implement a national re-vote\" because the right to vote is not specified in the Constitution or by a federal statute.</li><li>The November general election also reflected the \"true will of the people.\" In addition to <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/2020-election-results\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">notching 306 Electoral College votes</a> (a candidate needs 270 to win), President-elect Joe Biden won the national popular vote, with nearly 81 million votes compared with Trump's 74 million.</li></ul><p>Flynn shared the WTPC ad in a tweet and tagged several Trump-supporting lawyers and media personalities. \"Freedom never kneels except for God,\" he wrote.</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">&#8212;General Flynn  (@GenFlynn) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1333916403389370369?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">December 1, 2020</a></blockquote><script async src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p>The former national security advisor was recently pardoned after pleading guilty to lying to the FBI as part of the bureau's investigation into Russia's interference in the 2016 US election.</p><p>Before that, Flynn was a frequent surrogate for Trump on the 2016 campaign trail and made headlines for encouraging chants of \"lock her up,\" referring to former Democratic presidential nominee Hillary Clinton, who has not been charged with any crime.</p><p>Now Flynn is one of several people in Trump's orbit who have amplified unfounded claims in recent weeks that the 2020 election was \"stolen\" from Trump, there was widespread voter fraud, and the Democratic Party conspired with \"big media\" to rig the election in Biden's favor.</p><p><strong>Fact check</strong></p><ul><li>There is no evidence to support these claims, and Trump's Department of Homeland Security has <a href=\"https://www.cisa.gov/rumorcontrol\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">a website dedicated to swatting them down</a>. In fact, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/2020-election-administration-was-successful-not-a-disaster-2020-11\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">as Business Insider has reported</a>, the 2020 election was the safest and most secure in US history because of the use of paper ballots and voting machines with verifiable paper trails.</li></ul><p>The Trump campaign and Republican officials have <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-campaign-lawsuits-election-results-2020-11\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">filed more than two dozen lawsuits</a> across the country seeking to nullify the election results by making vague and ambiguous allegations of electoral malfeasance. They haven't won a single case so far. And as of this week, the six battleground states that decided the election — Arizona, Nevada, Georgia, Michigan, Wisconsin, and Pennsylvania — <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/6-key-battleground-states-finalize-election-results-for-joe-biden-2020-11\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">have all certified their results</a>, confirming Biden's victory.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/michael-flynn-shares-message-trump-martial-law-2020-12'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=hJMEIpPzB9Q:AeAEVxExVWI:yIl2AUoC8zA\"><img
