src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=hJMEIpPzB9Q:AeAEVxExVWI:gIN9vFwOqvQ\" border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/hJMEIpPzB9Q\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Wed, 02 Dec 2020 20:41:34 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/59a2ed44ba785e1a852e683d?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"1a341008abe06ced2e9eed9750eab4ad","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn81@2020_5/2020/12/03/02-48-48-749_aae0b0a2bcd74866.webp","destWidth":910,"destHeight":683,"sourceBytes":39326,"destBytes":39326,"author":"ssheth@businessinsider.com (Sonam Sheth)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5eb470f2e3c3fb15656b1b77?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn35@2020_3/2020/12/03/02-48-56-351_cd0868d80b922858.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn3@2020_2/2020/12/03/02-49-00-176_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=hJMEIpPzB9Q:AeAEVxExVWI:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn75@2020_6/2020/12/03/02-48-54-760_480c88efc9b8144e.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=hJMEIpPzB9Q:AeAEVxExVWI:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn39@2020_2/2020/12/03/02-49-02-863_6416c44bbdde3e77.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn99@2020_3/2020/12/03/02-48-56-007_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=hJMEIpPzB9Q:AeAEVxExVWI:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn60@2020_6/2020/12/03/02-48-54-582_11ac95f95ce76780.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/hJMEIpPzB9Q":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn52@2020_1/2020/12/03/02-48-56-535_3f86290311ec4cd3.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1606963710002},{"createdTime":"2020-12-03 10:48:30","updatedTime":"2020-12-03 10:48:30","title":"Where to buy the best-tasting, highest-quality seafood online","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/online-seafood-delivery","description":"<p class=\"financial-disclaimer\"><i>When you buy through our links, we may earn money from our affiliate partners. <a href=\"https://www.insider-inc.com/commerce-on-insider-inc/\">Learn more.</a></i></p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ebc0ff0fc593d02e70c2633?format=jpeg\" alt=\"seafood lead\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Olesia Shadrina/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>Navigating the e-commerce world for fresh, high-quality seafood is full of obstacles and trepidation, and the last thing you want is to end up with overpriced and weeks- or months-old fish at a premium price.</li><li>We spent eight months sifting through the world of online seafood suppliers to find the best ones.</li><li>Whether you're after subscription, bulk, or something different, you'll found options for fish, lobster, crab, shrimp, and more.</li><li><a href=\"https://newsletter.businessinsider.com/join/4np/insider-picks\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" data-stringify-link=\"https://newsletter.businessinsider.com/join/4np/insider-picks\" data-sk=\"tooltip_parent\">Sign up for Insider Reviews' weekly newsletter for more buying advice and great deals.</a></li></ul><bi-shortcode id=\"table-of-contents-sticky\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-type=\"h2\">Table of Contents: Masthead Sticky</bi-shortcode><p>Meat supplies and availability are in flux right now, and while it's not impossible to fetch a cut of beef or a pork shoulder online, many of us are looking to different sources of protein. One solution you might consider is adding more seafood to your diet.</p><p>The fisheries in the United States <a href=\"https://www.marketplace.org/2020/05/06/covid-19-amerian-seafood-commercial-fishing-industry/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">are in rough shape</a> right now too, but some companies are still making a go of it — especially on the direct-to-consumer side — and <a href=\"https://www.seafoodwatch.org/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">more sustainable options</a> are in good supply.&#160;</p><p>But you don't want to buy just anything. If fish isn't handled correctly, it tends to taste, well, fishy. As a former commercial and charter fisherman, as well as a raw-bar tender, I know good — and bad — fish when I see it. So, after eight months of testing some of the most popular places to buy seafood online, I've rounded up my favorites (and highlighted some particularly excellent selections from each).&#160;</p><p>Whether you're shopping in bulk for the family or looking for the freshest, highest-quality sushi-grade salmon money can buy, you'll find all the best options here, including ones for vegetarians and vegans. Yes, seaweed, also known as sea greens, is widely available, and full of flavor, vitamins, and protein. Plus, it's an up-and-coming superfood, don't you know.&#160;</p><p><em>*Note that some brands are currently experiencing delays, but they tend to be on a daily or weekly basis, so we won't note them here as things are rapidly changing. The good news from purveyors is that <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/meat-beef-industry-coronavirus-pandemic-small-scale-farms-2020-10\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">unlike meat</a>, there's no shortage of fish.</em></p><h2><strong>Where to buy seafood online</strong></h2>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tSitka Salmon Shares\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5eeb7bfc3f737004e8750d33?format=jpeg\" alt=\"sitkasalmon\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Owen Burke/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Sitka Salmon Shares works like a community-supported agricultural (CSA) co-op, only with fish, otherwise known as a community-supported fishery (CSF). Members can enroll at three-, six-, and nine-month intervals and receive their monthly share (with no-contact delivery). Depending on the size of the box you decide upon, prices per pound will range from $18 to $28, and monthly shares start at $119 per month.</p><p>That's just shy of what you'll pay in most markets for fresh black cod, and a good deal less than what you'd pay for fresh, wild halibut or salmon (which is often frozen and thawed). The benefit for you is that Sitka Salmon Shares' fish is blast-frozen at -50 degrees Fahrenheit and expertly vacuum-sealed, so you can confidently load everything into your freezer and expect it to stay free of freezer burn and oxidation, which happen when there's water or air trapped inside the bag.</p><p>The benefit for the fishermen is that by working within the cooperative, they're getting paid more than they would if they were selling their fish to processing plants &#8212; Sitka Salmon Shares has its own processing plant, and a strict set of handling processes, leaving you with higher quality fish than you might get at a large-scale processing plant.</p><p>You also get what's in season, and won't be receiving last year's salmon just because that's the number one Alaskan fish everyone knows and loves. Throughout the course of a year, you'll receive salmon, yes, but also black cod, lingcod, halibut, prawns, and Dungeness crab.</p><p>We tried Sitka Salmon Shares in early June and received a box of halibut, black cod, and lingcod, which were the species running at the time. Halibut is a coveted fish that often goes for $40 a pound in New York, so the two roughly one-pound fillets we received already made up for over half of the cost of a box. The rest, which amounted to six half-pound-or-more fillets of black cod and lingcod &#8212; less sought-after fish &#8212; would probably fall more on the $18-a-pound side of the spectrum, but between all of the species overall, you're getting more and higher quality Alaskan seafood than you'd get at your typical grocery store fish counter for that price.</p><p>Lastly, Sitka Salmon Shares ships in some of the most sustainable packaging around, using corn-starch-based foam as opposed to styrofoam, which is wrapped in recycled #4 plastic bags and filled with dry ice. Everything arrived still solidly frozen and was immaculately sealed. We will hang on to a few of these until next year to see how they fare, but by the looks of the packaging, we're confident they'll last that long.</p><h3><a href=\"https://sitkasalmonshares.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Shop Sitka Salmon Shares</a></h3>\n\tCitarella\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f120a23f34d055dea5e85e8?format=jpeg\" alt=\"citarella\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Owen Burke/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>If you want fresh &#8212; not frozen &#8212; seafood delivered to your door no more than a few days out of the water, Citarella is your go-to. Sure, you'll pay for it, but everything comes fresh and expertly wrapped in wax paper, ready to eat. It's even patted dry and packaged with drying cloths so that when your fillets, prawns, or scallops arrive, they are ready to cook, or eat right away (we wasted no time with the scallops at my house, and had them raw, which is my definitive quality test for fresh seafood purveyors).</p><p>Apart from your run-of-the-mill snapper, flounder, grouper, clams, and striped bass, you'll find deep-sea and far-flung treasures such as tilefish and the organic Madagascar shrimp you see above. I'm usually not sold on fish farming for a number of reasons, but this is the first organic shrimp farm to get any attention out of Madagascar, Citarella owner and CEO Joe Gurrera assured me. \"I try to be as modern as I can be,\" he said. \"I'm the first person in this country to have these shrimp fresh. People sell them frozen, and not organic... I got my second shipment just before Covid-19.\"</p><p>I had to try them. They arrived with the fresh, glassy sheen I am accustomed to finding on shrimp I purchase from friends dockside, not the opaque, desiccated appearance of frozen, or once-frozen shrimp you find in the freezer aisles of megalithic supermarkets. Citarella's Madagascar shrimp are sweet, they offer a firm crunch (provided you cook them well), and the heads, if you're into that sort of thing, are divine. Also, there's no deveining necessary.</p><p>The bottom line with Citarella is that, yes, it's expensive, but if you don't want to leave your house, or if you happen to live hundreds or thousands of miles from the nearest coast, it is the best you're going to do across the board, hands down. You might find smaller purveyors with better prices for live lobster, or crabs, and in that case, go with them. There are a couple of those on this list. But if you want a little of everything, or a fillet of deep-sea fish as fresh as fresh can possibly be short of buying it off the dock (or catching it yourself) call upon Citarella and pay up. This sort of thing is a special-occasion purchase for most of us. Why risk botching it?</p><h3><a href=\"https://www.citarella.com/shop/shellfish-seafood\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Shop Citarella seafood</a></h3>\n\tCrowd Cow\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5eeb888619182410dd04df15?format=jpeg\" alt=\"crowdcow\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Chloe Seytre/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>You might not think to look to a brand called \"Crowd Cow\" for seafood, but lo and behold, we tested halibut, Maine lobster tails, and Icelandic-farmed Arctic Char (a healthy and far more sustainable alternative to farmed salmon), and everything was in spectacular shape.</p><p>And while Crowd Cow does not offer a large selection of seafood, we find that to be more comforting. Oftentimes, the more on a menu, the more likely it is that something isn't up to snuff.</p><p>The halibut was a little on the expensive side at over $16 for a 6-ounce fillet, but the two Arctic char fillets at $18 were a steal. The lobster tails, though on the smaller size (maybe about 4-5 ounces each) for $22 is an absolutely fair price, and while you can do better, you might not find better packaging. It's not the most eco-friendly stuff, with a thick plastic tray, but it seems to work better than the standard vacuum-sealed bag, for the most part.</p><p>Crowd Cow, like Sitka Salmon Shares, does use corn-starch-based foam and recycled plastic, as well as dry ice, to deliver your goods, though, which we appreciate far better than the run-of-the-mill styrofoam box, which needs to go.</p><p>Crowd Cow is also <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/where-to-buy-meat-online\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">one of our favorite places to buy beef</a>, which is organically raised.</p><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/crowd-cow-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Read our review of Crowd Cow</a></h3><h3><a href=\"https://shareasale.com/r.cfm?b=999&#38;u=1088116&#38;m=69866&#38;urllink=www.crowdcow.com%2Fseafood\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Shop Crowd Cow</a></h3>\n\tPeter's Florida Seafood\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fc7da2450e71a001155874a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"peters florida seafood\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Owen Burke/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>If it's Caribbean- or Florida-based seafood you're after, you'll have a tough time finding yellowtail snapper, gulf shrimp, or stone crab claws any fresher. Everything we tried (and more than 3,000 miles away from Florida, in San Francisco, at that) was expertly packaged and sealed, and arrived without a drop of air and minimal water inside.</p><p>We even ate the <a href=\"https://petersfloridaseafood.com/collections/shellfish/products/florida-royal-red-shrimp\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Florida Royal Red Shrimp</a> raw on your behalf, dear reader (highly recommended). The black grouper and butterflied yellowtail snapper hardly even needed a patting from a paper towel before going into the oven, and the shrimp were sweet and plump and clearly not previously frozen.</p><p>You can find plenty of frozen fish around, and there is any number of mongers willing and able to send your fresh (and not previously frozen) seafood at the tip of a hat. They will all cost you, of course, but where Peter's Florida Seafood shines is in its attention to the advantage of its locality. And while the purveyor does offer options from Alaska (and we imagine they're plenty fine), options like the yellowtail, the Florida Royal Red Shrimp (which are deep-dwelling cool-water crustaceans from off the coast of the Sunshine State), the stone crab claws, and the black grouper are specialties that attract us.</p><p>In short, save your live Maine lobster for a Maine-based purveyor, but when it comes to ordering tropical and subtropical species as fresh as fresh gets, look to Peter's.</p><h3><a href=\"https://petersfloridaseafood.com/collections/shellfish/products/florida-royal-red-shrimp\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Shop Peter's Florida Seafood</a></h3>\n\tSea to Table\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ebc27c8fc593d11c96baf23?format=jpeg\" alt=\"sea to table\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Owen Burke/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Sea to Table leaves you with the most information about your catch right on the label. You'll know exactly how and when your fish was caught, as well as where it was landed, and you'll get a very reasonable \"best by\" date.</p><p>We like how Sea to Table vacuum-seals cuts of seafood, too, with not a pocket of air or ice trapped inside. You'll find delicately-handled fillets and scallops, with nothing broken, nothing mangled, and no unsavory bits like oxidized meat or bloodline, which tend to be offensively pungent upon thawing (and don't do your health any favors either).</p><p>Sea to Table isn't just among the most accountable brand we found, it offers some of the more sustainability-minded catches. Think skate (an oft-overlooked finfish in the US; a delicacy across the Atlantic), Gulf of Maine redfish, and West Coast Dover sole. Try it all.</p><p>Of course, you can order all the salmon you want through the brand, but our favorite option is the Fish Lover's Box, which will get you two types of salmon, Pacific cod, Gulf of Maine Redfish, Skate, and West Coast Dover sole (12 six-ounce servings in all) for less than $90.</p><h3><a href=\"https://www.sea2table.com/shop/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Shop Sea to Table</a></h3>\n\tGet Maine Lobster\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ebc489c3dac9a0fb56cc295?format=jpeg\" alt=\"getmainelobster\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Owen Burke/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Get Maine Lobster deals in the freshest available seafood from Maine. It offers a small menu, but if you want the best and freshest lobster and/or scallops you can get your hands on without going down to the docks or hauling them up yourself, this is the place to shop.</p><p>Note that live lobsters arrive fresh, and not frozen (there are options for frozen seafood too). You will want to eat it the night it arrives or the night after that. (Though we did stretch the scallops for three days.)</p><p>Lobsters are plucked from the water the very morning of the day they're air-mailed to you &#8212; ours nearly kicked the box off the kitchen counter upon receipt &#8212; and tails are never more than a few days out of the water by the time you get them. The same goes for the scallops. I ate them raw and they were fresher than the ones I've had at most sushi bars.</p><p>You're going to pay a premium if you go with Get Maine Lobster, and while other brands' lobsters are flash-frozen and of high quality, Get Maine Lobster's offerings are undoubtedly the best and the freshest. The brand also touts being the only certified Fair Trade lobster purveyor on earth.&#160;</p><p>For a limited time, Get Maine Lobster is teaming up with Rtic Coolers to send out <a href=\"https://getmainelobster.com/search?q=rtic\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">lobster (live, frozen tails, lobster roll kits) in a Get Maine Lobster-embossed 8-can Rtic Cooler</a>.&#160;</p><h3><a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&#38;xs=1&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fgetmainelobster.com%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Shop Get Maine Lobster</a></h3>\n\tThrive Market\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ebc2761cdfd4801cc33e7a6?format=jpeg\" alt=\"thrive market seafood\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Owen Burke/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Thrive Market is a membership-based grocer that's almost like a small-scale, high-quality, web-based Costco. Most of the retailer's items come in bulk, making it a great option for families looking to stock up on seafood.</p><p>That being said, it's also handy for larger one-off purchases by individuals with enough freezer space &#8212; as long as they use the subscription for other grocery items to offset the $60 annual membership fee.</p><p>Standouts were the superbly peeled, deveined, and vacuum-sealed shrimp, and the salmon. The scallops aren't the best or the freshest you'll find, but they are flash-frozen, which means no excess water or chance for oxidization.</p><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/thrive-market-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Read our review of Thrive Market</a></h3><h3><a href=\"https://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/6415797/type/dlg/https://thrivemarket.com/c/seafood\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Shop Thrive Market</a></h3>\n\tWild Alaskan Company\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ebc4eb5cdfd481bc9356ad2?format=jpeg\" alt=\"wildalaskan\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Owen Burke/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Wild Alaskan Company is a monthly (or bi-monthly) subscription membership that offers a choice selection of wild-caught finfish from the waters off Alaska. Salmon (silver, king, or sockeye), white-fleshed fish (usually halibut or cod), or a combination of both will arrive in six-ounce, flash-frozen, individually-wrapped pieces.</p><p>Our favorite is the Wild White Fish Box. The fillets are perfectly packaged and vacuum-sealed, and as far as frozen seafood goes, it is top-notch.</p><p>The salmon, which is skin-on, has been a little hit and miss for us, and we've had several pieces arrive with the vacuum-sealed bag broken, resulting in brown and oxidized meat. This wasn't a reason to discard the fish or discount the brand &#8212; it happens from time to time, as vacuum-sealed bags can break in transit &#8212; but we encountered the same problem twice. However, other pieces of salmon from the same boxes turned out to be some of the best we tried.</p><p>Still, our favorite option is the Wild White Fish Box. These fish were skinless and perfectly filleted, and this is why we recommend Wild Alaskan Company.</p><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/wild-alaskan-company-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Read our review of Wild Alaskan Company</a></h3><h3><a href=\"https://wildalaskancompany.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Shop Wild Alaskan Company</a></h3>\n\tBlue Circle Foods\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f1210a13f73707a573fee1a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"blue circle foods tuna\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Blue Circle Foods</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>On the more affordable end is Blue Circle Foods, which bills itself as a brand on a mission to make ethically-caught fish more sustainable. I did a little digging to find that Blue Circle is <a href=\"https://www.msc.org/home\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Marine Stewardship Council (MSC)</a>-certified, and most of the brand's offerings are considered \"good alternatives\" (as opposed to best choices) by the <a href=\"https://www.montereybayaquarium.org/act-for-the-ocean/sustainable-seafood?gclid=EAIaIQobChMI_JnHt5XV6gIVjLbICh1OoAsaEAAYASAAEgKBafD_BwE\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Monterey Bay Aquarium's Seafood Watch Program</a>, which I prefer to go by. (MSC is a pay-to-play certification given to individual companies, rather than species, fishing practices, and locations, so you might not find the same objective ratings you'll find on <a href=\"https://www.seafoodwatch.org/seafood-recommendations/groups/tuna?o=1744679325\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Seafood Watch</a>.)</p><p>I chose to try Indian Ocean-caught yellowfin tuna steaks from Blue Circle, and Seafood Watch has the following to say about the species: \"Yellowfin tuna are depleted, and overfishing is still occurring. Trolling lines have minimal bycatch and habitat impacts.\"&#160;</p><p>The brand's tuna is purportedly pole-caught using traceable and sustainable methods and then injected with beetroot for coloring, but when it comes to wild seafood catches taking place thousands of miles away and passing through multiple ports and nations, things can get mixed up. That's often the price you pay for buying curiously inexpensive fish.&#160;</p><p>I was able to sear and slice the yellowfin steaks, and there was no off, \"fishy\" taste. Tuna, when it starts to turn, has an unbearably gamey flavor, and it's something that I personally have never been able to put up with. Note that the above photo is not mine; I forgot to snap a shot of this particular shipment, but the size and coloration compared with what I received is spot on.</p><p>If you prefer salmon, Blue Circle's is farm-raised, and the brand's salmon nets are only filled to 2% capacity, to minimize the burden on their farming grounds.&#160;Blue Circle also sells ready-to-cook meals and \"Happy Fish,\" which are fish-shaped fish sticks for the little ones.&#160;</p><p>The bottom line is, Blue Circle offers very serviceable frozen fish from decent &#8212; although far from perfect&#8212; fishing practices at prices most of us can agree on.&#160;</p><h3><a href=\"https://bluecirclefoods.com/products/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Shop Blue Circle Foods</a></h3>\n\tThe Crab Place\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ebc270557853207bf112bf4?format=jpeg\" alt=\"crabplace\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Owen Burke/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>If you're after Maryland blue crab in all of its delectable forms, ginormous U-10 (10-count to a pound) sea scallops, or shrimp the size of your palm, Crab Place has been <em>the</em> place for online seafood supply since its inception in 1997. It's not quite a CSF, but you'll be getting seafood fresh-frozen right off the boat.</p><p>We tried crab cakes, shucked oysters, live oysters, shrimp, and some of the largest scallops we've ever seen. Everything was good, but we really have to highlight the U-10 (10-count per pound) scallops. You'll want to follow the seasons and pick your seafood accordingly (seek out those massive scallops in winter and spring), but know that everything is coming right into port and shipping out to you almost immediately.</p><p>Also, a note to crab cake connoisseurs: do not be wary of these crab cakes. Though elsewhere they are almost always deceptively filled with bread crumbs and/or mayonnaise, The Crab Place's are the real deal.</p><h3><a href=\"https://crabplace.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Shop The Crab Place</a></h3>\n\tRastelli's\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ebc45e13dac9a0d307b938a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"rastellis shrimp\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Owen Burke/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>New Jersey-based Rastelli's, which has been around since the 1970s, may be known for its meat, but don't sell them short when it comes to seafood.</p><p>The shrimp is perfectly processed and we can't recommend it enough, but the salmon is the real winner here.</p><p>It's brought in from Scandinavia and is sushi-grade, to which yours truly can attest. I tried three different fillets as sashimi at three different times and was consistently wowed. If you want the best Atlantic salmon you can find, and you're looking to make sushi or sashimi, this is the spot to get it.</p><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/rastellis-meat-delivery-review#:~:text=Review%20of%20Rastelli's&#38;text=We%20tried%20chicken%2C%20salmon%2C%20and,out%20perfectly%20flaky%20and%20moist.\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Read our review of Rastelli's</a></h3><h3><a href=\"https://rastellis.eyip.net/c/196318/611447/9984?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.rastellis.com%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Shop Rastelli's</a></h3>\n\tSizzlefish\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ebc2783fc593d11745ab5b6?format=jpeg\" alt=\"sizzlefish\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Owen Burke/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Sizzlefish is another subscription-based service, but it's much more affordable than most, starting at $6.99 per serving.</p><p>The brand specializes in North Atlantic seafood, and the cod is right up there with Sea to Table's. Cod, which is increasingly substituted with Alaskan black cod and true cod, is not the easiest thing to find anymore, but it's worth seeking out when and where you can.</p><p>Our other favorite options are the (Alaska-caught) salmon and halibut, as well as the North Atlantic cod.</p><p>You can get weekly, fortnightly, monthly, and even once-every-five-week deliveries of 12- or 14-serving boxes, and shipping is included. You can also place one-off orders of everything from blue mussels to diver, or sea scallops, crab cakes and softshell crabs from the Chesapeake Bay, calamari, and king crab legs.</p><h3><a href=\"https://shareasale.com/r.cfm?b=999&#38;u=1088116&#38;m=59668&#38;urllink=www.sizzlefish.com%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Shop Sizzlefish</a></h3>\n\tReal Oyster Cult\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5eeb85d2988ee31f5c3ef6a2?format=jpeg\" alt=\"true oyster cult\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Owen Burke/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>With oyster farms appearing up and down both coasts of the US, it's now easy to get fresh oysters all year long. But the best oysters come from more northern reaches, starting north of San Francisco on the West Coast and around Massachusetts on the East Coast.</p><p>These smaller, more delicate oysters, with their deep cups and briny but complex meat are favored around the world, and they're the ones you pay upwards of $4 apiece for in upscale oyster bars.</p><p>Sold in 20-, 50-, and 100-count portions, you'll get prime, cleanly rinsed oysters delivered anywhere in the country for as little as $1.45 apiece, like our favorite Pink Moons from Prince Edward Island's New London Bay.</p><p>You might find local oysters for less than that depending on where you live, and by all means, buy those. But if you're looking for a treat, or you live nowhere near the ocean, Real Oyster Cult will delight.</p><p>The great thing about receiving oysters this fresh (and live) is that they'll happily live in your fridge for at least 10 days, and we can attest to them holding up for at least five.</p><p>We tried three different oysters ranging from Cape Cod, Massachusetts to Prince Edward Island, Canada, and every single one had a deep cup, a very happy oyster inside, and a very healthy amount of elixir still trapped inside &#8212; all good signs, as this reporter, who once tended upscale oyster bars, should know.</p><h3><a href=\"https://realoystercult.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Shop Real Oyster Cult</a></h3>\n\tLobster Anywhere\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ebc20e5e3c3fb09905cadc4?format=jpeg\" alt=\"lobsteranywhere\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Owen Burke/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Lobster Anywhere has been in the game for more than 20 years, and offers some of the most competitive prices for lobster online.</p><p>The brand specializes in more than just lobster, but first things first: if you are looking for truly colossal lobster tails, look no further. These things are about the size of your forearm and are more than enough for dinner for two, or maybe even three.</p><p>Lobster tails will come neatly in-shell, which is a perfect way to broil, grill, or even saut&#233;e them. The tails won't be flash-frozen at -50 degrees Fahrenheit, but lobster meat tends to stand up to regular freezing better than, say, fish.</p><p>The brand also offers Gulf of Maine redfish, which is an underappreciated white-fleshed fish that's not readily available everywhere, as well as hearty lobster bisque and clam chowder.</p><p>And if you're after live lobster, you're going to get the best deal here, with live 1.25-pound lobster coming in at $26.95 plus shipping.</p><h3><a href=\"https://go.redirectingat.com/?id=35871X943606&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Flobsteranywhere.com%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Shop Lobster Anywhere</a></h3>\n\tSeaweed and kelp, or sea greens\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ebc415d144192132f6085da?format=jpeg\" alt=\"seaweed atlantic ocean\" height=\"668\" width=\"891\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Shutterstock</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>If you're vegan or vegetarian and are looking to add some kelp to your diet, there are plenty of places to order it online. Here are some highly-rated brands we know of, but haven't tested:</p><p><strong><a href=\"https://www.seaquoia.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Sequoia</a>:</strong> Fresh by the pound, dried, freeze-dried, in seasonings, in supplements, Sequoia offers California seaweed just about every which way.</p><p><strong><a href=\"https://www.barnaclefoods.com/#\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Barnacle Foods</a>:</strong> Salsa, hot sauce, pickles, seasonings; Barnacle Foods offers a sampling of Alaskan kelp prepared in many different ways.</p><p><strong><a href=\"https://www.saltpointseaweed.com/products\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Salt Point Seaweed</a>:</strong> Salt Point Seaweed offers two dried edible kelps &#8212; California wakame and kombu &#8212; as well as nori flakes and a few different snacks.</p><p><strong><a href=\"http://seaveg.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Maine Coast Sea Vegetables</a>:</strong> If you're looking for raw sea greens and kelp in bulk, this place has the widest range of offerings we've found. They also sell several dried snack options, as well as seasonings and sushi nori.</p>\n</div><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a 10:48:29","updatedTime":"2020-12-03 10:48:29","title":"'This is shameful!': Fox News co-host goes off on Trump voter fraud claims as 'nonsense' and 'ridiculous' in heated exchange","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/fox-news-clip-juan-williams-goes-off-trump-voter-fraud-2020-12","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fc81fb9037cbd00186137d9?format=jpeg\" alt=\"juan williams trump voter fraud\" height=\"1249\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Juan Williams\n<p class=\"copyright\">Steven Ferdman/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>The panel on Fox News' \"The Five\" got heated Wednesday evening when co-host Juan Williams went off on his colleagues who were entertaining President Donald Trump's unsubstantiated voter fraud claims.</li>\n<li>\"Let me ask you something: Do you think the news division of Fox News isn't interested in every one of these [voter fraud allegations]?\" Williams said before significant crosstalk ensued.</li>\n<li>\"This is shameful!\" he said after being talked over by the other co-hosts.</li>\n<li>Fox News has been in <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/fox-news-ratings-newsmax-trump-create-their-own-trap-2020-11\">a bind of its own making</a> now that Trump has turned on the network, with Williams' mini rant marking another instance of tensions among on-air talent.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>During a contentious exchange on Fox News' \"The Five\" on Wednesday, co-host Juan Williams said it was \"shameful\" for his colleagues to be entertaining President Donald Trump's election conspiracy theories.</p><p>Williams, a Democrat who normally serves as the lone liberal panelist on the show, appeared especially irritated when co-host Jesse Watters rattled off a series of unsubstantiated voter fraud claims in support of Trump.</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">&#8212;Justin Baragona  (@justinbaragona) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1334263246115794949?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">December 2, 2020</a></blockquote><script async src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p>\"This is shameful!\" Williams said as Watters talked over him.</p><p>Williams also called Trump's assertions \"nonsense\" and \"ridiculous.\"</p><p>\"Let me ask you something: Do you think the news division of Fox News isn't interested in every one of these [voter fraud allegations]?\" Williams said to co-host Dagen McDowell, who was raising questions around why Democrats and media outlets were not devoting more attention to \"isolated cases\" of mail-in voter fraud.</p><p>Instances of voter fraud with mail-in ballots are <a href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-election-vote-by-mail-explainer-idUSKBN2482SA\">quite rare</a>, with <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/mistakes-that-can-disqualify-your-mail-absentee-ballot-2020-9\">individual errors</a> presenting a much bigger problem for local elections officials.</p><p>Williams argued that there would be interest among Fox News' reporters if Trump's allegations were backed up by evidence, but that instead they have <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-campaign-lawsuits-election-results-2020-11\">repeatedly fallen flat in court</a>.</p><p>The heated exchange between Williams and his co-hosts, particularly Watters and comedian Greg Gutfeld, typified the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/fox-news-ratings-newsmax-trump-create-their-own-trap-2020-11\">conundrum Fox News has found itself in ever since Trump turned on the network</a> once their Decision Desk called the race for President-elect Joe Biden.</p><p>While the news division has fact checked Trump's voter fraud theories, some opinion hosts are still holding out.</p><p>For Williams, at least on Wednesday, enough was enough.</p><p>\"I think Juan sounds nervous,\" Watters said before reading the teleprompter to cut to commercial.</p><p>\"Oh, I'm nervous. Oh yeah, yeah,\" Williams said sarcastically before the break.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a Bernie Sanders' presidential bid.&#160;</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Former President Barack Obama said in a Monday night interview that Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez, the high-profile progressive freshman, should have gotten more time to speak at the Democratic Convention in August.&#160;</p><p>\"The Democratic National Convention I thought was really successful considering the pandemic,\" <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Yj-eNGfeG0o&feature=youtu.beu.be\">Obama told Peter Hamby</a>, host of Snap's \"Good Luck America.\" \"But the fact that an AOC only got, what? Three minutes or five minutes? When she speaks to a broad section of young people who are interested in what she has to say, even if they don't agree with everything she says.\"</p><p>He added, \"New blood is always good. And I say that as somebody who used to be the young, shiny cool guy. But now is the gray-haired old grizzled vet.\"</p><p>Ocasio-Cortez was given just 60 seconds to speak at the convention, where she delivered a symbolic endorsement of Sen. Bernie Sanders' presidential bid.&#160;</p><p>Over the summer, the Bronx native worked with Biden's campaign and Sanders on a coalition task force to beef up President-elect Joe Biden's policies proposals to address climate change. But Ocasio-Cortez hasn't shied away from criticizing the president-elect when she diverges from him on policy and personnel decisions, and she has repeatedly called on progressive activists to hold the Biden administration \"accountable.\"&#160;</p><p>Obama cautioned Democrats against what he considers to be divisive \"labels,\" like the activist calls to defund the police and Ocasio-Cortez and Sanders' democratic socialism.&#160;</p><p>\"Socialism is still a loaded term for a lot of folks,\" he said. \"Once again, instead of talking labels and ideology, we should focus on talking about getting certain things done.\"</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/obama-aoc-more-time-at-dnc-new-blood-always-good-2020-12'>Business href=\"https://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/6415797/type/dlg/https://www.buybuybaby.com/store/product/elvie-reg-wearable-single-electric-breast-pump/5309306?keyword=elvie\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\"><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e1604f1b2e66a19d144ff78?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Elvie Double Pump wearable breast pump\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Elvie Pump comfortably fits within a bra, allowing you to pump without cords or tubes.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Elvie</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></a></p><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li><strong>The <a href=\"https://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/6415797/type/dlg/https://www.buybuybaby.com/store/product/elvie-reg-wearable-single-electric-breast-pump/5309306?keyword=elvie\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Elvie Pump</a> is a hands-free, wearable electric breast pump without any cords, wires, or tubes. </strong></li><li><strong>As a mother whose baby struggled to breastfeed, this breast pump was been a life-changing purchase.</strong></li><li><strong>For the convenience of double pumping, I bought the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07G375DHR/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=biipf_010820_elvie-double-breast-pump-review-20&camp=1789&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B07G375DHR&linkId=9e2f3255aeb79c80bd77052800c833c2aeb79c80bd77052800c833c2\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Elvie Pump Double</a> (currently $476, usually $499), but you can also purchase a <a href=\"https://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/6415797/type/dlg/https://www.buybuybaby.com/store/product/elvie-reg-wearable-single-electric-breast-pump/5309306?keyword=elvie\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">single pump</a> for (currently $238, usually $279). </strong></li><li><strong>While the Elvie Pump is pricey, it's partially reimbursable by many insurance companies.</strong></li></ul><div id=\"ProductCard_5dcb1ad83afd371a6a21eee5\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5dcb1ad83afd371a6a21eee5&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><div id=\"ProductCard_5e398b2a5bc79c48e767f2b3\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5e398b2a5bc79c48e767f2b3&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><p>&#160;</p><p>When my daughter was born prematurely and had to spend time in the NICU, feeding her was a challenge. She couldn't seem to get the hang of breastfeeding, so I pumped in the hospital during her stay and continued to try to nurse her at home without much success.&#160;</p><p>Every day and night soon became an exhausting blur of trying to nurse her, then pumping, then feeding her the expressed breast milk. After about a week of this, I broke down and spent $500 on the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07G375DHR/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=biipf_010820_elvie-double-breast-pump-review-20&camp=1789&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B07G375DHR&linkId=9e2f3255aeb79c80bd77052800c833c2aeb79c80bd77052800c833c2\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Elvie Pump Double</a>&#160;— the first wearable, hands-free breast pump I've ever owned.&#160;</p><p>Fortunately, it's exactly what I needed.&#160;</p><p>I went from spending hours pumping, tied to a wall while, to being able to pump and hold my baby at the same time, or pump and make breakfast for my other kids, or pump and drive them to school.&#160;</p><p>My daughter is turning 5 months this week, and I've been using the Elvie successfully for the past four months. Here's my experience with it, and why I think it's worth considering this wearable electric breast pump if you're a mother who's breastfeeding.</p><h2>Design and specs</h2><p>I opted for the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07G375DHR/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=biipf_010820_elvie-double-breast-pump-review-20&camp=1789&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B07G375DHR&linkId=9e2f3255aeb79c80bd77052800c833c2aeb79c80bd77052800c833c2\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Elvie Pump Double</a>, but you can also buy the <a href=\"https://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/6415797/type/dlg/https://www.buybuybaby.com/store/product/elvie-reg-wearable-single-electric-breast-pump/5309306?keyword=elvie\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">single for $238 (usually $279)</a> — the only difference is that you get one pump instead of two.</p><p>A single Elvie pump is an all-in-one seamless unit that easily fits in your <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-nursing-bra\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">bra</a>. The design is sleek and minimal, with white casing and simple, straightforward controls.&#160;</p><p>Each unit consists of three parts: 1) the Hub, which houses the electronics and actual pumping apparatus, 2) the detachable milk bottle with spout and valve, and 3) the breast shield and seal that houses your nipple and breast.&#160;</p><p><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07G375DHR/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=biipf_010820_elvie-double-breast-pump-review-20&camp=1789&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B07G375DHR&linkId=9e2f3255aeb79c80bd77052800c833c2aeb79c80bd77052800c833c2\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\"><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e16044fb2e66a19155875b9?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Elvie Double Pump unit\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The all-in-one seamless units are powered by rechargeable lithium-polymer batteries.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Chaunie Brusie/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></a></p><h3><strong>What's included with the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07G375DHR/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=biipf_010820_elvie-double-breast-pump-review-20&camp=1789&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B07G375DHR&linkId=9e2f3255aeb79c80bd77052800c833c2aeb79c80bd77052800c833c2\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Elvie Pump Double</a></strong></h3><ul><li>2 Hubs, each measures 5 inches (height) by 2.5 inches (width) and weighs 14.8 ounces</li><li>4 5-ounce milk bottles with storage lids — all BPA free and dishwasher-safe on the top rack</li><li>4 seals, 4 spouts, 4 valves</li><li>2 24mm breast shields and 2 28mm breast shields. You can purchase a pack of 2 21mm breast shields separately if needed</li><li>4 bra adjusters, machine washable</li><li>2 micro USB charging cables. Each pump is powered by a 1460mAh lithium-polymer battery; each lasts approximately 2.5 hours depending on which intensity setting is used</li><li>2-year warranty for the Hub, 90-day warranty for the washable parts</li><li>2 carry bags</li></ul><h3><strong>Key features</strong></h3><ul><li>2 modes (stimulation and expression) and 7 suction intensity settings</li><li>Infrared (IR) energy sensor monitors milk volume in the bottle</li><li>Automatically starts in stimulation mode and switches to expression mode after two minutes or if the sensor detects let-down</li><li>Sensor detects when the milk container is full and automatically stops pumping</li><li>Free app links to each pump through Bluetooth so you can actively monitor milk while pumping, see your stats for past sessions, and check output levels. The app also works as a remote to start or pause pumping, switch intensity settings, and change to expression or stimulation mode.</li><li>Manual controls on each pump let you start and pause pumping and change intensity levels</li><li>Though it's marketed as a \"silent\" breast pump, the sound is noticeable — though significantly quieter than other pumps.</li><li>FSA/HSA funds-compatible and reimbursable by many insurance companies</li></ul><h2>Setup</h2><p>Out of the box, it took me less than a half-hour to read through the instructions, clean and sterilize the parts, and get everything set up. After about two hours, both pumps were fully charged and good to go.</p><p>To use one of the pumps, twist the valve onto the milk container, put the silicone valve over top, then snap the base into the Hub. The breast shield fits into the opening in the Hub, and you align your nipple along the markings for the best fit.&#160;</p><p><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07G375DHR/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=biipf_010820_elvie-double-breast-pump-review-20&camp=1789&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B07G375DHR&linkId=9e2f3255aeb79c80bd77052800c833c2aeb79c80bd77052800c833c2\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\"><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e16054724fe12184d055bb2?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Elvie Double Pump \" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Amazon</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></a></p><p>The first time I used the Elvie, it took me a few tries to get the nipple alignment right, but now I can literally assemble and place it on in the dark. Pressing the power button on the front of the Hub powers it on and illuminates the other manual controls, which include the play/pause button, two smaller intensity buttons at the top, and a left/right side selector should you wish to use a single pump for both breasts. Alternatively, after manually powering it on, you can use the app to control pump settings.</p><h2><strong>What it's like to use</strong></h2><p>When I started pumping, it felt too good to be true. I had come to dread uncomfortable pumping sessions, but compared to the traditional plug-in-the-wall pump I'd been using, the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07G375DHR/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=biipf_010820_elvie-double-breast-pump-review-20&camp=1789&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B07G375DHR&linkId=9e2f3255aeb79c80bd77052800c833c2aeb79c80bd77052800c833c2\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Elvie</a> felt downright invisible.&#160;&#160;</p><p>For me, it's an incredibly effective <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-breast-pump\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">breast pump</a>. I immediately went from pumping for 15 to 20 minutes every two to three hours to pumping a full feeding of 5 ounces on each breast in around five minutes. I'm not entirely sure why it's worked so well for me, but it seems to be a combination of the stimulation mode, suction seal, and the fact that I'm more relaxed using a hands-free pump.</p><p>While I prefer to use the manual controls on the Hub, the app is particularly handy if you need to switch back and forth between stimulation and expression modes — this cannot be controlled manually.</p><p>One of the most clever features is the IR energy sensor that automatically pauses pumping when the milk container is full — a big plus when you don't have a free hand. Knowing I can just pop the pump in and let it do the rest has been invaluable.&#160;</p><p>It's easy to switch out the milk container when pumping is paused. After removing the valve, the easy-pour spout makes pouring your milk into a storage bag or container simple and mess-free. I also like that you can easily see the milk container on the Elvie (unlike the <a href=\"https://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/6415797/type/dlg/https://www.buybuybaby.com/store/product/willow-reg-generation-3-hands-free-wearable-double-electric-breast-pump/5468500\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Willow Wearable Pump</a>), so I can peek to make sure the milk is actually flowing and readjust the pump or settings to ensure milk flow.</p><p>The battery charge lasts me through almost a whole day of pumping, which is typically four times a day.&#160;</p><h3><strong>How to clean the Elvie</strong></h3><p><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07G375DHR/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=biipf_010820_elvie-double-breast-pump-review-20&camp=1789&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B07G375DHR&linkId=9e2f3255aeb79c80bd77052800c833c2aeb79c80bd77052800c833c2\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\"><strong><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e1603edb2e66a18bb0dbd05?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Elvie Double Pump cleaning\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Aside from the Hub apparatus, I can conveniently wash all parts in the dishwasher.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Chaunie Brusie/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></strong></a></p><p>Aside from the Hub, everything is dishwasher safe on the top rack or can be cleaned and sterilized in boiling water or a microwave sterilizer. However, it's incredibly important to make sure all of the parts are completely dry before using them again — I've found that if the breast shield seals are even slightly wet, it will affect the suction.&#160;</p><p>The Hub itself should only be wiped clean with a damp cloth. I occasionally have some milk splash up onto the Hub and into its crevices but have found a soft toothbrush works to gently remove any dried milk.</p><h2><strong>Notes on milk overflow</strong></h2><p>Initially, I had some issues with milk overflow. Milk would back up into the plastic on the Hub, making it difficult to clean. After reaching out to customer service via email, I discovered I'd been using the wrong size breast shield. My output increased as soon as I switched shields, and my overflow practically disappeared.&#160;</p><p>The customer service representative also told me that after hearing from other users who experienced overflow, they released a firmware upgrade (1.7.0) in October 2019 to improve the milk volume algorithm and increase the accuracy of the overflow sensor. Since upgrading my firmware through the app, my overflow issue has completely resolved.</p><p>If users experience overflow, aside from getting in touch with customer service, the representative suggested wearing a dark-colored bra or shirt, as the color contrast helps the auto-sensor detect the lighter-colored milk.</p><h2><strong>Data privacy</strong></h2><p>I reached out to Elvie via email to ask about data privacy, and a company representative said all data is kept totally private and not shared with third parties. Their <a href=\"https://www.elvie.com/en-us/support/elvie-pump/legal-and-warranty-information/is-my-data-stored-securely-and-kept-confidential\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">website</a> provides full details on how the data is stored anonymously. If you choose to operate the pumps manually without the app, be sure to open it periodically to check for software updates.</p><h2><strong>The cons</strong></h2><p><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07G375DHR/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=biipf_010820_elvie-double-breast-pump-review-20&camp=1789&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B07G375DHR&linkId=9e2f3255aeb79c80bd77052800c833c2aeb79c80bd77052800c833c2\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\"><strong><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e16032b24fe1216055351e7?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Elvie Double Pump cons\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Elvie isn&#39;t completely discreet, a minor con for me.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Chaunie Brusie/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></strong></a></p><p>The downsides are very small in relation to how much I love this pump. First, I wish it came with a sturdy carrying case instead of two small velvet-like drawstring bags that aren't at all practical for carrying the pumps.</p><p>Second, the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07G375DHR/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=biipf_010820_elvie-double-breast-pump-review-20&camp=1789&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B07G375DHR&linkId=9e2f3255aeb79c80bd77052800c833c2aeb79c80bd77052800c833c2\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Elvie</a> isn't completely discreet. The pumping sound and the lights on the hub — which can't be turned off — are definitely noticeable. The lights shine through most of my shirts, and while it's a lot quieter than any other pump I've used, if you've ever pumped before and happen to be sitting near me, you'll definitely know what's going on. I'd feel comfortable using it in a noisier location where the sound would be masked, but not in a quiet setting.</p><h2><strong>The bottom line</strong></h2><p>If you'll be pumping for any regular amount of time, the Elvie wearable breast pump is worth the investment. It truly gave me my life back, taking the hour-long feeding process with my baby down to minutes and giving me the freedom to pump on the go. I can enjoy the extra time I have with my baby <em>and</em> provide her with breast milk with confidence — a win-win.</p><p>If it's within your budget, I recommend getting the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07G375DHR/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=biipf_010820_elvie-double-breast-pump-review-20&camp=1789&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B07G375DHR&linkId=9e2f3255aeb79c80bd77052800c833c2aeb79c80bd77052800c833c2\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Elvie Pump Double</a>, for convenience's sake. However, a <a href=\"https://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/6415797/type/dlg/https://www.buybuybaby.com/store/product/elvie-reg-wearable-single-electric-breast-pump/5309306?keyword=elvie\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">single pump</a> is fast and efficient enough that you could get away with simply switching sides to pump both breasts.&#160;&#160;</p><div id=\"ProductCard_5dcb1ad83afd371a6a21eee5\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5dcb1ad83afd371a6a21eee5&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><div id=\"ProductCard_5e398b2a5bc79c48e767f2b3\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe ally","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/biden-national-security-advisor-supports-australian-amid-china-dispute-2020-12","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fbe84bb50e71a00115575c2?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Jake Sullivan, national security advisor nominee\" height=\"2599\" width=\"5200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Jake Sullivan, who Biden has selected to be national security advisor, at a cabinet announcement event in Wilmington, Delaware, November 24, 2020.\n<p class=\"copyright\">CHANDAN KHANNA/AFP via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Jake Sullivan, who President-elect Joe Biden has picked as&#160;national security adviser, on Wednesday sent a subtle message of support to Australia, which is locked in an ongoing showdown with China.</li>\n<li>China's confrontation with Australia has escalated this spring, most recently with Chinese official tweeting an inflammatory image referencing war-crimes accusations against Australian soldiers.</li>\n<li>US observers welcomed Sullivan's message as a departure from Trump's attitude toward allies but said Biden needs to follow-through on it after taking office.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Jake Sullivan, who President-elect Joe Biden has <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/joe-biden-cabinet-white-house-staff-transition-president-elect-administration-2020-11\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">picked to be</a> national security adviser, on Wednesday sent what appeared to be a message of support to Australia amid its ongoing showdown with China.</p><p>\"The Australian people have made great sacrifices to protect freedom and democracy around the world,\" Sullivan <a href=\"https://twitter.com/jakejsullivan/status/1334173397035741189\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">tweeted</a>. \"As we have for a century, America will stand shoulder to shoulder with our ally Australia and rally fellow democracies to advance our shared security, prosperity, and values.\"</p><p>Sullivan's message avoided mentioning China, which has steadily escalated a confrontation with Australia <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/caught-between-trump-and-china-australia-is-reevaluating-its-position-2020-6\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">since earlier this year</a>.</p><p>After Canberra called for an independent investigation into the origins of the coronavirus, Beijing called Australia \"a giant kangaroo that serves as a dog to the US.\" That was followed by a series of tariffs as well as a months-long cyberattack on Australian governments and businesses purportedly conducted by Beijing.</p><p>Beijing recently put tariffs on Australian wine, for which China is <a href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/11/30/business/australia-china-wine-tariffs-intl-hnk/index.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">the biggest</a> export market. That drew a <a href=\"https://twitter.com/WHNSC/status/1333597644162215936\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">less-than-subtle message</a> of support from the Trump administration, with which Australia <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/caught-between-trump-and-china-australia-is-reevaluating-its-position-2020-6\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">has also had a strained relationship</a>.</p><p>Tensions seemed to escalate on Sunday, when a senior Chinese official posted <a href=\"https://twitter.com/zlj517/status/1333214766806888448?s=20\">a controversial image</a> on Twitter that referenced war-crimes accusations against Australian troops.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fc69265037cbd00186132c2?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Screen Shot 2020 12 01 at 10.56.03 AM\" height=\"1185\" width=\"2370\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The image posted on a Chinese government official&#39;s Twitter account.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://twitter.com/zlj517/status/1333214766806888448?s=20\" target=\"_blank\">@zlj517/Twitter</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>The fabricated image posted by Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesman Zhao Lijian showed a smiling Australian soldier slitting a child's throat. The child was in front of an Afghan flag in the form of an incomplete puzzle. A caption on the photo read, \"Don't be afraid, we are coming to bring you peace!\"</p><p>Zhao's tweet came as Australian Defence Force (ADF) released an <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/australia-to-prosecute-soldiers-accused-of-afghanistan-war-crimes-2020-11\">investigation</a> that recommended current and former special forces soldiers be investigated over the deaths of 39 non-combatants in Afghanistan between 2009 and 2013.</p><p>Prime Minister Scott Morrison said the image was \"repugnant\" and could not \"be justified on any basis.\"</p><p>\"The Chinese Government should be totally ashamed of this post,\" Morrison added. \"There are undoubtedly tensions that exist between China and Australia, but this is not how you deal with them.\"</p><p>Chinese officials have refused to apologize and instead questioned Morrison's grievances in light of the ADF report.</p><p>\"The Australian side has been reacting so strongly to my colleague's tweet,\" Foreign Ministry spokeswoman Hua Chunying said Monday. \"Why is that? Do they think that their merciless killing of Afghan civilians is justified but the condemnation of such ruthless brutality is not? Afghan lives matter!\"</p><p>Zhao's tweet remains on Twitter as of Wednesday.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fbe6b0832f2170011f711d9?format=jpeg\" alt=\"GettyImages xi jinping joe biden\" height=\"1726\" width=\"3453\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Vice President Joe Biden and Chinese President Xi Jinping toast during a State Luncheon for China, September 25, 2015.\n<p class=\"copyright\">PAUL J. RICHARDS/AFP via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>While Sullivan's message drew some criticism for failing to mention China directly, others applauded it as a welcome change from the Trump administration's dealings with allies.</p><p>Jorge Guajardo, Mexico's ambassador to China from 2007 to 2013, called it \"<a href=\"https://twitter.com/jorge_guajardo/status/1334187129350582275\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">soup for the allies' soul</a>.\" Bonnie Glaser, senior advisor for Asia at the Center for Strategic and International Studies, <a href=\"https://twitter.com/BonnieGlaser/status/1334179209422524417\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">said</a> it was \"pitch perfect.\"</p><p>John Culver, who was US national intelligence officer for East Asia from 2015 to 2018, <a href=\"https://twitter.com/JohnCulver689/status/1334180506951356427\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">said</a> Sullivan's tweet reflected that \"Biden's first China issue will be [China's] economic pressure and media attacks on a key US ally\" and called Beijing's pressure an \"own-goal.\"</p><p>Abraham Denmark, who was deputy assistant secretary of defense for East Asia from 2015 to January 2017, <a href=\"https://twitter.com/AbeDenmark/status/1334188162525106178\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">also said </a>Sullivan's message was \"pitch-perfect in terms of reassurance and vision, but it will need practical and consistent follow-through after inauguration.\"</p><p>Biden won't take office until January 20, but Australia's prime minister was among the first foreign leaders he spoke to his election.</p><p>In a November 11 call, Biden thanked Prime Minister Scott Morrison for Morrison's congratulations on that win and \"underscored\" the US and Australia's longstanding relationship, according to <a href=\"https://buildbackbetter.gov/press-releases/readout-of-the-president-elects-foreign-leader-calls/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">a readout</a>.</p><p>Biden said he looked forward to working closely with Morrison \"on many common challenges,\" including containing the pandemic, confronting climate change, and \"maintaining a secure and prosperous Indo-Pacific region.\"</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/Td0rI4xQkHc\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Wed, 02 Dec 2020 22:02:02 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5fbe84b4037cbd001861249b?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"a8ad1132924b7e479538968456a13ba6","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn15@2020_1/2020/12/03/02-48-49-707_8c73509de5e9ee8a.webp","destWidth":4840,"destHeight":3630,"sourceBytes":248590,"destBytes":248590,"author":"insider@insider.com (Christopher Woody,David Choi)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5fbe84bb50e71a00115575c2?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn96@2020_4/2020/12/03/02-48-55-047_4e36a940967b64ac.webp","https://i.insider.com/5fc69265037cbd00186132c2?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn99@2020_1/2020/12/03/02-48-55-093_0ee1c1287f171590.webp","https://i.insider.com/5fbe6b0832f2170011f711d9?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn83@2020_5/2020/12/03/02-49-03-188_87d4b5f1864fc44f.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn3@2020_2/2020/12/03/02-49-00-176_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Td0rI4xQkHc:Uvz26nLoRzU:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn51@2020_2/2020/12/03/02-48-52-395_f129f274ae76b1ef.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Td0rI4xQkHc:Uvz26nLoRzU:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn95@2020_1/2020/12/03/02-48-49-973_b319047793ce03f8.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn99@2020_3/2020/12/03/02-48-56-007_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Td0rI4xQkHc:Uvz26nLoRzU:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn43@2020_6/2020/12/03/02-49-02-891_6918e0cbecc88613.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/Td0rI4xQkHc":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn43@2020_6/2020/12/03/02-48-59-754_a35256f75f82e0f2.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1606963709991},{"createdTime":"2020-12-03 10:48:30","updatedTime":"2020-12-03 10:48:30","title":"The CDC says Americans shouldn't travel for the holidays. Knowing they will anyway, the agency suggests 2 COVID-19 tests.","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/cdc-postpone-holiday-travel-or-else-get-2-tests-2020-12","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fbe746850e71a001155753d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"thanksgiving travel test coronavirus 2020\" height=\"1467\" width=\"2200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Health care worker Elizabeth Cameros, right, administers a deep nasal coronavirus test to traveler Wade Hopkins at a COVID-19 testing station at LAX on Monday, November 23, 2020 in Los Angeles, California.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Allen J. Schaben / Los Angeles Times via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>The CDC says the safest way to celebrate winter holidays this year is at home.</li>\n<li>But if you do plan to travel, the CDC recommends getting tested twice, once before and once after, and restricting your outings to only those most essential in the days surrounding your trip.</li>\n<li>The CDC says travelers should get tested for the virus one to three days before traveling, as well as three to five days afterwards, and make sure both of those tests come back negative.</li>\n<li>The agency also recommends restricting any \"non-essential\" outings for at least seven days after traveling.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>With the coronavirus still spreading fast across the US, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention says the best way for Americans to celebrate winter holidays this December is to stay where they live.</p><p>\"Cases are rising, hospitalizations are increasing, deaths are increasing, and we need to try to bend the curve,\" the CDC's COVID-19 Incident Manager Dr. Henry Walke said Wednesday on a call with reporters.</p><p>Across the country, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/us-averaging-one-covid-19-death-per-minute-cdc-expert-2020-12\">approximately one person is now dying from COVID-19</a> every minute.&#160;</p><p>\"The best thing for Americans to do in the upcoming holiday season is to stay at home.\"</p><p>Knowing that many people across the US will <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/americans-ignore-covid-19-to-have-thanksgiving-as-usual-2020-11\">not heed that advice</a>, the CDC is also offering up some guidance on how to travel more safely if you decide to venture out before 2021 ends.</p><h2>Test before travel, afterwards, and lay low for a week</h2><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fbe746432f2170011f71220?format=jpeg\" alt=\"thanksgiving travel 2020\" height=\"1448\" width=\"2200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Travelers at Miami International Airport on Sunday, November 22, 2020.\n<p class=\"copyright\">David Santiago/Miami Herald/Tribune News Service via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>The new travel guidance is three-pronged: test, lay low, and test again.</p><p>First, the CDC recommends travelers get a coronavirus test one to three days before they travel, and then make sure it comes back negative before they hop in the car, board a flight, or catch a train.</p><p>Once travelers arrive at their destination, they should also lay low for a week, restricting outings to only their most essential chores like grocery shopping. They should then take one more test \"three to five days after travel,\" Walke said. If it's not possible to procure a second test after traveling, the CDC recommends increasing the period of essential-only outings to 10 days.&#160;</p><p>Throughout all of this, travelers should monitor themselves for common <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/difference-between-coronavirus-symptoms-flu-allergies-common-cold-chart-2020-9\">symptoms of the virus</a> (fever, cough, fatigue, body aches). They also need to wear a mask and be vigilant about handwashing, social distancing, and ventilation when indoors.</p><p>People traveling who've tested negative for the virus should still assume they could catch or carry it. Tests are not perfect at picking out every infection, and they can only provide insight into a single moment in time, meaning that people who accurately test negative for the virus one day might start their infection the next.&#160;</p><h2>The safest option is still to postpone travel until next year<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fc7dcbc50e71a0011558755?format=jpeg\" alt=\"thanksgiving travel coronavirus 2020\" height=\"1563\" width=\"2084\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Elian McCrosky greets his grandparents, Rebecca and Randy Wells, at baggage claim at John Wayne Airport in Santa Ana, California, on Monday, November 23, 2020. The Wells are visiting from South Carolina for Thanksgiving.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Jeff Gritchen/MediaNews Group/Orange County Register via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></h2><p>Around Thanksgiving, more than <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/record-breaking-americans-flew-sunday-thanksgiving-travel-2020-11\">15 million passengers</a> flew back and forth across the US. Early surveys suggest even more Americans <a href=\"https://www.latimes.com/business/story/2020-11-12/thanksgiving-travel-southern-californians-driving\">may choose</a> to travel around Christmas, with people traveling both to visit family and <a href=\"https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/travelocity-2020-holiday-travel-outlook-most-families-arent-going-home-this-holiday-but-they-arent-staying-home-either-301148116.html\">simply to get away from home</a> for a bit.</p><p>Dr. Cindy Friedman, chief of the travelers' health branch at the CDC, encouraged families to begin making tough decisions about their end of year travel as soon as possible.&#160;</p><p>\"We know it's a hard decision, and that people need to have time to prepare and have discussions with family and friends,\" Friedman said. \"Take some time now before the Christmas holidays — we have several weeks — to really think about the safest option ... which we think is to postpone travel.\"</p><p>Friedman said traveling is especially dangerous right now because when people move around, they can spark new COVID-19 outbreaks in different areas of the country. Even a small percentage of travelers who may be sick, but without symptoms, could easily seed \"hundreds of thousands of additional infections, moving from one community to another,\" she said.&#160;</p><p>Besides, some of the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/moncef-slaoui-100-million-americans-vaccinated-by-march-2021-2020-12\">first coronavirus vaccines are expected to be approved for emergency use in the US in the coming weeks</a>, and as temperatures warm up in the spring, people will be able to gather together more safely outside again.</p><p>Dr. Anthony Fauci, the top infectious disease expert in the US, said last month at the White House that vaccines should be available to the most high-priority groups, like <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/healthcare-workers-long-term-care-residents-recommended-to-get-vaccines-first-2020-12\">healthcare workers and people in nursing homes</a>, beginning in late December.&#160;</p><p>\"Help is on the way,\" Fauci said.&#160;</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/cdc-postpone-holiday-travel-or-else-get-2-tests-2020-12'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a
