Brueck)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5fbe746850e71a001155753d?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn35@2020_6/2020/12/03/02-49-01-253_b709b8a0d3311611.webp","https://i.insider.com/5fbe746432f2170011f71220?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn23@2020_3/2020/12/03/02-48-58-777_8f3319b368deda4c.webp","https://i.insider.com/5fc7dcbc50e71a0011558755?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn16@2020_4/2020/12/03/02-48-57-851_a863a7e88eff9d77.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn3@2020_2/2020/12/03/02-49-00-176_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=1vu1lCMPTPA:4huVzenXI5g:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn67@2020_1/2020/12/03/02-48-53-603_229fb75e68a62543.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=1vu1lCMPTPA:4huVzenXI5g:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn84@2020_5/2020/12/03/02-48-49-916_4808b59e163964a8.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn99@2020_3/2020/12/03/02-48-56-007_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=1vu1lCMPTPA:4huVzenXI5g:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn71@2020_6/2020/12/03/02-48-59-959_82c917f4639650fa.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/1vu1lCMPTPA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn51@2020_2/2020/12/03/02-48-51-733_3f9b2493d2261966.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1606963710037},{"createdTime":"2020-12-03 10:48:30","updatedTime":"2020-12-03 10:48:30","title":"Republican Sen. David Perdue's stock portfolio shows he'd occasionally make at least 20 trades in one day, per a New York Times investigation","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/gop-senator-david-perdue-stock-trades-in-one-day-nyt-2020-12","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fc807f3037cbd001861375c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"GettyImages david perdue\" height=\"2400\" width=\"3600\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Sen. David Perdue (R-GA) speaks to the crowd of supporters during a &#34;Defend the Majority&#34; rally at the Georgia National Fairgrounds and Agriculture Center on November 19, 2020 in Perry, Georgia.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Jessica McGowan/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Republican Sen. David Perdue of Georgia has at times made at least 20 stock transactions in just one day, according to a New York Times analysis on Wednesday.</li>\n<li>Perdue made a total of 2,596 trades during his first term in office, the report revealed.</li>\n<li>The senator has faced public scrutiny and been under federal investigation for potential conflicts of interest while stock trading as a member of Congress.&#160;</li>\n<li>The news comes as he's in a close race with a Democratic challenger to keep his seat in an upcoming special election on Jan 5.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Republican Sen. David Perdue has occasionally made at least 20 stock transactions in just one day, according to a <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/12/02/us/politics/david-perdue-stock-trades.html\">New York Times analysis</a> on Wednesday.</p><p>The report revealed that during his six years in office, Perdue carried out 2,596 trades, which makes up almost a third of all trades by senators over the same time period. Sometimes, that meant Perdue made 20 or more transactions in the span of a day, The Times noted.</p><p>The data comes as Perdue has faced public scrutiny over the past several months for potential conflicts of interest while stock trading as a member of Congress. He drew criticism in the spring after the Atlanta Journal-Constitution reported that <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/coronavirus-david-perdue-bought-stock-company-producing-ppe-after-briefing-2020-4\">he bought stock</a> in a personal protective equipment company on January 24 — the same day he received a classified Senate briefing on the coronavirus. (The Times <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/11/25/us/politics/david-perdue-cardlytics.html\">reported last week</a> that the Justice Department had been investigating the senator's stock activity around the start of the pandemic; that case was dropped without charges.)</p><p>The Times details many other transactions Perdue made in his first term. While serving on the Senate Armed Services Committee's cybersecurity panel, Perdue bought and sold shares of a cybersecurity firm called FireEye, the newspaper found. He also bought and sold shares of companies such as Bank of America, JPMorgan Chase, and Regions Financial, while a member of the Senate Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs Committee, which oversees those firms, the report noted.</p><p>One huge transaction in his portfolio, which the Justice Department reportedly looked into, involved a sale worth over $1 million in stocks of Cardlytics, a finance-advertising platform.&#160;</p><p>Perdue's office denied that the senator's stock transactions break any conflicts of interests and said that he doesn't directly manage his investments, according to The Times.</p><p>\"Senator Perdue doesn't handle the day-to-day decisions of his portfolio — all of his holdings are managed by outside financial advisers who make recommendations, set strategy, and manage trades and personal finances,\" John Burke, his campaign's communications director, told The Times.&#160;</p><p>When asked for comment, Burke referred Insider to his statement in The Times and added that Perdue's \"stock activity was reviewed by the bipartisan Senate Ethics Committee, DOJ, and the SEC, all of whom independently cleared Senator Perdue of any and all wrongdoing.\"</p><p>Several other lawmakers have <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/coronavirus-republican-senator-dumped-shares-ahead-of-market-crash-2020-3\">similarly have gained national attention</a> for their <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/doj-drops-probe-3-senators-dumped-stock-before-crash-2020-5\">trading activity</a> around the onset of the public health crisis, including fellow Georgia Sen. Kelly Loeffler, who also faces a runoff election on Jan. 5.</p><p>Perdue is also fighting to keep his seat in <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/georgia-senate-runoff-elections-jon-ossoff-david-perdue-warnock-loeffler-2020-11\">the upcoming special election</a> in Georgia. His Democratic opponent, Jon Ossoff, has blasted the senator's stock trading on the campaign trail and labeled him a \"crook.\"</p><p>On Wednesday, Ossoff repeated the attacks in a <a href=\"https://twitter.com/ossoff/status/1334221527760375813\">retweet</a> of a CNN report highlighting The Times investigation.</p><p>\"Like I said: he's a crook,\" he wrote.&#160;</p><p>Perdue's spokesperson Burke pushed back on Ossoff's attacks, calling them \"entirely baseless.\"</p><p>The results of the two Georgia races will determine which party controls the Senate next year. President Donald Trump, who has refused to concede the 2020 presidential election, <a href=\"https://apnews.com/article/joe-biden-donald-trump-politics-georgia-david-perdue-adf4fe5b05bbcd0bc92968665303ba4a\">plans to travel</a> to the state on Saturday to campaign for both Perdue and Loeffler.&#160;</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/gop-senator-david-perdue-stock-trades-in-one-day-nyt-2020-12'>Business Seddiq)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5fc807f3037cbd001861375c?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn48@2020_3/2020/12/03/02-48-51-722_d7accec0a56e357b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn3@2020_2/2020/12/03/02-49-00-176_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=WF0YGcNN0jE:R5WsJajMxBg:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn36@2020_4/2020/12/03/02-49-02-016_d76c1b7353651c17.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=WF0YGcNN0jE:R5WsJajMxBg:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn23@2020_5/2020/12/03/02-48-55-351_4e7ed66f3893e733.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn99@2020_3/2020/12/03/02-48-56-007_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=WF0YGcNN0jE:R5WsJajMxBg:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn67@2020_3/2020/12/03/02-48-59-077_7b5be9e90a2553bf.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/WF0YGcNN0jE":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn92@2020_1/2020/12/03/02-48-51-025_eb0c094a28b7e982.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1606963710003},{"createdTime":"2020-12-03 10:48:30","updatedTime":"2020-12-03 10:48:30","title":"Amazon is reportedly considering buying Wondery in a deal that could value the podcast startup at $300 million","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/amazon-considering-buying-podcast-startup-wondery-report-2020-12","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fc7dac3037cbd00186135f2?format=jpeg\" alt=\"jeff bezos amazon\" height=\"1361\" width=\"1815\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos in 2019.\n<p class=\"copyright\">MARK RALSTON/AFP via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Amazon is considering buying Wondery, the world's largest independent podcast publisher, the Wall Street Journal reported.</li>\n<li>Sources say the talks value Wondery at $300 million, which would make for the podcast industry's largest deal if the negotiations go through.</li>\n<li>Apple and Sony were reported to be among four companies that were holding preliminary talks in November to buy Wondery, which was seeking between $300 million and $400 million.</li>\n<li>News of Amazon's potential acquisition of Wondery comes as the podcast market continues to heat up, with Spotify acquiring Gimlet Media in 2019 and landing an exclusive deal with Kim Kardashian West in June.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Amazon is considering buying the podcast startup Wondery, the <a href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/amazon-in-talks-to-buy-podcast-maker-wondery-11606931396\">Wall Street Journal</a> reported Wednesday.</p><p>Sources told the outlet that the early talks are exclusive and would signal the tech company's deeper foray into the consumer audio market. Wondery is the world's largest independent podcast producer, with <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/apple-wondery-deal-sony-acquisition-podcast-industry-2020-11\">more than 100 current podcasts</a> — including its popular \"Dirty John\" show — and a total of 58 million streams or downloads, according to data analytics firm Podtrac. It's the sixth-largest podcast publisher in the US, with 8 million unique listeners as of October.</p><p>Sources told the WSJ that the company's talks with Amazon value it at over $300 million. People familiar with the talks said the preliminary discussions are still being held, and any potential deal could still fall through, according to the report.</p><p>An Amazon spokesperson told Business Insider that the company does not comment on speculation.</p><p>Bloomberg reported in early November that Apple and Sony were among four companies <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/apple-wondery-deal-sony-acquisition-podcast-industry-2020-11\">holding talks to potentially buy Wondery</a>, which was founded in 2016. The podcast startup was seeking $300 million to $400 million which, if met, would mark the podcast industry's largest deal ever.</p><p>News of Amazon's potential acquisition of Wondery comes as the podcast arena continues to burgeon. Spotify acquired Gimlet Media and Anchor for $340 million in 2019 and in May <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/joe-rogan-experience-podcast-spotify-exclusive-2020-5\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"60\" data-uri=\"c9f6fbf6b016e96d38a6972858101b56\">signed a multi-year licensing deal with Joe Rogan</a>, giving the platform exclusive rights to host full episodes of his popular podcast, \"The Joe Rogan Experience.\"</p><p><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/spotify-kim-kardashian-west-podcast-innocence-project-2020-6\">It also struck a deal with Kim Kardashian West in June</a> for an exclusive podcast that will feature her work with the Innocence Project. Spotify is reportedly considering a <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/spotify-considers-podcast-only-subscription-plan-service-2020-11\">podcast-only</a> subscription plan.</p><p><em><strong>Read more:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/podcast-acquisitions-to-watch-2020-2020-11?r=kc-sub\">The podcast market is booming. Here are 5 audio firms that could be acquired next and who might buy them.</a></em></p><p>Amazon reportedly told multiple podcasters in an email in August that <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/amazon-launch-podcasts-disparage-company-2020-8\">the company was considering launching podcasts</a> on its Amazon Music and Audible services. However, the company told the producers that it would only give them a platform if they don't speak badly about Amazon, according to the report. Both Apple and Google offer podcasts as part of their streaming services.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a They're lightweight, moisture-wicking, and built to circumvent annoyances like uncomfortable seams and heel slipping.</p>\n\tAn 8-in-1 pan that helps to declutter your home\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7f4880c655f6001969efec?format=jpeg\" alt=\"image   2020 10 08T131152.377\" height=\"600\" width=\"800\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Our Place</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://www.pntrac.com/t/TUJGR0lNTkJGSEhLR01CR0ZMTUVN?url=https%3A%2F%2Ffromourplace.com%2Fproducts%2Falways-essential-cooking-pan&#38;sid=xid:fr1602177103637jde\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Always Pan, available at Our Place, $145</a></h3><p>Especially if you're spending more time at home cooking &#8212; or more time re-organizing the kitchen &#8212; you can appreciate a beautiful 8-in-1 cookware hack.</p><p>The Always Pan from startup Our Place is a fry pan, saute pan, steamer, skillet, saucier, saucepan, non-stick pan, spatula, and spoon rest in the space of a single pan. It's a clever generalist that's extremely convenient for small spaces or minimalist cooks. <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/our-place-cookware-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">You can read our review here</a>.</p>\n\tA lounge set to relax in\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f9823c14743a3001216bd85?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Gift guides Lively\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Lively</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/fs-bin/click?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&#38;offerid=644795.220&#38;type=3&#38;subid=0\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">The Cozy Lounge Kit, available at LIVELY, $95 (originally $125) [You save $30]</a></h3><p>Since many people are spending more time at home than ever before, it's never been clearer that comfort is key. LIVELY's lounge kit comes equipped with the brand's cozy All Day Lounge Set, a sleep mask for some extra shut-eye, The Best Day Ever Socks, and the Cotton Duster. It's $80, but it's an at-home pro-quality facial she can use anytime &#8212; which is a fraction of the price required for regular facials.</p>\n\tA framed keepsake of a favorite memory\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f32b0f40ef1882a0874c33e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Framebridge sale\" height=\"720\" width=\"960\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Framebridge</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://www.gopjn.com/t/TUJGR0hOTEJGSEhLR01CR0VHTEVL?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.framebridge.com%2Fgifts%3Fsscid%3Dc1k3_othbg&#38;sid=biip_110818_gifts-girlfriend\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow nofollow\">Framed photo, available at Framebridge, from $39</a><br /><br /><a href=\"https://www.pjtra.com/t/TUJGR0hOTEJGSEhLR01CR0VHTEVL?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.framebridge.com%2Flp%2Fgift-cards&#38;sid=biip_110818_gifts-girlfriend\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow\">Gift Card, available at Framebridge, from $25</a></h3><p>Framebridge makes custom framing for not-custom-framing prices. You can print or paint something on your own and have it framed, or have them print and frame it, and&#160;<a href=\"https://www.pntrs.com/t/TUJGR0hOTEJGSEhLR01CR0VHTEVL?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.framebridge.com%2Flp%2Fdesign-services&#38;sid=biip_110818_gifts-girlfriend\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow\">you can take advantage of the team of designers</a>&#160;for help deciding what frame to get.&#160;</p>\n\t16 highly-rated sheet masks\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f909a1c2121130018740049?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Gifts for girlfriend Dermal\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Amazon/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0797V8QZP/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biip_102720_gifts-for-girlfriend-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B0797V8QZP&#38;linkId=8f7f42fd495a2055fd3f45e7bdc605b3\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow nofollow nofollow nofollow nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Sheet Mask Set, available at Amazon, $21.99</a></h3><p>Grab her 39 sheet masks to make it easier for her to have a frequent and well-deserved \"treat yourself\" day. These are highly-rated and have both vitamin E and collagen included for healthy, happy skin.&#160; &#160;</p>\n\tKitchen towels that rate wines by how well they pair with certain foods\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5cba3e10c3a7c145ef7e67f7?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Screen Shot 2018 11 12 at 11.03.49 AM\" height=\"600\" width=\"800\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Uncommon Goods</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&#38;xs=1&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.wolfandbadger.com%2Fus%2Fwine-pairing-towel-set%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Wine Pairing Towel Set, available at Wolf &#38; Badger, $34</a></h3><p>If she loves having a nice glass of wine and/or cooking, she'll appreciate the thought behind these unique wine pairing towels. Grab a bottle and some corresponding ingredients for a fun night in for the two of you.</p>\n\tA stylish, savvy carry-on with an external battery pack\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f32b08b243817281b372f3d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Away Luggage Monogram\" height=\"683\" width=\"911\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Away</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"http://www.pjatr.com/t/TUJGRkpGSUJGSEhLR01CRkpKS0ZJ?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.awaytravel.com%2Fluggage%2Fcarry-on%2Fgreen\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow\">Carry-On, available at Away, $225</a></h3><p>Away's hyper-popular suitcases deserve their hype. Their hard shell is lightweight but durable, their 360&#176; spinner wheels make for seamless traveling, and the external (and ejectable and TSA-compliant) battery pack included can charge a smartphone five times over so she never has to sit behind a trash can at the airport for access to an outlet again. In addition to cooking classes, Cozymeal offers food tours in various cities (when it's safe to do so).&#160;</p>\n\tThe last weekend bag you'll ever need to buy her\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fc7df1b037cbd0018613612?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Rothy&#39;s The Weekender Bag\" height=\"1072\" width=\"1430\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Rothy&#39;s</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&#38;mid=41244&#38;murl=https%3A%2F%2Frothys.com%2Fbags%2Fproducts%2Fthe-weekender%3Fcolor%3Dmidnight-camo\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Rothy's The Weekender, available at Rothy's, $450</a></h3><p>With its large, padded top handles and roomy interior, Rothy's The Weekender might be the last overnight bag your partner ever needs. It's got multiple pockets and a sturdy insert that helps it maintain its shape. You'll be shocked by how much you can fit in this bag &#8212; definitely enough for a long weekend. It's made of recycled plastic pulled from the ocean <em>and&#160;</em>is machine washable. 10:48:30","updatedTime":"2020-12-03 10:48:30","title":"'Big Short' investor Michael Burry reveals he's short Tesla, tells Elon Musk to issue more stock at its 'ridiculous price'","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/tesla-stock-big-short-michael-burry-elon-musk-share-issuance-2020-12","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fc7ee0250e71a00115587f9?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Michael Burry big short\" height=\"1500\" width=\"3000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Jim Spellman / Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul><li><strong>Michael Burry, whose bet against the housing market was made famous by \"The Big Short,\" revealed in a late Tuesday <a href=\"https://twitter.com/michaeljburry/status/1333998226244964353\">tweet</a> that he is short <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/stocks/tsla-stock\">Tesla</a>.</strong></li><li><strong>The hedge fund manager advised CEO Elon Musk to issue more shares while they sit at their \"ridiculous\" levels.</strong></li><li><strong>\"That's not dilution. You'd be cementing permanence and untold optionality,\" he added.</strong></li><li><strong>Tesla dipped as much as 7.1% on Wednesday before paring losses and trading roughly 3% lower.</strong></li><li><strong><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/stocks/tsla-stock\">Watch Tesla trade live here</a>.</strong></li></ul><hr><p>Famed investor Michael Burry revealed that he's short <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/stocks/tsla-stock\">Tesla</a>, and advised CEO Elon Musk to issue more shares while they sit at their \"current ridiculous\" levels.</p><p>Tesla shares have rallied more than 575% in the year to date, boosted by the company's upcoming inclusion in the S&#38;P 500 and fading profitability concerns. Some of Wall Street's more bearish analysts <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/tesla-stock-price-morgan-stanley-will-surge-from-current-levels-2020-11-1029817453\">have turned more optimistic</a> toward the stock, and favor from waves of retail investors further supported Tesla's lofty valuation.</p><p>Not every bear has been converted, though. Burry reiterated his pessimistic outlook for the company in a late Tuesday <a href=\"https://twitter.com/michaeljburry/status/1333998226244964353\">tweet</a>, adding that Musk should take advantage of the sky-high stock price to raise more cash.</p><p>\"So, @elonmusk, yes, I'm short $TSLA, but some free advice for a good guy ... Seriously, issue 25-50% of your shares at the current ridiculous price. That's not dilution,\" Burry tweeted.</p><p>He continued: \"You'd be cementing permanence and untold optionality. If there are buyers, sell that #TeslaSouffle.\"</p><p><em><strong>Read more:&#160;</strong> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/options-trading-how-investors-can-protect-tech-heavy-portfolios-nasdaq-2020-12\" data-analytics-position=\"4\" data-analytics-module=\"\">The creator of a new volatility index for the Nasdaq 100 shares how investors can protect portfolios loaded with tech names — and explains why he thinks it's superior to the VIX</a></em></p><p>The hashtag seems to reference a letter Musk sent to Tesla employees on Tuesday, in which he warned that the automaker's stock could \"get crushed like a souffle under a sledgehammer\" if profit margins don't improve.</p><p>The automaker fell as much as 7.4% Wednesday morning before paring losses and trading roughly 3% lower.</p><p>Burry rose to fame after the financial crisis for his then-unusual bet against the housing market. His trade was captured in Michael Lewis' bestselling novel \"The Big Short.\" He was played by Christian Bale in the 2015 film adaptation.</p><p>The hedge fund manager included a spreadsheet in the tweet detailing Tesla's financial performance against older automakers. The company touts an industry-high market capitalization but posts total profits and revenues far below those seen by Toyota, Volkswagen, and other major car companies.</p><p>Burry has espoused his bearish outlook online in the past. Ahead of Tesla's Battery Day event, the investor highlighted Tesla's thin margins and questioned the rationality of its industry-leading market cap. Though the automaker has steadily notched quarterly profits since the late-September event, its valuation has only swung higher.</p><p>Tesla traded at $566.25 per share as of 3:30 p.m. ET Wednesday. The company has 22 \"buy\" ratings, 42 \"hold\" ratings, and 19 \"sell\" ratings from analysts.</p><p><strong><em>Now read more markets coverage from Markets Insider and Business Insider:</em></strong></p><p><strong><em><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/salesforce-q3-earnings-stock-price-slack-deal-weak-growth-guidance-2020-12-1029858085\" Smith</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul><li><strong>US stocks erased their morning losses and closed higher on Wednesday as investors once again latched onto hope that another round of fiscal stimulus is imminent.</strong></li><li><strong>Democratic leaders embraced a bipartisan proposal for $908 billion in stimulus, as they hope to get the bill passed and enacted before crucial unemployment benefits expire next month.</strong></li><li><strong><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/indices\">Watch major indexes update live here</a>.</strong></li></ul><hr><p>After an initial morning decline, US stocks finished mostly higher on Wednesday as investors latched onto hope that another round of fiscal stimulus to hasten the economic recovery is just around the corner.</p><p>Democratic leaders <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/democrats-just-embraced-a-908-billion-coronavirus-stimulus-plan-2020-12\">embraced a bipartisan stimulus deal</a> that would include up to $908 billion in funding for various initiatives, including expanded unemployment benefits and an extension of the paycheck protection program.</p><p>Congressional leaders hope to get the stimulus bill passed and enacted before crucial unemployment benefits expire next month. Both President Donald Trump and President-elect Joe Biden have said they support another stimulus deal.</p><p><strong>Here's where US indexes stood at the 4 p.m. ET market close on Wednesday:</strong></p><ul><li><strong><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/index/s&p_500_500\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">S&#38;P 500</a>:</strong> 3,669.01, up 0.2%</li><li><strong><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/index/dow_jones\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Dow Jones industrial average</a>:</strong> 29,883.79, up 0.2% (60 points)</li><li><strong><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/index/nasdaq_composite\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Nasdaq composite</a>:</strong> 12,349.37, down 0.1%</li></ul><p><em><strong>Read more:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/zoom-stock-outlook-top-analysts-forecast-price-after-covid-vaccine-2020-12\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Zoom has soared 497% this year. 3 analysts — including one of the most accurate in tech — break down whether you should buy, hold, or sell the stock as a vaccine becomes widely available.</a></em></p><p>Investors also remain hopeful that a swift rollout of COVID-19 vaccines will lead to a quick reopening of the global economy. The UK became the first country to approve Pfizer and BioNTech's COVID-19 vaccine for emergency use authorization, with nearly 1 million doses expected to be shipped to the country next week.</p><p>The US Food and Drug Administration is expected to grant emergency authorization for Pfizer's COVID-19 vaccine next week. <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/when-coronavirus-vaccines-will-be-rolled-out-countries-goldman-sachs-2020-12\">Goldman Sachs released an estimate</a> of when the vaccine could be rolled out to advanced economies.</p><p>The economy could use an extra dose of stimulus and the vaccine, as November's ADP jobs report missed expectations on Wednesday. The <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/us-private-payroll-november-adp-jobs-economic-data-unemployment-recovery-2020-12\">ADP's jobs report</a> said companies added 307,000 new jobs in November, well below economists' expectations of 440,000 jobs, and below October's revised figure of 404,000 jobs.</p><p><em><strong>Read more:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/stocks-to-buy-31-set-to-become-growth-engines-hsbc-2020-12\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">HSBC says buy these 31 global stocks that are exposed to the pandemic's biggest tech disruptions and set to become growth engines of the future</a></em></p><p>Investors had their eyes on <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/stocks/work-stock\">Slack</a> and <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/stocks/crm-stock\">Salesforce</a> on Wednesday. On Tuesday, Salesforce <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/salesforce-slack-acquisition-merger-deal-2020-11\">announced a $27.7 billion acquisition of Slack</a> as it looks to better compete against collaborative enterprise-software providers like Microsoft. Shares of Salesforce traded down as much as 12%.</p><p><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/stocks/mrk-stock\">Merck</a> said <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/merck-sells-investment-stake-in-moderna-after-recording-substantial-gain-2020-12-1029859196\">it sold its investment stake</a>&#160;in <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/stocks/mrna-stock\">Moderna</a> and recorded a \"substantial\" gain thanks to it's high-flying rally in 2020. Merck invested $50 million in Moderna in 2015, and $125 million in 2018, before the biotech company was public.</p><p><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/stocks/pltr-stock\">Palantir</a> fell as much as 18% after <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/palantir-stock-price-morgan-stanley-downgrades-company-on-valuation-2020-12-1029858985\">Morgan Stanley downgraded the company to Underweight</a> due to a heightened valuation with no underlying change in the company's fundamentals.</p><p>Oil prices climbed. <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/commodities/oil-price?type=wti\">West Texas Intermediate crude</a> rose as much as 3.1%, to $45.92 per barrel. <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/commodities/oil-price?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestts&#38;utm_medium=ingest\">Brent crude</a>, oil's international benchmark, increased 2.8%, to $48.76 per barrel, at intraday highs.</p><p><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/commodities/gold-price\">Gold</a> gained as much as 1%, to $1,832.56 per ounce.</p><p><em><strong>Read more:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/real-estate-investing-strategy-airbnb-shelby-osborne-shares-unique-strategy-2020-12\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Shelby Osborne achieved financial freedom using a unique twist on a classic real-estate investment strategy. Here's how she built a portfolio of 53 units, starting in her early 20s.</a></em></p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a (Matthew Fox)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f577a1e7ed0ee001e25dd96?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn11@2020_1/2020/12/03/02-48-55-347_7f2f79b498387226.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn3@2020_2/2020/12/03/02-49-00-176_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=V5tf1xdnVSI:VVWzTnszgJ8:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn47@2020_5/2020/12/03/02-48-57-442_1eb9cab39d40994e.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=V5tf1xdnVSI:VVWzTnszgJ8:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn88@2020_3/2020/12/03/02-49-00-802_e4f847b8d29db656.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn99@2020_3/2020/12/03/02-48-56-007_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=V5tf1xdnVSI:VVWzTnszgJ8:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn32@2020_4/2020/12/03/02-48-57-377_f0ee9b8d32e851dc.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/V5tf1xdnVSI":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn68@2020_6/2020/12/03/02-48-58-175_9056c50a74487646.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1606963710014},{"createdTime":"2020-12-03 10:48:30","updatedTime":"2020-12-03 10:48:30","title":"9 cheap and free online French classes to help beginners build their vocabulary, fix their grammar, and perfect pronunciation","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-learn-french-fast-online-courses-apps-duolingo-babbel-rosetta-stone","description":"<p class=\"financial-disclaimer\"><i>When you buy through our links, we may earn money from our affiliate partners. <a href=\"https://www.insider-inc.com/commerce-on-insider-inc/\">Learn more.</a></i></p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fc7c417037cbd0018613553?format=jpeg\" alt=\"French Language Learning IPhone 4x3\" height=\"1250\" width=\"1667\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Alyssa Powell/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>French is one of the most popular languages in the world and <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/100-most-spoken-languages-1028908456\">is spoken by over 279 million people</a>. If you want to learn, there are plenty of great online courses, apps, books, and even TV shows to teach you.</li><li>Below, you'll find nine online resources to learn French (or improve upon what you already know). They're organized around core language learning, grammar, pronunciation, and cultural immersion.</li><li>Read more: <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-learn-spanish-online-beginner-classes-apps-books\" data-analytics-position=\"10\" data-analytics-module=\"\">The 8 best apps, courses, and books to start learning Spanish</a></li><li><a href=\"https://newsletter.businessinsider.com/join/4np/insider-picks\">Sign up for Insider Reviews' weekly newsletter for more buying advice and great deals</a>.</li></ul><p>If <a href=\"https://www.insider.com/emily-in-paris-unrealistic-moments-season-one-netflix-2020-10\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\"Emily in Paris\"</a> spurred your desire to brush off your high school French textbook, you're not alone — French is the fifth most popular language in the world, <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/100-most-spoken-languages-1028908456\">with over 279 million speakers</a>. Learning <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-learn-spanish-online-beginner-classes-apps-books\">any language </a>is a great use of any extra downtime right now, and there are many online resources that can help you master French, whether you're a <em>débutant</em> or nearly fluent speaker.<br><br>The courses, apps, and other resources below are organized by what you want to work on, whether it's covering the core basics of French, improving your pronunciation, perfecting your grammar, or just getting some extra practice in.</p><h3>Here are nine affordable and free online classes, apps, and resources to help you learn how to speak French.</h3>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tFor basic language acquisition\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fc7e93a50e71a00115587c7?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Paris\" height=\"2646\" width=\"3529\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">t: Alexander Spatari/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<div id=\"ProductCard_5fc7a7d6bca41b29df78bc68\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5fc7a7d6bca41b29df78bc68&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><p><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/duolingo-review-guide-learning-language-2018-1\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Duolingo's</a> free mobile app turns language-learning into a game with levels to overcome and rewards to earn. As the over 300 million users can attest: it works! Bite-sized lessons make Duolingo easy to integrate into your daily routine, and free access means that it doesn't take much to get started. It's the perfect tool for those reticent of making too hasty a financial or time commitment &#8211; just sign up, sign in, and you'll be learning French in no time.</p><div id=\"ProductCard_5fbef66cbf93dc2e860a6574\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5fbef66cbf93dc2e860a6574&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><p>Designed by professional linguists, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/babbel-language-learning-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Babbel's</a> goal is to get you speaking French in a practical and realistic way, with phrases you'd use if you had to navigate a city or make simple conversation. The best-selling language learning app is great for those who want to devote a bit more time, effort, and cash ($7 a month if you commit to a year), all the while taking advantage of continuous access whenever your phone is near (i.e&#8230;. all the time).&#160;</p><div id=\"ProductCard_5fc7a951664756386976d50f\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5fc7a951664756386976d50f&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><p><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/rosetta-stone-language-courses-sale-amazon-gold-box-deal-2016-5\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Rosetta Stone's</a> time-tested techniques for language learning have a good rep for a reason. Accompanying learners from the beginning stages of language acquisition all the way up to fluency, Rosetta Stone stands out from other apps thanks to its almost immediate, full immersion in the target language. It also boasts a number of specialized tools including TruAccent technology, a speech recognition app that corrects your pronunciation.</p>\n\tFor accent perfection\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fc7e99b037cbd0018613676?format=jpeg\" alt=\"brussels belgium\" height=\"2649\" width=\"3532\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Alexander Spatari/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<div id=\"ProductCard_5fc7aa9383bd0b2af71e7824\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5fc7aa9383bd0b2af71e7824&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><p>With its nasal vowels and uvular \"r,\" the French accent is famously elusive to master. That's where \"Sound Like a Native\" comes in. This <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/udemy-best-online-classes\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Udemy</a> course is specially designed to help improve your pronunciation with exercises you can easily practice at home. The course costs just under $100 for lifetime access to two hours of video and loads of other resources. Experienced French instructor Anne Le Grand is captivating and supremely talented; with her as your guide, you'll soon be pronouncing like a near-native.</p><div id=\"ProductCard_5fc7ab2ffe994d3c805f3d5a\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5fc7ab2ffe994d3c805f3d5a&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><p>Perfecting your pronunciation can be tough in a vacuum, so if you need a bit of interaction to master this or any other aspects of French, look no further than Interpals. The free language exchange interface allows you to find a conversation partner to speak to &#8212;&#160;which can especially be nice during quarantine. While not a certified teacher, this person will certainly be able to grant you much-needed practice and help you navigate the ins and outs of pronunciation woes. This is the perfect option for the speaker who's already fairly fluent but wants to improve spoken and colloquial French.</p>\n\tFor grammar mastery\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fc7ebe7037cbd0018613694?format=jpeg\" alt=\"quebec city\" height=\"2663\" width=\"3551\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Yanis Ourabah/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<div id=\"ProductCard_5fc7acce64795039b94ff623\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5fc7acce64795039b94ff623&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><p>This is the only French grammar book you'll ever need. \"Une Fois Pour Toutes\" was originally developed as a companion textbook for intermediate and advanced French language classes, but even without a teacher, the textbook offers a no-nonsense approach to some of the most difficult elements of French grammar. If you are ready to learn once and for all when to use which past tense and how to figure out the gender of a noun, this is the tome for you.</p><div id=\"ProductCard_5fc7ad5ac5e67e37886f6fd1\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5fc7ad5ac5e67e37886f6fd1&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><p>This exam prep course offered through <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/edx-overview-faq\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">edX</a> was originally designed to help students prepare for an AP French Language and Culture class, but it's helpful for any intermediate learner who wants to review some of the basics. In the three-week course, students brush up on essential grammar topics including conjugations, pronouns, and essay writing, perfect for the so-called \"false beginner\" who has had quite a bit of contact with the French language but wants to revise some or several grammar topics. The course is free to audit, and $25 for a certificate to add to your LinkedIn profile or resume.</p>\n\tFor cultural immersion and fluency\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fc7ec2550e71a00115587ef?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Provence, France\" height=\"2664\" width=\"3552\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Peter Zelei Images/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<div id=\"ProductCard_5fc7b136935fea3bcb3bc924\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5fc7b136935fea3bcb3bc924&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><p>One of the best ways to perfect your grasp of French is by consuming French media. And while there's no dearth of French movies at your disposal, French television may be an even better option. \"Un Village Fran&#231;ais\" is a show set in a small French town during the Nazi occupation. With phenomenal scriptwriting and acting, a 72-episode show like \"Un Village Fran&#231;ais\" will also give you the regular exposure you need to approach fluency. Best of all? It's easily available on <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/is-amazon-prime-worth-it\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Amazon Prime</a>.</p><div id=\"ProductCard_5fc7b1c66647563b08797e34\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5fc7b1c66647563b08797e34&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><p>Another great way to soak up the French language is with radio and podcasts. France Inter is a phenomenal resource with cultural, news, and even humor programs. Browse your favorite topics from history to politics to current events, and let the radio waves do the rest. And since these programs are available online, you can stop, rewind, and replay as many times as you need to ensure you've mastered what you've heard.&#160;</p>\n</div><div Monaco)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5fc7c417037cbd0018613553?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn15@2020_6/2020/12/03/02-48-52-379_d97375dbbea4402f.webp","https://i.insider.com/5fc7e93a50e71a00115587c7?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn59@2020_4/2020/12/03/02-49-01-414_52be306a651c62d8.webp","https://i.insider.com/5fc7e99b037cbd0018613676?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn55@2020_2/2020/12/03/02-48-54-580_2b8c9103018f886e.webp","https://i.insider.com/5fc7ebe7037cbd0018613694?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn12@2020_2/2020/12/03/02-49-01-087_d8cadc2b87b04f5b.webp","https://i.insider.com/5fc7ec2550e71a00115587ef?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn79@2020_3/2020/12/03/02-48-52-098_52032154737ee92d.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn3@2020_2/2020/12/03/02-49-00-176_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=EI4jgJz40EY:6rB2Ehe3u0U:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn48@2020_6/2020/12/03/02-49-01-305_bd91f6ba484b1305.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=EI4jgJz40EY:6rB2Ehe3u0U:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn48@2020_2/2020/12/03/02-48-58-953_59a1a6eb9c074d59.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn99@2020_3/2020/12/03/02-48-56-007_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=EI4jgJz40EY:6rB2Ehe3u0U:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn51@2020_3/2020/12/03/02-48-54-464_d427f43e4371e22d.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/EI4jgJz40EY":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn84@2020_4/2020/12/03/02-48-59-243_ebfd54175683723e.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1606963710010},{"createdTime":"2020-12-03 10:48:30","updatedTime":"2020-12-03 10:48:30","title":"How to report a fleet on Twitter if it violates the platform's community guidelines","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-report-a-fleet-on-twitter","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fc6ae91037cbd0018613357?format=jpeg\" alt=\"hands holding smart phone texting\" height=\"1249\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Twitter lets you report fleets that contain harmful content.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Klaus Vedfelt/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>You can report a fleet on Twitter, just like you can with a tweet, if it contains offensive or graphic content.</li>\n<li>Fleets, Twitter's latest feature, allows users can post ephemeral images, videos, and text.&#160;</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/tech-reference\"><strong>Visit Business Insider's Tech Reference library for more stories</strong></a><strong>.</strong></li>\n</ul><p>The latest feature from <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/category/twitter\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Twitter</a>, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/category/fleets\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Fleets</a>, allows users to post story-like videos, images, and tweets that disappear in 24 hours.&#160;</p><p>Reporting a fleet is just as simple as reporting a tweet. If you find a fleet to be breaking <a href=\"https://help.twitter.com/en/rules-and-policies\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Twitter's policies and community guidelines</a>, be sure to report it so it can be flagged for the appropriate moderator.</p><p>Right now, fleets can only be accessed on Twitter's mobile app.&#160;</p><h2><strong>How to report a fleet on the Twitter mobile app&#160;</strong></h2><p><strong>1.</strong> Open the Twitter mobile app on your device.&#160;</p><p><strong>2.</strong> Find and select the fleet you wish to report for violating Twitter's community guidelines. Fleets can be found at the top of the homepage, or accessed through a user's profile page by clicking their profile photo.&#160;</p><p><strong>3.</strong> Once you've found the fleet you wish to report, select the down arrow at the top right corner of the screen next to the \"X\" icon.&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fc6aa3150e71a001155848e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"ReportFleet1__2_\" height=\"1164\" width=\"817\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Tap the down arrow in the upper right corner of the fleet.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Meira Gebel/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>4.</strong> In the pop-up window, select \"Report Fleet.\"</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fc6a84d50e71a0011558484?format=jpeg\" alt=\"ReportFleet1__1_\" height=\"1727\" width=\"817\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Select &#34;Report Fleet&#34; in the pop-up.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Meira Gebel/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>5.</strong> On the next page, under \"Report an Issue,\" select the type of issue that most pertains to the violation.&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fc6a8f950e71a001155848b?format=jpeg\" alt=\"ReportFleet2\" height=\"817\" width=\"824\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Choose a reason for reporting the fleet.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Meira Gebel/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>6.</strong> Follow the prompts in the following windows, and then select \"Done\" in the upper right corner.&#160;</p><p><strong>7.</strong> Once Twitter has resolved the issue regarding your report, they will typically send you a notification, which can be found in your Notifications tab.</p><h2><strong>Related coverage from&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/tech-reference\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\">Tech Reference</a>:</strong></h2><ul><li><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-share-a-fleet-in-a-tweet\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\">How to share a fleet in a tweet on Twitter's mobile app<br></a></h3></li><li><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-post-fleet-on-twitter\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\">How to post a fleet on Twitter in 2 ways, and share temporary text, pictures, or videos</a></h3></li><li><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-long-can-a-fleet-be-on-twitter\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\">How long can a fleet be on Twitter? Gebel)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5fc6ae91037cbd0018613357?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn28@2020_3/2020/12/03/02-49-01-158_243351844f131d29.webp","https://i.insider.com/5fc6aa3150e71a001155848e?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn52@2020_3/2020/12/03/02-49-02-141_883587c7c3baaa44.webp","https://i.insider.com/5fc6a84d50e71a0011558484?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn23@2020_6/2020/12/03/02-48-56-211_c99f4a308d486863.webp","https://i.insider.com/5fc6a8f950e71a001155848b?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn64@2020_3/2020/12/03/02-49-01-843_63669f03b87d5feb.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn3@2020_2/2020/12/03/02-49-00-176_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=wqKhmYD6ww4:B1Raotg526M:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn31@2020_1/2020/12/03/02-48-50-674_7f75f08b5f9fdbda.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=wqKhmYD6ww4:B1Raotg526M:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn59@2020_5/2020/12/03/02-48-53-763_42fc047d12ed7e98.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn99@2020_3/2020/12/03/02-48-56-007_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=wqKhmYD6ww4:B1Raotg526M:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn88@2020_4/2020/12/03/02-48-51-295_cbe14be0c7b80f1b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/wqKhmYD6ww4":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn20@2020_2/2020/12/03/02-48-56-186_eda72054be871098.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1606963710016},{"createdTime":"2020-12-03 10:48:30","updatedTime":"2020-12-03 10:48:30","title":"Operation Warp Speed's top scientist predicts more than 100 million Americans could be immunized with coronavirus vaccines within the next 100 days","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/moncef-slaoui-100-million-americans-vaccinated-by-march-2021-2020-12","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5faf034b402d49001924ef47?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Moncef Slaoui\" height=\"683\" width=\"910\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Moncef Slaoui, chief adviser to Operation Warp Speed, speaks in the Rose Garden of the White House, Friday, Nov. 13, 2020, in Washington.\n<p class=\"copyright\">AP Photo/Evan Vucci</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Moncef Slaoui, the top scientist advising the US government's Operation Warp Speed, predicted that more than 100 million Americans would be vaccinated against COVID-19 within the next 100 days.</li>\n<li>Slaoui said 20 million Americans should be immunized in December, then 30 million more in January and 50 million in February.</li>\n<li>By the end of February, \"we will have potentially immunized 100 million people, which is really more or less the size of the significant at-risk population: the elderly, the healthcare workers, the first-line workers, people with comorbidities,\" Slaoui said.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>The co-leader of the US government's Operation Warp Speed coronavirus vaccine initiative on Wednesday outlined the most ambitious timeline yet for vaccinating the most vulnerable Americans against COVID-19.</p><p>Moncef Slaoui, Warp Speed's chief advisor, predicted that 100 million Americans would be immunized by the end of February.</p><p>Twenty million Americans should be vaccinated in December, followed by 30 million more in January and 50 million more in February, the former pharmaceutical executive said in a press briefing.</p><p>By then, \"we will have potentially immunized 100 million people, which is really more or less the size of the significant at-risk population: the elderly, the healthcare workers, the first-line workers, people with comorbidities,\" Slaoui said.</p><p>His prediction is based on anticipated vaccine supplies from Pfizer and Moderna, the two vaccine frontrunners. Neither vaccine has yet received an emergency OK from US regulators, but both companies have submitted their shots to the US Food and Drug Administration for evaluation.&#160;</p><p>A former pharmaceutical industry executive, Slaoui was picked by the Trump administration in mid-May to guide the US effort to quickly develop coronavirus vaccines and treatments. He spent 30 years working at the drugmaker GlaxoSmithKline, where he developed 14 vaccines, <a href=\"https://www.usatoday.com/in-depth/news/health/2020/12/01/operation-warp-speeds-moncef-slaoui-guided-covid-19-vaccine-creation/6375043002/\">according to USA Today</a>. More recently, he served on the board at Moderna, but stepped down from that role when he signed on with Operation Warp Speed.</p><p>Slaoui, who's a registered Democrat, has taken pains to distance the Warp Speed program from political pressure. He has repeatedly said he would resign if he felt interference from political operatives.</p><p>Results from late-stage studies that enrolled tens of thousands of volunteers indicated that both vaccines <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/moderna-coronavirus-vaccine-works-to-prevent-covid-19-company-says-2020-11\">were highly effective</a> — about 95% — at preventing symptomatic COVID-19 compared with a placebo. Questions remain about how durable that protection is and whether the vaccines <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/vaccine-experts-pitch-asymptomatic-covid-19-vaccine-trials-2020-11\">also reduce transmission and prevent asymptomatic infections</a>.</p><p>The FDA is now reviewing both vaccine applications and is expected to issue decisions on emergency authorizations before the year's end. British health authorities <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/pfizer-and-biontech-covid-19-vaccines-approved-by-uk-regulator-2020-11\">authorized Pfizer's vaccine</a> on Wednesday, making the UK the first Western country to approve a coronavirus vaccine.</p><p><em><strong>Read more:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/insider-pfizer-biontech-historic-coronavirus-vaccine-program-2020-11\">How the pharma giant Pfizer teamed up with a little-known biotech to develop an effective coronavirus vaccine in record time</a></em></p><p>Warp Speed is prepared to start shipping doses to states within a day or two of an authorization decision, officials said. The federal government is splitting up limited doses proportionally to each state's population, with governors deciding where Warp Speed ships the doses in their states.</p><p>State officials will also be responsible for ultimately deciding which Americans are the first to get the vaccines, which are given as a two-dose regimen. An advisory group to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/healthcare-workers-long-term-care-residents-recommended-to-get-vaccines-first-2020-12\">recommended that frontline healthcare workers and nursing-home residents</a> get the highest priority.</p><p>Warp Speed has spent billions to secure supplies from these leading drugmakers.</p><p>Slaoui also said he expected additional experimental COVID-19 vaccine programs run by Johnson &#38; Johnson and <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/6-key-questions-on-astrazenecas-coronavirus-vaccine-2020-11\">AstraZeneca</a> to produce definitive data in January. If either or both of those vaccines were to secure a regulatory green light, that would add further upside to Warp Speed's supply projections, he said.</p><p><em><strong>Read more:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-moderna-developed-coronavirus-vaccine-record-time-2020-11\">Inside Moderna's historic coronavirus vaccine program that transformed the biotech upstart into a $57 billion drug industry powerhouse</a></em></p><p>Slaoui's become more optimistic about the pace of vaccinations in the US. In mid-November, he said about 7<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/when-will-i-get-a-coronavirus-vaccine-moncef-slaoui-distribution-2020-11\">0 million to 80 million people in the US</a> were likely to be vaccinated by the end of February.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a 10:48:30","updatedTime":"2020-12-03 10:48:30","title":"Trading and investing are two approaches to playing the stock market that bring their own benefits and risks","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/trading-vs-investing","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fc8120350e71a00115588de?format=jpeg\" alt=\"trading vs investing\" height=\"1500\" width=\"3000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Your financial goals, knack for fast-thinking, and ability to stomach price swings all help determine whether trading or investing suits you more.\n<p class=\"copyright\">LanaStock/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Trading and investing are two different approaches to the stock market, and which is better depends largely on your time commitment and tolerance for risk.&#160;</li>\n<li>Investing involves buying an asset you expect will rise in value over time, with the goal of long-term gains.</li>\n<li>Trading, on the other hand, is about timing market moves and buying and selling stocks within a short period for quick profits.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/investing-reference\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-module=\"summary_bullets\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"0\"><strong>Visit Business Insider's Investing Reference library for more stories.</strong></a></li>\n</ul><p>Actively trading stocks has always been a popular pastime, especially during the long bull market of the 2010s. But during the coronavirus pandemic of 2020, its popularity has <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/day-trading-boom-reduced-market-volatility-veteran-trader-says-2020-8-1029461086\">reached new heights</a>.&#160;</p><p>Many traders have become online celebrities. Perhaps you even know someone personally who's jumped on the trading train and you're wondering if you should climb aboard as well — as opposed to just feeding your 401(k) with each paycheck, or investing in the occasional mutual fund.</p><p>But it's important to understand that the words \"active\" and \"investor\" rarely belong next to each other.&#160;</p><p>Trading and investing are two different ways of approaching the stock market. With trading, you're hoping to earn quick returns based on short-term fluctuations in the market. Long-term investors, in contrast, tend to <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-diversify-portfolio\">build diversified portfolios</a> of assets and stay in them through the ups and downs of the market.</p><p>Due to the high-stakes nature of trading and its inherent risks, many investors — especially individuals — may want to avoid it altogether. However, others may want to allocate some of their available funds towards trading and the rest towards long-term investing. Let's take a closer look at the basics of each strategy and their pros and cons.&#160;&#160;</p><h2>Investing basics</h2><p>Investing involves putting money into a financial asset (stocks, bonds, mutual or exchange-traded fund, etc). that you expect will rise in value over time. Investors generally have a long time horizon and predominantly look to build wealth through gradual appreciation and <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/what-is-compound-interest\">compound interest</a> rather than short-term gains.</p><p>The shorter the time horizon, the higher the risk that you could lose money on an investment. That's why the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC)'s<a href=\"https://www.investor.gov/sites/investorgov/files/2019-02/Saving-and-Investing.pdf\"> Office of Investor Education and Advocacy recommends</a> putting money in a savings account if you'll need to access it within three years. For all other goals, investing could yield much better returns. Some investors may even plan to hold onto their investments for multiple decades.&#160;</p><p><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/what-is-diversification\">Diversification</a> (owning a mix of investments) is important for investors as it can reduce their risk — mainly by mitigating the effects of volatility (rapid, violent, or unexpected changes in values or price). Today, investors can achieve instant diversification through <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/personal-finance/how-to-invest-in-mutual-funds-step-by-step-guide\">mutual funds</a> and <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/personal-finance/what-is-an-etf-exchange-traded-fund\">ETFs</a> — single investment vehicles that hold a variety of or a large number of assets. It's also important to consider your risk tolerance and estimated withdrawal date when selecting your portfolio's asset allocation.</p><p>If investors do choose individual stocks or bonds, they'll typically look at fundamental indicators — that is, elements intrinsic to the issuing company, like its earnings, history, or creditworthiness. These factors help locate stocks that are undervalued (i.e. value investing) or have a chance to enjoy significant capital appreciation (i.e. <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/investing-reference\">growth investing</a>).</p><h2>Trading basics</h2><p>Trading involves buying and selling stocks or other securities in a short period of time with the goal of making quick profits. While investors typically measure their time horizon in years, traders think in terms of weeks, days, or even minutes.&#160;&#160;</p><p>Two of the most common forms of trading are day trading and swing trading. Day traders buy and sell a security within the same trading day; positions are never held overnight. Swing traders, on the other hand, buy assets that they expect will rise in value over a matter of days or weeks.</p><p>In the world of trading, a stock's fundamentals are fairly irrelevant. Even if a stock's value is expected to go up over the long-term, that doesn't necessarily mean it will do so over the next few minutes, or even days. That's why traders tend to rely more heavily on <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com.au/category/technical-analysis\">technical analysis</a> of market movements and news reports to inform their trade decisions.</p><p>Trading can be a risky enterprise. If a trade goes against you, you can lose a lot of money in a short period of time. And traders often increase their risk by using leverage — that is, borrowing money or buying assets with money they don't yet have. Options, trading on margin, or short selling are all ways of leveraging.</p><p>Famous traders often appear more skilled and knowledgeable than the \"little guy\" (or gal). And while it's true that some traders are more proficient at reading charts and performing technical analysis than others, no one can accurately predict every trade. Celebrity traders can (and do) lose big on trades too.</p><p>If you're interested in trying your hand at trading, taking small position sizes (that is, not spending a big amount) can reduce your risk of losing big on any one trade. Other tips include setting a stop-loss order that will automatically execute if the asset drops below a certain price (thereby limiting your losses).</p><h2>Is one better than the other?</h2><p>Although they both involve the financial markets and assets, trading and investing are really two different activities, with different aims. So comparisons and generalizations are tricky.</p><p>Overall, though, trading is riskier for two reasons:&#160;</p><ul><li>It involves a lot of speculation — that is, quick decisions, educated guesses and just plain gambles.</li><li>It demands minimal (or no) diversification since it's difficult to monitor more than a few trades at the same time. Also, diversification by its \"evens-out\" nature mitigates both the ups and the downs — and traders want the maximum highs they can get.</li></ul><p>However, it should be noted that trading can also mean higher returns. Investors may hope to earn 8% to 10% on their portfolio per year. But a trader may hope to earn that much or more per <em>month</em>. Even traders who earned \"just\" 5% per month would end up with an uncompounded annual return of 60%.</p><p>For these reasons, it's difficult to crown either strategy as the \"best\" way to approach the stock market. If you have a low <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com.au/category/risk-tolerance\">risk tolerance</a> and want to avoid volatility, investing will be the way to go. But if you're more of a risk-taker and would like the chance to earn big returns fast, trading could be appealing.</p><p>It's important to understand that trading and investing don't necessarily have to be mutually exclusive. For example, you may choose to invest 90% of your money in a diversified portfolio that you'll hold onto for the long haul and earmark the other 10% — your play money, in effect —for short-term, speculative trading.</p><h2>The financial takeaway</h2><p>Trading can be a thrilling way to earn quick cash. However, like with gambling, <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/day-trader-made-million-lost-it-all-cautionary-tale-investing-2020-7-1029383192\">it can also quickly lead to big losses</a>. Investing usually means smaller short-term wins, but also fewer severe losses.</p><p>If you're comfortable with the risks, trading with a portion of your money can be enjoyable and could lead to profits. If reducing risk and exposure to volatility are your main goals, then you'll want to stick with long-term investing. But if you're saving for a <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/sc/financial-goals-guide-2017-6\">financial goal</a> that you hope to reach by a specific time, a slow-and-steady investing approach is usually best.</p><h2>Related Coverage in&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/investing-reference\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\">Investing</a>:</h2><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/what-is-common-stock\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\">What is common stock? The most typical way to invest in a company and profit from its growth</a></h3><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/what-is-market-cap\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-position=\"2\" data-analytics-module=\"featured_post\">Market capitalization tells you how much a company is worth, and whether buying its stock suits your overall investing strategy</a></h3><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/what-is-diversification\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-position=\"23\" data-analytics-module=\"\">What is diversification? A portfolio strategy that uses a variety of investments to limit risk</a></h3><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/what-is-an-index-fund\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-position=\"27\" data-analytics-module=\"\">What is an index fund? A low-cost, low-risk way to invest in the stock market</a></h3><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/passive-investing\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-position=\"37\" as COVID-19 cases rose in the city, according to the <a But what we did was stay compliant with the rules.\"</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>The mayor of Austin, Texas, urged his constituents to \"stay home\" on a video call from a timeshare in Cabo San Lucas last month where he traveled on a private jet with eight family members and guests, according to the <a href=\"https://www.kvue.com/article/news/investigations/defenders/austin-mayor-steve-adler-coronavirus-covid-19-daughter-wedding-vacation/269-d76bf9b8-54bb-4736-9b00-80fdf2953145\">Austin Statesman and KVUE</a>.</p><p>\"Stay home if you can ... this is not the time to relax,\" said Steve Adler in the video, which was shared Facebook on November 9.&#160;</p><p>Adler kept the jaunt under wraps until local journalist Tony Plohetski broke the story Wednesday afternoon. The Democrat then confirmed the trip to Mexico and said he also hosted a wedding for his daughter the day before flying out for his vacation. Plohetski reported that 20 people attended the celebration.</p><p>According to Adler, neither his trip nor the wedding violated any of his own orders or Texas' COVID-19 restrictions.</p><p>\"It's not perfect,\" Adler said during an interview this week, according to the local ABC affiliate, KVUE. \"Obviously there are infections that could happen. But what we did was stay compliant with the rules.\"</p><iframe width=\"560\" height=\"315\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/fBXjr81SeVY\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen></iframe><p>In his video address, the mayor gave no indication he was out of town.</p><p>He also noted some constituents \"seem to be a little reticent\" when reached by the city's contact tracers.</p><p>As for the wedding, Adler said in a statement that he consulted with health officials \"and worked hard to model the kind of behavior I've asked of the community.\"</p><p>\"We ask everyone to be as safe as possible in what they do,\" he continued in the statement. \"My family and I are no exception and we'll continue to do as I ask of our community. During Thanksgiving and as anticipated for Christmas and the New Year, we should all be especially mindful.\"&#160;</p><p>As of Wednesday, more than 13.8 million Americans have tested positive for coronavirus and over 272,400 have died, according to data compiled by <a href=\"https://gisanddata.maps.arcgis.com/apps/opsdashboard/index.html#/bda7594740fd40299423467b48e9ecf6\">Johns Hopkins University</a>. Texas, the second worst-hit state in the US, has surpassed 1.25 million cases and 22,100 deaths.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a 2020 21:12:58
